content: 1 The vision of Isaiah､ son of Amoz, which he saw, concerning Judah and Jerusalem,—in the days of Uzziah､ Jotham､ Ahaz､ Hezekiah､—kings of Judah.
content_old: 1 The vision of Isaiah､ son of Amoz, which he saw, concerning Judah and Jerusalem,—in the days of Uzziah､ Jotham､ Ahaz､ Hezekiah､—kings of Judah.

content: 2 Hear､ O heavens, And give ear､ O earth, for Yahweh hath spoken:— Sons have I brought up､ and advanced, And they have rebelled against me.
content_old: 2 Hear､ O heavens, And give ear､ O earth, for Yahweh hath spoken:— Sons have I brought up､ and advanced, And they have rebelled against me.

content: 3 An ox knoweth his owner, And an ass his master’s crib,— Israel doth not know, My people doth not consider.
content_old: 3 An ox knoweth his owner, And an ass his master’s crib,— Israel doth not know, My people doth not consider.

content: 4 Alas! a nation—committing sin､ a people—burdened with iniquity, a seed—practising wickedness, sons—acting corruptly. They have forsaken Yahweh､ despised the Holy One of Israel,— Are estranged and gone back.
content_old: 4 Alas! a nation—committing sin､ a people—burdened with iniquity, a seed—practising wickedness, sons—acting corruptly. They have forsaken Yahweh､ despised the Holy One of Israel,— Are estranged and gone back.

content: 5 Why should ye be smitten any more? Ye would again turn aside! The whole head is sick, And the whole heart faint:
content_old: 5 Why should ye be smitten any more? Ye would again turn aside! The whole head is sick, And the whole heart faint:

content: 6 From the sole of the foot､ even unto the head there is in it no soundness, Bruise and stripe and newly-made wound,— They have not been pressed out､ nor bound up, nor soothed with oil.
content_old: 6 From the sole of the foot､ even unto the head there is in it no soundness, Bruise and stripe and newly-made wound,— They have not been pressed out､ nor bound up, nor soothed with oil.

content: 7 Your country—is a desolation, Your cities— are consumed with fire,— Your soil—right before your eyes foreigners are devouring it, And it is a desolation､ a very overthrow by foreigners;
content_old: 7 Your country—is a desolation, Your cities— are consumed with fire,— Your soil—right before your eyes foreigners are devouring it, And it is a desolation､ a very overthrow by foreigners;

content: 8 And left is the Daughter of Zion､ Like a hut in a vineyard,— Like a lodge in a gourd-plot､ Like a city besieged.
content_old: 8 And left is the Daughter of Zion､ Like a hut in a vineyard,— Like a lodge in a gourd-plot､ Like a city besieged.

content: 9 If Yahweh of hosts had not left as a very small remnant Like Sodom had we become, Gomorrah had we resembled.
content_old: 9 If Yahweh of hosts had not left as a very small remnant Like Sodom had we become, Gomorrah had we resembled.

content: 10 Hear the word of Yahweh､ ye rulers of Sodom,— Give ear to the instruction of our God､ ye people of Gomorrah:—
content_old: 10 Hear the word of Yahweh､ ye rulers of Sodom,— Give ear to the instruction of our God､ ye people of Gomorrah:—

content: 11 Of what use to me is your multitude of sacrifices? Saith Yahweh: I am sated with ascending-offerings of rams､ and the fat of fed beasts,— In the blood of bulls and young rams and he-goats have I no pleasure.
content_old: 11 Of what use to me is your multitude of sacrifices? Saith Yahweh: I am sated with ascending-offerings of rams､ and the fat of fed beasts,— In the blood of bulls and young rams and he-goats have I no pleasure.

content: 12 When ye enter to see my face Who hath required this at your hand､ trampling my courts?
content_old: 12 When ye enter to see my face Who hath required this at your hand､ trampling my courts?

content: 13 Ye shall not again bring in an empty present, Incense an abomination is that unto me! New moon､ and sabbath､ calling an assembly— I cannot endure iniquity and sacred festival!
content_old: 13 Ye shall not again bring in an empty present, Incense an abomination is that unto me! New moon､ and sabbath､ calling an assembly— I cannot endure iniquity and sacred festival!

content: 14 Your new moons､ and your appointed feasts my soul hateth,— They have become unto me a burden I am too weary to bear:
content_old: 14 Your new moons､ and your appointed feasts my soul hateth,— They have become unto me a burden I am too weary to bear:

content: 15 Even when ye spread forth your open palms I hide mine eyes from you; Yea though ye multiply prayers I am not hearkening,— Your hands with deeds of blood are filled.
content_old: 15 Even when ye spread forth your open palms I hide mine eyes from you; Yea though ye multiply prayers I am not hearkening,— Your hands with deeds of blood are filled.

content: 16 Wash you､ make you clean, Put away the wickedness of your doings from before mine eyes,— Cease to do evil.
content_old: 16 Wash you､ make you clean, Put away the wickedness of your doings from before mine eyes,— Cease to do evil.

content: 17 Learn to do well— Seek justice､ Correct the oppressor,— Vindicate the fatherless, Plead the cause of the widow.
content_old: 17 Learn to do well— Seek justice､ Correct the oppressor,— Vindicate the fatherless, Plead the cause of the widow.

content: 18 Come､ I pray you､ and let us settle the dispute､ Saith Yahweh,— Though your sins be found like scarlet As snow shall they be made white, Though they appear red like crimson As wool shall they become.
content_old: 18 Come､ I pray you､ and let us settle the dispute､ Saith Yahweh,— Though your sins be found like scarlet As snow shall they be made white, Though they appear red like crimson As wool shall they become.

content: 19 If ye be willing—and hearken Of the good of the land shall ye eat;
content_old: 19 If ye be willing—and hearken Of the good of the land shall ye eat;

content: 20 But if ye refuse and rebel With the sword shall ye be devoured, For the mouth of Yahweh hath spoken it.
content_old: 20 But if ye refuse and rebel With the sword shall ye be devoured, For the mouth of Yahweh hath spoken it.

content: 21 How hath she become unchaste!— The city that was Faithful,— Full of justice､ Righteousness lodged in her, But now murderers!
content_old: 21 How hath she become unchaste!— The city that was Faithful,— Full of justice､ Righteousness lodged in her, But now murderers!

content: 22 Thy silver hath become dross,— Thy wine weakened with water;
content_old: 22 Thy silver hath become dross,— Thy wine weakened with water;

content: 23 Thy rulers are unruly､ and companions of thieves, Every one of the people loveth a bribe, and runneth after rewards,— The fatherless they do not vindicate, And the plea of the widow reacheth them not.
content_old: 23 Thy rulers are unruly､ and companions of thieves, Every one of the people loveth a bribe, and runneth after rewards,— The fatherless they do not vindicate, And the plea of the widow reacheth them not.

content: 24 Therefore Declareth the Lord､ Yahweh of hosts, The Mighty One of Israel,— Alas! I must appease me on mine adversaries, I must avenge me on mine enemies;
content_old: 24 Therefore Declareth the Lord､ Yahweh of hosts, The Mighty One of Israel,— Alas! I must appease me on mine adversaries, I must avenge me on mine enemies;

content: 25 That I may turn my hand against thee, And smelt away､ as with potash､ thy dross, And remove all thine alloy;
content_old: 25 That I may turn my hand against thee, And smelt away､ as with potash､ thy dross, And remove all thine alloy;

content: 26 That I may restore thy Judges､ as at the first, and thy Counsellors､ as at the beginning,— After that shalt thou be called Righteous citadel, Trusty city,—
content_old: 26 That I may restore thy Judges､ as at the first, and thy Counsellors､ as at the beginning,— After that shalt thou be called Righteous citadel, Trusty city,—

content: 27 Zion with justice shall be redeemed,— And her returning ones with righteousness;
content_old: 27 Zion with justice shall be redeemed,— And her returning ones with righteousness;

content: 28 And the downfall of transgressors and sinners shall be together,�� And they who forsake Yahweh shall be brought to an end;
content_old: 28 And the downfall of transgressors and sinners shall be together,�� And they who forsake Yahweh shall be brought to an end;

content: 29 For they shall turn pale on account of the oaks which ye desired,— And ye shall blush on account of the gardens which ye had chosen;
content_old: 29 For they shall turn pale on account of the oaks which ye desired,— And ye shall blush on account of the gardens which ye had chosen;

content: 30 For ye shall be as an oak with its leaf faded, And as a garden that hath no water;
content_old: 30 For ye shall be as an oak with its leaf faded, And as a garden that hath no water;

content: 1 That which Isaiah､ son of Amoz､ saw in vision,—concerning Judah and Jerusalem.
content_old: 1 That which Isaiah､ son of Amoz､ saw in vision,—concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

content: 2 But it shall come to pass､ in the afterpart of the days､ That the mountain of the house of Yahweh Shall be set up as the head of the mountains, And be exalted above the hills,— And all the nations shall stream thereunto;
content_old: 2 But it shall come to pass､ in the afterpart of the days､ That the mountain of the house of Yahweh Shall be set up as the head of the mountains, And be exalted above the hills,— And all the nations shall stream thereunto;

content: 3 And many peoples shall go､ and say— Come ye､ and let us ascend Unto the mountain of Yahweh､ Unto the house of the God of Jacob, That he may teach us of his ways, And we may walk in his paths,— For out of Zion shall go forth a law, And the word of Yahweh out of Jerusalem;
content_old: 3 And many peoples shall go､ and say— Come ye､ and let us ascend Unto the mountain of Yahweh､ Unto the house of the God of Jacob, That he may teach us of his ways, And we may walk in his paths,— For out of Zion shall go forth a law, And the word of Yahweh out of Jerusalem;

content: 4 And he will judge between the nations, And be umpire to many peoples,— And they will beat their swords into ploughshares､ and their spears into pruning-hooks, Nation— against nation shall not lift up sword, Neither shall they learn any more to make war.
content_old: 4 And he will judge between the nations, And be umpire to many peoples,— And they will beat their swords into ploughshares､ and their spears into pruning-hooks, Nation— against nation shall not lift up sword, Neither shall they learn any more to make war.

content: 5 O house of Jacob! come ye､ and let us walk in the light of Yahweh.
content_old: 5 O house of Jacob! come ye､ and let us walk in the light of Yahweh.

content: 6 Therefore hast thou abandoned thy people､ the house of Jacob, Because they have become full of the East, And use hidden arts､ like the Philistines,— And with the children of foreigners strike hands;—
content_old: 6 Therefore hast thou abandoned thy people､ the house of Jacob, Because they have become full of the East, And use hidden arts､ like the Philistines,— And with the children of foreigners strike hands;—

content: 7 So that filled is their land with silver and gold, And there is no end to their treasures,— And filled is their land with horses, And there is no end to their chariots;
content_old: 7 So that filled is their land with silver and gold, And there is no end to their treasures,— And filled is their land with horses, And there is no end to their chariots;

content: 8 And filled is their land with idols,— To the work of their own hands do they bow themselves down, To that which they made with their own fingers.
content_old: 8 And filled is their land with idols,— To the work of their own hands do they bow themselves down, To that which they made with their own fingers.

content: 9 So the mean man boweth down､ And the great man stoopeth low,— Therefore do not thou forgive them!
content_old: 9 So the mean man boweth down､ And the great man stoopeth low,— Therefore do not thou forgive them!

content: 10 Enter into the rock, Or hide thee in the dust,— Because of the terribleness of Yahweh, And for his majestic splendour.
content_old: 10 Enter into the rock, Or hide thee in the dust,— Because of the terribleness of Yahweh, And for his majestic splendour.

content: 11 The lofty looks of mean men shall be humbled, And the haughtiness of great men shall be bowed down,— And Yahweh alone shall be exalted in that day
content_old: 11 The lofty looks of mean men shall be humbled, And the haughtiness of great men shall be bowed down,— And Yahweh alone shall be exalted in that day

content: 12 For a day of Yahweh of hosts shall be— Upon every one who is high and lofty,— And upon every one who is lifted up､ And he shall be brought low;
content_old: 12 For a day of Yahweh of hosts shall be— Upon every one who is high and lofty,— And upon every one who is lifted up､ And he shall be brought low;

content: 13 And upon all cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up,— And upon all the oaks of Bashan;
content_old: 13 And upon all cedars of Lebanon, that are high and lifted up,— And upon all the oaks of Bashan;

content: 14 And upon all the lofty mountains,— And upon all the uplifted hills;
content_old: 14 And upon all the lofty mountains,— And upon all the uplifted hills;

content: 15 And upon every high tower,— And upon every fortress wall;
content_old: 15 And upon every high tower,— And upon every fortress wall;

content: 16 And upon all the ships of Tarshish,— And upon all desirable banners.
content_old: 16 And upon all the ships of Tarshish,— And upon all desirable banners.

content: 17 And the haughtiness of mean men shall be humbled,— And the loftiness of great men shall be laid low,— And Yahweh alone shall be exalted in that day.
content_old: 17 And the haughtiness of mean men shall be humbled,— And the loftiness of great men shall be laid low,— And Yahweh alone shall be exalted in that day.

content: 18 And the idols shall wholly pass away;
content_old: 18 And the idols shall wholly pass away;

content: 19 And they shall enter into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of clay,— Because of the terribleness of Yahweh､ And for his majestic splendour, When he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.
content_old: 19 And they shall enter into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of clay,— Because of the terribleness of Yahweh､ And for his majestic splendour, When he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

content: 20 In that day shall the son of earth cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold,—which had been made for him to worship, into the hole of the mice､ and to the bats;
content_old: 20 In that day shall the son of earth cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold,—which had been made for him to worship, into the hole of the mice､ and to the bats;

content: 21 That he may enter into the clefts of the rocks, and into the fissures of the crags,— Because of the terribleness of Yahweh､ And for his majestic splendour, When he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.
content_old: 21 That he may enter into the clefts of the rocks, and into the fissures of the crags,— Because of the terribleness of Yahweh､ And for his majestic splendour, When he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

content: 1 For lo! the Lord､ Yahweh of hosts removing from Jerusalem and from Judah, The stay and staff,— The whole stay of bread, And the whole stay of water:
content_old: 1 For lo! the Lord､ Yahweh of hosts removing from Jerusalem and from Judah, The stay and staff,— The whole stay of bread, And the whole stay of water:

content: 2 Man of might､ and man of war,— Judge and prophet､ And diviner and elder;
content_old: 2 Man of might､ and man of war,— Judge and prophet､ And diviner and elder;

content: 3 Captain of fifty､ and favourite; And counsellor､ and skilled artificer､ And master of magical formulas;
content_old: 3 Captain of fifty､ and favourite; And counsellor､ and skilled artificer､ And master of magical formulas;

content: 4 And I will appoint boys to be their princes,— And petulant children shall rule over them.
content_old: 4 And I will appoint boys to be their princes,— And petulant children shall rule over them.

content: 5 And the people will tyrannise Every man over his fellow-man､ And every man over his friend,— And they will rage The boy against the elder, And the despised against the honourable.
content_old: 5 And the people will tyrannise Every man over his fellow-man､ And every man over his friend,— And they will rage The boy against the elder, And the despised against the honourable.

content: 6 When a man shall lay hold on his brother､ of the house of his father, saying— Clothing hast thou, Become thou our ruler,— This downfall be under thy hand
content_old: 6 When a man shall lay hold on his brother､ of the house of his father, saying— Clothing hast thou, Become thou our ruler,— This downfall be under thy hand

content: 7 He will swear､ in that day､ saying— I will take no control, When in mine own house is neither food nor clothing,— Ye must not set me for a ruler of people!
content_old: 7 He will swear､ in that day､ saying— I will take no control, When in mine own house is neither food nor clothing,— Ye must not set me for a ruler of people!

content: 8 For stumbled hath Jerusalem, and Judah hath fallen,— Because their tongue and their doings are against Yahweh, Provoking his glorious presence.
content_old: 8 For stumbled hath Jerusalem, and Judah hath fallen,— Because their tongue and their doings are against Yahweh, Provoking his glorious presence.

content: 9 The show of their face hath answered against them, And their sin—like Sodom have they told､ they have not concealed it. Alas for their souls! For they have requited to themselves calamity.
content_old: 9 The show of their face hath answered against them, And their sin—like Sodom have they told､ they have not concealed it. Alas for their souls! For they have requited to themselves calamity.

content: 10 Say ye to the righteous､ It is well! For the fruit of their doings shall they eat:
content_old: 10 Say ye to the righteous､ It is well! For the fruit of their doings shall they eat:

content: 11 Alas! for the lawless it is ill, For what his own hand hath matured shall be done to him.
content_old: 11 Alas! for the lawless it is ill, For what his own hand hath matured shall be done to him.

content: 12 My people! children are their tyrants, And women rule over them,— My people! they who should lead thee forward are causing thee to stray, Thy pathways have they destroyed.
content_old: 12 My people! children are their tyrants, And women rule over them,— My people! they who should lead thee forward are causing thee to stray, Thy pathways have they destroyed.

content: 13 Yahweh hath taken his station to plead,— And is standing to judge peoples:
content_old: 13 Yahweh hath taken his station to plead,— And is standing to judge peoples:

content: 14 Yahweh into judgment will enter, With the elders of his people､ And their princes,— But ye have consumed the vineyard, That which hath been robbed from the oppressed is in your houses.
content_old: 14 Yahweh into judgment will enter, With the elders of his people､ And their princes,— But ye have consumed the vineyard, That which hath been robbed from the oppressed is in your houses.

content: 15 What right have ye to crush my people, And the faces of the oppressed to grind? Demandeth My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts—
content_old: 15 What right have ye to crush my people, And the faces of the oppressed to grind? Demandeth My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts—

content: 16 And Yahweh saith— Because haughty are the daughters of Zion, And they walk with neck thrown back, and wanton eyes,— Tripping along as they go, And with their feet making a tinkling sound
content_old: 16 And Yahweh saith— Because haughty are the daughters of Zion, And they walk with neck thrown back, and wanton eyes,— Tripping along as they go, And with their feet making a tinkling sound

content: 17 Therefore will My Lord smite with leprosy the crown of hair of the daughters of Zion,— And as for Yahweh their shame will he lay bare!
content_old: 17 Therefore will My Lord smite with leprosy the crown of hair of the daughters of Zion,— And as for Yahweh their shame will he lay bare!

content: 18 In that day will My Lord remove the finery—of the anklets, and the little suns､ and the little moons;
content_old: 18 In that day will My Lord remove the finery—of the anklets, and the little suns､ and the little moons;

content: 19 the pendants､ and the bracelets､ and the veils;
content_old: 19 the pendants､ and the bracelets､ and the veils;

content: 20 the chaplets､ and the armlets､ and the girdles, and the scent-cases､ and the amulets;
content_old: 20 the chaplets､ and the armlets､ and the girdles, and the scent-cases､ and the amulets;

content: 21 the rings､ and the nose-jewels;
content_old: 21 the rings､ and the nose-jewels;

content: 22 the robes､ and the over-tunics, and the cloaks､ and the purses;
content_old: 22 the robes､ and the over-tunics, and the cloaks､ and the purses;

content: 23 and the mirrors､ and the linen wraps, and the tiaras､ and the cloaks.
content_old: 23 and the mirrors､ and the linen wraps, and the tiaras､ and the cloaks.

content: 24 And it shall come to pass— That instead of fragrance a putrid odour shall be､ And instead of a girdle an encircling rope､ And instead of braided hair baldness, And instead of a festal robe a girding of sackcloth, Branding instead of beauty:
content_old: 24 And it shall come to pass— That instead of fragrance a putrid odour shall be､ And instead of a girdle an encircling rope､ And instead of braided hair baldness, And instead of a festal robe a girding of sackcloth, Branding instead of beauty:

content: 25 Thy males by the sword shall fall,— And thy mighty men by the war;
content_old: 25 Thy males by the sword shall fall,— And thy mighty men by the war;

content: 1 And seven women will take hold of one man､ in that day､ saying, Our own bread will we eat, And our own apparel will we wear,— Only let us be called by thy name, to take away our reproach.
content_old: 1 And seven women will take hold of one man､ in that day､ saying, Our own bread will we eat, And our own apparel will we wear,— Only let us be called by thy name, to take away our reproach.

content: 2 In that day Shall the Bud of Yahweh become beautiful and glorious,— And the Fruit of the Land splendid and majestic, To the escaped of Israel.
content_old: 2 In that day Shall the Bud of Yahweh become beautiful and glorious,— And the Fruit of the Land splendid and majestic, To the escaped of Israel.

content: 3 And it shall come to pass— He that is left in Zion And he that remaineth in Jerusalem Shall be called holy,— Everyone written unto life､ in Jerusalem.
content_old: 3 And it shall come to pass— He that is left in Zion And he that remaineth in Jerusalem Shall be called holy,— Everyone written unto life､ in Jerusalem.

content: 4 When My Lord shall have bathed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, And the blood-guiltiness of Jerusalem he shall wash away out of her midst,— By the spirit of judgment, and By the spirit of thorough cleansing
content_old: 4 When My Lord shall have bathed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, And the blood-guiltiness of Jerusalem he shall wash away out of her midst,— By the spirit of judgment, and By the spirit of thorough cleansing

content: 5 Then will Yahweh create— Over all the home of Mount Zion and Over her assembly A cloud by day､ and a smoke, And the shining of a fire-flame､ by night,— For over all the glory shall be a canopy;
content_old: 5 Then will Yahweh create— Over all the home of Mount Zion and Over her assembly A cloud by day､ and a smoke, And the shining of a fire-flame､ by night,— For over all the glory shall be a canopy;

content: 1 Let me sing､ I pray you､ for a well-beloved of mine, The song of my beloved､ concerning his vineyard:— A vineyard had my well-beloved､ on a very fruitful hill;
content_old: 1 Let me sing､ I pray you､ for a well-beloved of mine, The song of my beloved､ concerning his vineyard:— A vineyard had my well-beloved､ on a very fruitful hill;

content: 2 And he thoroughly digged it､ And gathered out the stones thereof､ And planted it with a precious vine, And built a tower in the midst thereof, Moreover also a wine-press hewed he therein,— Then waited he､ that it should bring forth grapes. And it brought foith wild grapes:
content_old: 2 And he thoroughly digged it､ And gathered out the stones thereof､ And planted it with a precious vine, And built a tower in the midst thereof, Moreover also a wine-press hewed he therein,— Then waited he､ that it should bring forth grapes. And it brought foith wild grapes:

content: 3 Now therefore､ O inhabitant of Jerusalem､ And men of Judah,— Judge､ I pray you､ betwixt me､ and my vineyard:—
content_old: 3 Now therefore､ O inhabitant of Jerusalem､ And men of Judah,— Judge､ I pray you､ betwixt me､ and my vineyard:—

content: 4 What could have been done further to my vineyard, That I had not done in it? Why then— When I had waited that it should bring forth grapes Brought it forth wild grapes?
content_old: 4 What could have been done further to my vineyard, That I had not done in it? Why then— When I had waited that it should bring forth grapes Brought it forth wild grapes?

content: 5 Now therefore､ I pray you､ let me tell you what I am about to do to my vineyard,— To take away the fence thereof､ And it shall be eaten up, To destroy the wall thereof､ And it shall be trodden down;
content_old: 5 Now therefore､ I pray you､ let me tell you what I am about to do to my vineyard,— To take away the fence thereof､ And it shall be eaten up, To destroy the wall thereof､ And it shall be trodden down;

content: 6 And I will make it a waste;— It shall be neither pruned nor hoed, But there shall come up briars and thorns,— And upon the clouds will I lay a charge, That they rain thereon no rain.
content_old: 6 And I will make it a waste;— It shall be neither pruned nor hoed, But there shall come up briars and thorns,— And upon the clouds will I lay a charge, That they rain thereon no rain.

content: 7 Surely the vineyard of Yahweh of hosts is the house of Israel, And the men of Judah are the plantation in which he dearly delighted,— And he waited For equity but lo! murderous iniquity, For the rule of rights､ but lo! the cry of the wronged .
content_old: 7 Surely the vineyard of Yahweh of hosts is the house of Israel, And the men of Judah are the plantation in which he dearly delighted,— And he waited For equity but lo! murderous iniquity, For the rule of rights､ but lo! the cry of the wronged .

content: 8 Alas! for them who join house to house, Field to field bring they near,— Until there is no room, But ye are left to dwell alone in the midst of the land.
content_old: 8 Alas! for them who join house to house, Field to field bring they near,— Until there is no room, But ye are left to dwell alone in the midst of the land.

content: 9 In mine ears said Yahweh of hosts,— Verily houses in abundance shall become a desolation, Large and fair､ without inhabitant;
content_old: 9 In mine ears said Yahweh of hosts,— Verily houses in abundance shall become a desolation, Large and fair､ without inhabitant;

content: 10 For ten yokes of vineyard shall yield one bath,— And the seed of a homer shall yield an ephah.
content_old: 10 For ten yokes of vineyard shall yield one bath,— And the seed of a homer shall yield an ephah.

content: 11 Alas! for them who rise early in the morning that strong drink they may pursue,— Who follow on in the evening cool､ until with wine they are heated;
content_old: 11 Alas! for them who rise early in the morning that strong drink they may pursue,— Who follow on in the evening cool､ until with wine they are heated;

content: 12 And it cometh to pass—that lyre and harp､ timbrel and flute､ and wine､ are in their banquets,— But the doing of Yahweh they do not discern, And the work of his hands have they not seen.
content_old: 12 And it cometh to pass—that lyre and harp､ timbrel and flute､ and wine､ are in their banquets,— But the doing of Yahweh they do not discern, And the work of his hands have they not seen.

content: 13 Therefore are my people taken away captive､ before they know it,— And their honourable men are famished with hunger, And their multitude do gape for thirst.
content_old: 13 Therefore are my people taken away captive､ before they know it,— And their honourable men are famished with hunger, And their multitude do gape for thirst.

content: 14 Therefore hath hades enlarged her desire, And opened her mouth to its widest,— And their glory, and their multitude､ and their pomp､ and he that is uproarious､ shall descend thereinto.
content_old: 14 Therefore hath hades enlarged her desire, And opened her mouth to its widest,— And their glory, and their multitude､ and their pomp､ and he that is uproarious､ shall descend thereinto.

content: 15 And the mean man hath been bowed down､ And the mighty man hath been humbled,— Yea the looks of the haughty shall be humbled.
content_old: 15 And the mean man hath been bowed down､ And the mighty man hath been humbled,— Yea the looks of the haughty shall be humbled.

content: 16 But Yahweh of hosts hath been exalted in justice,— And the GOD that is holy hath been hallowed in righteousness;
content_old: 16 But Yahweh of hosts hath been exalted in justice,— And the GOD that is holy hath been hallowed in righteousness;

content: 17 Then shall the young rams feed where they please,— And the wastes of the wealthy shall strangers consume.
content_old: 17 Then shall the young rams feed where they please,— And the wastes of the wealthy shall strangers consume.

content: 18 Alas! for them Who draw on themselves punishment､ with cords of falsehood,— And as with waggon-bands penalty:
content_old: 18 Alas! for them Who draw on themselves punishment､ with cords of falsehood,— And as with waggon-bands penalty:

content: 19 Who say— Let his work quicken—let it hasten､ That we may see,— And let the purpose of Israel’s Holy One draw near and come､ That we may know!
content_old: 19 Who say— Let his work quicken—let it hasten､ That we may see,— And let the purpose of Israel’s Holy One draw near and come､ That we may know!

content: 20 Alas! for them Who call evil good､ and good evil,— Who put darkness for light､ and light for darkness, Who put bitter for sweet､ and sweet for bitter.
content_old: 20 Alas! for them Who call evil good､ and good evil,— Who put darkness for light､ and light for darkness, Who put bitter for sweet､ and sweet for bitter.

content: 21 Alas! for them Who are wise in their own eyes,— And in their own sight are prudent.
content_old: 21 Alas! for them Who are wise in their own eyes,— And in their own sight are prudent.

content: 22 Alas! for them Who are heroes､ to drink wine,— And men of valour､ to mingle strong drink､
content_old: 22 Alas! for them Who are heroes､ to drink wine,— And men of valour､ to mingle strong drink､

content: 23 Who justify the lawless､ for a bribe,— Whereas the righteousness of the righteous they take from him.
content_old: 23 Who justify the lawless､ for a bribe,— Whereas the righteousness of the righteous they take from him.

content: 24 Therefore As a tongue of fire eateth up straw､ And a flame reduceth dry grass to powder Their root like rottenness shall become, And their blossom like dust shall ascend,— Because they refused the law of Yahweh of hosts, And the utterance of the Holy One of Israel they despised.
content_old: 24 Therefore As a tongue of fire eateth up straw､ And a flame reduceth dry grass to powder Their root like rottenness shall become, And their blossom like dust shall ascend,— Because they refused the law of Yahweh of hosts, And the utterance of the Holy One of Israel they despised.

content: 25 For this cause did the anger of Yahweh kindle upon his own people､ And he stretched out his hand against them and smote them— So that the mountains trembled, And their dead bodies served for fuel in the midst of the streets. For all this hath his anger not turned back, But still is his hand outstretched.
content_old: 25 For this cause did the anger of Yahweh kindle upon his own people､ And he stretched out his hand against them and smote them— So that the mountains trembled, And their dead bodies served for fuel in the midst of the streets. For all this hath his anger not turned back, But still is his hand outstretched.

content: 26 Therefore will he lift up an ensign to the nations afar off, And signal for him from the end of the earth,— And lo! with hot haste will he come:
content_old: 26 Therefore will he lift up an ensign to the nations afar off, And signal for him from the end of the earth,— And lo! with hot haste will he come:

content: 27 None shall be weary､ and none shall stumble in his midst, He shall neither slumber､ nor sleep,— Nor shall be loosened､ the girdle of his loins, Nor snapped､ the thong of his sandals:
content_old: 27 None shall be weary､ and none shall stumble in his midst, He shall neither slumber､ nor sleep,— Nor shall be loosened､ the girdle of his loins, Nor snapped､ the thong of his sandals:

content: 28 Whose arrows are sharpened, and all his bows bent,— The hoofs of his horses like flint are accounted, And his wheels are like a storm-wind:
content_old: 28 Whose arrows are sharpened, and all his bows bent,— The hoofs of his horses like flint are accounted, And his wheels are like a storm-wind:

content: 29 A roar hath he､ like a lioness,— He will roar like wild lions— And will growl､ and lay hold on prey, and carry into safety､ and there be none to deliver.
content_old: 29 A roar hath he､ like a lioness,— He will roar like wild lions— And will growl､ and lay hold on prey, and carry into safety､ and there be none to deliver.

content: 1 In the year that King Uzziah died I saw My Lord､ sitting upon a throne､ high and lifted up, and his skirts did fill the temple.
content_old: 1 In the year that King Uzziah died I saw My Lord､ sitting upon a throne､ high and lifted up, and his skirts did fill the temple.

content: 2 Seraphim were standing above him; six wings severally had each one,— With twain he covered his face､ And with twain he covered his feet､ And with twain he did fly.
content_old: 2 Seraphim were standing above him; six wings severally had each one,— With twain he covered his face､ And with twain he covered his feet､ And with twain he did fly.

content: 3 And they continued crying out one to another､ and said, Holy—holy—holy､ is Yahweh of hosts,— The fulness of the whole earth is his glory.
content_old: 3 And they continued crying out one to another､ and said, Holy—holy—holy､ is Yahweh of hosts,— The fulness of the whole earth is his glory.

content: 4 And the foundations of the porch were moved at the voice of him that cried,—and the house was filled with smoke.
content_old: 4 And the foundations of the porch were moved at the voice of him that cried,—and the house was filled with smoke.

content: 5 Then said I— Woe to me!—for I am undone､ Because a man of unclean lips am I, And in the midst of a people of unclean lips do I dwell,— For the King､ Yahweh of hosts have mine eyes seen!
content_old: 5 Then said I— Woe to me!—for I am undone､ Because a man of unclean lips am I, And in the midst of a people of unclean lips do I dwell,— For the King､ Yahweh of hosts have mine eyes seen!

content: 6 Then flew unto me､ one of the seraphim, And in his hand a live coal,— With tongs had he taken it from off the altar.
content_old: 6 Then flew unto me､ one of the seraphim, And in his hand a live coal,— With tongs had he taken it from off the altar.

content: 7 Then touched he my mouth, and said��� Lo! this hath touched thy lips,— Thus shall be taken away､ thine iniquity, And thy sin by propitiation be covered.
content_old: 7 Then touched he my mouth, and said��� Lo! this hath touched thy lips,— Thus shall be taken away､ thine iniquity, And thy sin by propitiation be covered.

content: 8 Then heard I the voice of My Lord､ saying, Whom shall I send? And who will go for us? And I said— Here am I—send me.
content_old: 8 Then heard I the voice of My Lord､ saying, Whom shall I send? And who will go for us? And I said— Here am I—send me.

content: 9 Then said he— Go and say unto this people,— Hear on､ but do not discern, See on､ but do not perceive:
content_old: 9 Then said he— Go and say unto this people,— Hear on､ but do not discern, See on､ but do not perceive:

content: 10 Stupefy thou the heart of this people, And their ears make thou heavy､ And their eyes overspread,— Lest they see with their eyes､ And with their ears should hear, And their heart should discern and come back､ And they be healed.
content_old: 10 Stupefy thou the heart of this people, And their ears make thou heavy､ And their eyes overspread,— Lest they see with their eyes､ And with their ears should hear, And their heart should discern and come back､ And they be healed.

content: 11 Then said I— How long､ My Lord? And he said— Until the time that Cities be wasted through having no inhabitant､ And houses—through having no men, And the ground be laid waste unto desolation;
content_old: 11 Then said I— How long､ My Lord? And he said— Until the time that Cities be wasted through having no inhabitant､ And houses—through having no men, And the ground be laid waste unto desolation;

content: 12 And Yahweh have far removed men,— And great be the abandonment in the midst of the land.
content_old: 12 And Yahweh have far removed men,— And great be the abandonment in the midst of the land.

content: 1 And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz son of Jotham son of Uzziah､ king of Judah that Rezin king of Syria､ and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel､ came up to Jerusalem, to war against it,—but could not prevail against it.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz son of Jotham son of Uzziah､ king of Judah that Rezin king of Syria､ and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel､ came up to Jerusalem, to war against it,—but could not prevail against it.

content: 2 And it was told the house of David､ saying, Syria hath settled down upon Ephraim. Then shook his heart､ and the heart of his people, as the trees of a forest shake before a wind.
content_old: 2 And it was told the house of David､ saying, Syria hath settled down upon Ephraim. Then shook his heart､ and the heart of his people, as the trees of a forest shake before a wind.

content: 3 Then said Yahweh､ unto Isaiah, Go forth､ I pray thee､ to meet Ahaz, thou､ and Shear-jashub thy son,—unto the end of the channel of the upper pool, unto the highway of the fuller’s field;
content_old: 3 Then said Yahweh､ unto Isaiah, Go forth､ I pray thee､ to meet Ahaz, thou､ and Shear-jashub thy son,—unto the end of the channel of the upper pool, unto the highway of the fuller’s field;

content: 4 and say unto him— Take heed and keep thyself calm—do not fear､ neither let thy heart be faint, because of these two fag-ends of smoking firebrands,—in spite of the glow of the anger of Rezin and Syria､ and the son of Remaliah.
content_old: 4 and say unto him— Take heed and keep thyself calm—do not fear､ neither let thy heart be faint, because of these two fag-ends of smoking firebrands,—in spite of the glow of the anger of Rezin and Syria､ and the son of Remaliah.

content: 5 Because Syria hath taken counsel against thee､ for mischief,—with Ephraim and the son of Remaliah､ saying,
content_old: 5 Because Syria hath taken counsel against thee､ for mischief,—with Ephraim and the son of Remaliah､ saying,

content: 6 Let us go up against Judah､ and besiege it, and break it open､ for ourselves,—and set up a king in the midst thereof, even the son of Tabeal
content_old: 6 Let us go up against Judah､ and besiege it, and break it open､ for ourselves,—and set up a king in the midst thereof, even the son of Tabeal

content: 7 Thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh,— It shall not stand､ Neither shall it come to pass!
content_old: 7 Thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh,— It shall not stand､ Neither shall it come to pass!

content: 8 For though the head of Syria is Damascus, And the head of Damascus is Rezin Yet within threescore and five years more shall Ephraim be broken､ that it shall not be a people;
content_old: 8 For though the head of Syria is Damascus, And the head of Damascus is Rezin Yet within threescore and five years more shall Ephraim be broken､ that it shall not be a people;

content: 9 Even though the head of Ephraim is Samaria, And the head of Samaria is the son of Remaliah. If ye trust not Surely ye cannot be trusted!
content_old: 9 Even though the head of Ephraim is Samaria, And the head of Samaria is the son of Remaliah. If ye trust not Surely ye cannot be trusted!

content: 10 And again spake Yahweh unto Ahaz､ saying—
content_old: 10 And again spake Yahweh unto Ahaz､ saying—

content: 11 Ask thee a sign, of Yahweh thy God,— Go down deep for a request, Or ascend on high!
content_old: 11 Ask thee a sign, of Yahweh thy God,— Go down deep for a request, Or ascend on high!

content: 12 But Ahaz said,— I will not ask､ Nor will I put Yahweh to the proof.
content_old: 12 But Ahaz said,— I will not ask､ Nor will I put Yahweh to the proof.

content: 13 Then said he— Hear､ I pray you､ O house of David! Is it too little for you to weary men, that ye must weary even my God?
content_old: 13 Then said he— Hear､ I pray you､ O house of David! Is it too little for you to weary men, that ye must weary even my God?

content: 14 Wherefore let My Lord Himself give you a sign,— Lo! a Virgin being with child and giving birth to a son thou wilt call his name Immanuel.
content_old: 14 Wherefore let My Lord Himself give you a sign,— Lo! a Virgin being with child and giving birth to a son thou wilt call his name Immanuel.

content: 15 Curds and honey shall he eat, by the time that he knoweth to refuse the bad and choose the good;
content_old: 15 Curds and honey shall he eat, by the time that he knoweth to refuse the bad and choose the good;

content: 16 for before the boy knoweth to refuse the bad and choose the good forsaken shall be the land､ at which thou art alarmed､ of the presence of both her kings.
content_old: 16 for before the boy knoweth to refuse the bad and choose the good forsaken shall be the land､ at which thou art alarmed､ of the presence of both her kings.

content: 17 Yahweh will bring upon thee､ and upon thy people､ and upon the house of thy father､ days which have not come, from the day when Ephraim departed from Judah,—even the king of Assyria.
content_old: 17 Yahweh will bring upon thee､ and upon thy people､ and upon the house of thy father､ days which have not come, from the day when Ephraim departed from Judah,—even the king of Assyria.

content: 18 And it shall come to pass in that day that Yahweh will give a signal— To the fly that is in the uttermost part of the Nile-canals of Egypt, And to the bee that is in the land of Assyria.
content_old: 18 And it shall come to pass in that day that Yahweh will give a signal— To the fly that is in the uttermost part of the Nile-canals of Egypt, And to the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

content: 19 And they shall all of them come and settle down— In the desolate torrent-valleys, And in the rents of the crags,— And on all the thorn-bushes, And on all the pastures.
content_old: 19 And they shall all of them come and settle down— In the desolate torrent-valleys, And in the rents of the crags,— And on all the thorn-bushes, And on all the pastures.

content: 20 In that day will My Lord shave with a hired razor even with them of the lands over the River “Euphrates” ､ with the king of Aasyria the head､ and the hair of the feet,—yea even the beard will it sweep off.
content_old: 20 In that day will My Lord shave with a hired razor even with them of the lands over the River “Euphrates” ､ with the king of Aasyria the head､ and the hair of the feet,—yea even the beard will it sweep off.

content: 21 And it shall come to pass､ in that day that a man shall keep alive a young cow､ and two sheep.
content_old: 21 And it shall come to pass､ in that day that a man shall keep alive a young cow､ and two sheep.

content: 22 Yea it shall come to pass for the abundance of the yield of milk that he shall eat curds,—for curds and honey shall every one eat､ that is left in the midst of the land.
content_old: 22 Yea it shall come to pass for the abundance of the yield of milk that he shall eat curds,—for curds and honey shall every one eat､ that is left in the midst of the land.

content: 23 And it shall come to pass in that day that every place wherein there used to be a thousand vines at a thousand pieces of silver—yea even for briars and thorns shall it be.
content_old: 23 And it shall come to pass in that day that every place wherein there used to be a thousand vines at a thousand pieces of silver—yea even for briars and thorns shall it be.

content: 24 With arrows and with a bow shall one come in thither,—for briars and thorns shall be all the land.
content_old: 24 With arrows and with a bow shall one come in thither,—for briars and thorns shall be all the land.

content: 1 And Yahweh said unto me: Take thee a large tablet,—and write thereon､ in plain characters, To Maher-shalal-hash-baz. “Speed-spoil-hurry-prey.”
content_old: 1 And Yahweh said unto me: Take thee a large tablet,—and write thereon､ in plain characters, To Maher-shalal-hash-baz. “Speed-spoil-hurry-prey.”

content: 2 That I may take in attestation, faithful witnesses,—even Uriah the priest, and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah.
content_old: 2 That I may take in attestation, faithful witnesses,—even Uriah the priest, and Zechariah son of Jeberechiah.

content: 3 Then approached I unto the prophetess, and she conceived､ and bare a son,—and Yahweh said unto me, Call his name Maher-shalal-hash-baz.
content_old: 3 Then approached I unto the prophetess, and she conceived､ and bare a son,—and Yahweh said unto me, Call his name Maher-shalal-hash-baz.

content: 4 For before the boy shall have knowledge to cry､ My father! and My mother! the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be carried away before the king of Assyria.
content_old: 4 For before the boy shall have knowledge to cry､ My father! and My mother! the riches of Damascus and the spoil of Samaria shall be carried away before the king of Assyria.

content: 5 And again Yahweh spake unto me yet further saying:
content_old: 5 And again Yahweh spake unto me yet further saying:

content: 6 Because this people hath refused the waters of Shiloah which flow softly,—and are rejoicing with Rezin and the son of Remaliah
content_old: 6 Because this people hath refused the waters of Shiloah which flow softly,—and are rejoicing with Rezin and the son of Remaliah

content: 7 now therefore lo! the Lord is about to bring up against them､ the waters､ strong and many､ of the River , even the king of Assyria､ and all his glory,—and he shall rise over all his channels, and flow over all his banks;
content_old: 7 now therefore lo! the Lord is about to bring up against them､ the waters､ strong and many､ of the River , even the king of Assyria､ and all his glory,—and he shall rise over all his channels, and flow over all his banks;

content: 8 and roll on throughout Judah—overflow and pass along, till unto the neck he shall reach,—and it shall be､ that the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land､ O Immanuel!
content_old: 8 and roll on throughout Judah—overflow and pass along, till unto the neck he shall reach,—and it shall be､ that the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land､ O Immanuel!

content: 9 Rage､ O ye peoples､—and be overthrown, And give ear､ all ye distant parts of the earth,— Gird yourselves and be overthrown, Gird yourselves､ and be overthrown:
content_old: 9 Rage､ O ye peoples､—and be overthrown, And give ear､ all ye distant parts of the earth,— Gird yourselves and be overthrown, Gird yourselves､ and be overthrown:

content: 10 Determine a plan､—and it shall be frustrated,— Speak a word, and it shall not stand, For With-us-is-GOD!
content_old: 10 Determine a plan､—and it shall be frustrated,— Speak a word, and it shall not stand, For With-us-is-GOD!

content: 11 For thus spake Yahweh unto me､ like a firm grasp of the hand,—when he admonished me､ not to walk in the way of this people､ saying:
content_old: 11 For thus spake Yahweh unto me､ like a firm grasp of the hand,—when he admonished me､ not to walk in the way of this people､ saying:

content: 12 Ye shall not say—A confederacy! of everything of which this people may say､ A confederacy! And their fear shall ye not fear or regard as awful:
content_old: 12 Ye shall not say—A confederacy! of everything of which this people may say､ A confederacy! And their fear shall ye not fear or regard as awful:

content: 13 Yahweh of hosts him shall ye hallow,— And let him be your fear､ and let him inspire you with awe;
content_old: 13 Yahweh of hosts him shall ye hallow,— And let him be your fear､ and let him inspire you with awe;

content: 14 So shall he become a hallowed asylum,— But a stone to strike against､ and a rock to stumble over､ unto both houses of Israel､ A trap and a snare to the dweller in Jerusalem;
content_old: 14 So shall he become a hallowed asylum,— But a stone to strike against､ and a rock to stumble over､ unto both houses of Israel､ A trap and a snare to the dweller in Jerusalem;

content: 15 And many shall stumble among them,—and fall and be torn, and snared､ and captured.
content_old: 15 And many shall stumble among them,—and fall and be torn, and snared､ and captured.

content: 16 Bind thou up the testimony,— Seal the instruction amongst my disciples.
content_old: 16 Bind thou up the testimony,— Seal the instruction amongst my disciples.

content: 17 I will therefore long for Yahweh, Who is hiding his face from the house of Jacob,— And will wait for him .
content_old: 17 I will therefore long for Yahweh, Who is hiding his face from the house of Jacob,— And will wait for him .

content: 18 Lo! I and the children whom Yahweh hath given me are for signs and for wonders､ in Israel,—from Yahweh of hosts, who is making his habitation in Mount Zion.
content_old: 18 Lo! I and the children whom Yahweh hath given me are for signs and for wonders､ in Israel,—from Yahweh of hosts, who is making his habitation in Mount Zion.

content: 19 But when they say unto you— Seek ye unto the necromancers and unto the wizards, who chirp､ and who mutter Should not a people seek unto its God? In behalf of the living should it seek unto the dead?
content_old: 19 But when they say unto you— Seek ye unto the necromancers and unto the wizards, who chirp､ and who mutter Should not a people seek unto its God? In behalf of the living should it seek unto the dead?

content: 20 To the law､ and to the testimony! If they speak not according to this word It is because they have no dawning day.
content_old: 20 To the law､ and to the testimony! If they speak not according to this word It is because they have no dawning day.

content: 21 Therefore shall they pass through it､ hard pressed and hungry,— And it shall be when they hunger then will they rage and revile their king and their god､ and turn their faces upwards;
content_old: 21 Therefore shall they pass through it､ hard pressed and hungry,— And it shall be when they hunger then will they rage and revile their king and their god､ and turn their faces upwards;

content: 1 For there is no gloom to her who had been in anguish, In the former time he brought into dishonour The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, In the latter time hath he brought into honour The Lake-way over the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.
content_old: 1 For there is no gloom to her who had been in anguish, In the former time he brought into dishonour The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, In the latter time hath he brought into honour The Lake-way over the Jordan, Galilee of the nations.

content: 2 The people who were walking in darkness Have seen a great light,— The dwellers in a land death-shadowed A light hath shined upon them.
content_old: 2 The people who were walking in darkness Have seen a great light,— The dwellers in a land death-shadowed A light hath shined upon them.

content: 3 Thou hast increased the exultation､ Thou hast made great the joy,— They joy before thee､ according to the joy of harvest, As men exult when they distribute spoil.
content_old: 3 Thou hast increased the exultation､ Thou hast made great the joy,— They joy before thee､ according to the joy of harvest, As men exult when they distribute spoil.

content: 4 For the yoke of their burden､ The cross-bar of their shoulder, The goad of their driver Hast thou broken､ as in the day of Midian.
content_old: 4 For the yoke of their burden､ The cross-bar of their shoulder, The goad of their driver Hast thou broken､ as in the day of Midian.

content: 5 Surely every boot of one tramping in tumult, and the war-cloak rolled in blood Then shall serve for burning､ food for fire;
content_old: 5 Surely every boot of one tramping in tumult, and the war-cloak rolled in blood Then shall serve for burning､ food for fire;

content: 6 For A Child hath been born to us､ A Son hath been given to us, And the dominion is upon his shoulder,— And his Name hath been called Wonderful Counsellor､ Mighty GOD, Father of Futurity､ Prince of Prosperity.
content_old: 6 For A Child hath been born to us､ A Son hath been given to us, And the dominion is upon his shoulder,— And his Name hath been called Wonderful Counsellor､ Mighty GOD, Father of Futurity､ Prince of Prosperity.

content: 7 Of the increase of dominion､ and of prosperity There shall be no end— Upon the throne of David､ and Upon his kingdom, By establishing it､ and By sustaining it, With justice､ and With righteousness,— From henceforth､ Even unto times age-abiding: The jealousy of Yahweh of hosts will perform this!
content_old: 7 Of the increase of dominion､ and of prosperity There shall be no end— Upon the throne of David､ and Upon his kingdom, By establishing it､ and By sustaining it, With justice､ and With righteousness,— From henceforth､ Even unto times age-abiding: The jealousy of Yahweh of hosts will perform this!

content: 8 A word hath My Lord sent unto Jacob,— And it shall alight on Israel;
content_old: 8 A word hath My Lord sent unto Jacob,— And it shall alight on Israel;

content: 9 And the people shall all of them know it— Ephraim and the dweller in Samaria— Who in pride and insolence of heart are saying:
content_old: 9 And the people shall all of them know it— Ephraim and the dweller in Samaria— Who in pride and insolence of heart are saying:

content: 10 Bricks have fallen down､ But with hewn stone will we build,— Sycomoros have been felled, But with cedars will we replace them.
content_old: 10 Bricks have fallen down､ But with hewn stone will we build,— Sycomoros have been felled, But with cedars will we replace them.

content: 11 Therefore will Yahweh strengthen the adversaries of Rezin against him,— And his enemies will he arouse:
content_old: 11 Therefore will Yahweh strengthen the adversaries of Rezin against him,— And his enemies will he arouse:

content: 12 Syrians before､ and Philistines behind, Thus have they devoured Israel with open mouth,— For all this hath his anger not turned back, But still is his hand outstretched.
content_old: 12 Syrians before､ and Philistines behind, Thus have they devoured Israel with open mouth,— For all this hath his anger not turned back, But still is his hand outstretched.

content: 13 Yet the people have not turned unto him that smote them,— And Yahweh of hosts have they not sought.
content_old: 13 Yet the people have not turned unto him that smote them,— And Yahweh of hosts have they not sought.

content: 14 Therefore hath Yahweh cut off from Israel— Head and tail､ Palm-top and rush､ In one day.
content_old: 14 Therefore hath Yahweh cut off from Israel— Head and tail､ Palm-top and rush､ In one day.

content: 15 The elder and favourite he is the head,— And the prophet teaching falsehood he is the tail;
content_old: 15 The elder and favourite he is the head,— And the prophet teaching falsehood he is the tail;

content: 16 And they who should have led this people forward have been causing them to stray,— And they who are led of them are destroyed.
content_old: 16 And they who should have led this people forward have been causing them to stray,— And they who are led of them are destroyed.

content: 17 For this cause over their choice young men will My Lord not rejoice, And on their fatherless and their widows will he not have compassion, For every one of them is profane and an evildoer, And every mouth is speaking baseness,— For all this hath his anger not turned back, But still is his hand outstretched.
content_old: 17 For this cause over their choice young men will My Lord not rejoice, And on their fatherless and their widows will he not have compassion, For every one of them is profane and an evildoer, And every mouth is speaking baseness,— For all this hath his anger not turned back, But still is his hand outstretched.

content: 18 For lawlessness hath consumed like fire, Briars and thorns doth it devour,— Yea it hath kindled upon the thickets of the forest, And they have rolled up､ as a column of smoke.
content_old: 18 For lawlessness hath consumed like fire, Briars and thorns doth it devour,— Yea it hath kindled upon the thickets of the forest, And they have rolled up､ as a column of smoke.

content: 19 Through the wrath of Yahweh of hosts is the land consumed,— And the people have come to be as fuel for fire, A man unto his own brother sheweth not pity;
content_old: 19 Through the wrath of Yahweh of hosts is the land consumed,— And the people have come to be as fuel for fire, A man unto his own brother sheweth not pity;

content: 20 And he hath slain on the right､ and yet is hungry, And hath eaten on the left､ yet are they not satisfied,— Every one the flesh of his own arm will they eat:
content_old: 20 And he hath slain on the right､ and yet is hungry, And hath eaten on the left､ yet are they not satisfied,— Every one the flesh of his own arm will they eat:

content: 1 Alas! for them who ordain iniquitous decrees,— And busy writers who make a business of writing mischief:
content_old: 1 Alas! for them who ordain iniquitous decrees,— And busy writers who make a business of writing mischief:

content: 2 Turning aside from judgment the poor, And robbing of justice the oppressed of my people,— So that widows become their spoil, And of the fatherless they make prey.
content_old: 2 Turning aside from judgment the poor, And robbing of justice the oppressed of my people,— So that widows become their spoil, And of the fatherless they make prey.

content: 3 What､ then､ will ye do for the day of visitation, And for the devastation which from afar shall come? Unto whom will ye flee for help? And where will ye leave your glory?
content_old: 3 What､ then､ will ye do for the day of visitation, And for the devastation which from afar shall come? Unto whom will ye flee for help? And where will ye leave your glory?

content: 4 Without me one hath bowed under a prisoner､ Yea under the slain do they fall! For all this hath his anger not turned back, But still is his hand outstretched.
content_old: 4 Without me one hath bowed under a prisoner､ Yea under the slain do they fall! For all this hath his anger not turned back, But still is his hand outstretched.

content: 5 Alas! for Assyria the rod of mine anger,— Yea the very staff in their hand is my displeasure:
content_old: 5 Alas! for Assyria the rod of mine anger,— Yea the very staff in their hand is my displeasure:

content: 6 Against an irreligious nation will I send him, Yea against the people with whom I am wroth will I command him,— To capture spoil､ And lay hold on prey, And cause them to be trodden down as the mire of the lanes.
content_old: 6 Against an irreligious nation will I send him, Yea against the people with whom I am wroth will I command him,— To capture spoil､ And lay hold on prey, And cause them to be trodden down as the mire of the lanes.

content: 7 But as for him not so doth he deem, And in his heart not so doth he think,— For to destroy is in his heart, And to cut off nations､ not a few;
content_old: 7 But as for him not so doth he deem, And in his heart not so doth he think,— For to destroy is in his heart, And to cut off nations､ not a few;

content: 8 For he saith:— Are not my generals all alike kings?
content_old: 8 For he saith:— Are not my generals all alike kings?

content: 9 Is not Calno like Carchemish? Is not Hamath like Arpad? Is not Samaria like Damascus?
content_old: 9 Is not Calno like Carchemish? Is not Hamath like Arpad? Is not Samaria like Damascus?

content: 10 As my hand hath reached unto the kingdoms of idols,—whose images did excel them of Jerusalem and Samaria
content_old: 10 As my hand hath reached unto the kingdoms of idols,—whose images did excel them of Jerusalem and Samaria

content: 11 Shall I not､ as I have done to Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her images?
content_old: 11 Shall I not､ as I have done to Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her images?

content: 12 Wherefore it shall come to pass—When My Lord shall finish his whole work upon Mount Zion､ and upon Jerusalem I will bring punishment— Upon the fruit of the greatness of heart of the king of Assyria､ And upon the vainglory of his uplifted eyes.
content_old: 12 Wherefore it shall come to pass—When My Lord shall finish his whole work upon Mount Zion､ and upon Jerusalem I will bring punishment— Upon the fruit of the greatness of heart of the king of Assyria､ And upon the vainglory of his uplifted eyes.

content: 13 For he hath said— By the strength of mine own hand have I effectually wrought, And by my wisdom—for I have discernment,— That I might remove the bounds of peoples, Yea their treasures have I plundered､ That I might lay prostrate､ as a mighty one､ the inhabitants;
content_old: 13 For he hath said— By the strength of mine own hand have I effectually wrought, And by my wisdom—for I have discernment,— That I might remove the bounds of peoples, Yea their treasures have I plundered､ That I might lay prostrate､ as a mighty one､ the inhabitants;

content: 14 And my hand hath found as a nest the wealth of the peoples, And as the gathering of eggs that are forsaken all the earth have I gathered,— And there was none to flap a wing, or open a mouth､ or chirp.
content_old: 14 And my hand hath found as a nest the wealth of the peoples, And as the gathering of eggs that are forsaken all the earth have I gathered,— And there was none to flap a wing, or open a mouth､ or chirp.

content: 15 Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? Or the saw magnify itself against him that wieldeth it? As if a rod could wield them who lift it up! As if a staff could raise what is not wood!
content_old: 15 Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? Or the saw magnify itself against him that wieldeth it? As if a rod could wield them who lift it up! As if a staff could raise what is not wood!

content: 16 Therefore shall the Lord､ Yahweh of hosts､ Send among his fat ones leanness, And under his glory shall he kindle a kindling､ like the kindling of fire;
content_old: 16 Therefore shall the Lord､ Yahweh of hosts､ Send among his fat ones leanness, And under his glory shall he kindle a kindling､ like the kindling of fire;

content: 17 So shall the Light of Israel become a fire, And his Holy One a flame, Which shall burn and consume his thorns and his briars､ in one day;
content_old: 17 So shall the Light of Israel become a fire, And his Holy One a flame, Which shall burn and consume his thorns and his briars､ in one day;

content: 18 And the glory of his forest and of his garden land, both soul and body shall it bring to an end,— And it shall be like the wasting away of a consumptive.
content_old: 18 And the glory of his forest and of his garden land, both soul and body shall it bring to an end,— And it shall be like the wasting away of a consumptive.

content: 19 And the remnant of his forest-trees few in number shall become,—yea a child might describe them!
content_old: 19 And the remnant of his forest-trees few in number shall become,—yea a child might describe them!

content: 20 And it shall come to pass in that day That the remnant of Israel､ And the escaped of the house of Jacob､ Shall no more again lean upon him that smote them,— But shall lean upon Yahweh､ the Holy One of Israel､ in truth.
content_old: 20 And it shall come to pass in that day That the remnant of Israel､ And the escaped of the house of Jacob､ Shall no more again lean upon him that smote them,— But shall lean upon Yahweh､ the Holy One of Israel､ in truth.

content: 21 A remnant shall return､ The remnant of Jacob,—unto the mighty GOD;
content_old: 21 A remnant shall return､ The remnant of Jacob,—unto the mighty GOD;

content: 22 For though thy people､ O Israel､ shall be as the sand of the sea A mere remnant shall return of them,— A full end decreed bringeth in justice like a flood;
content_old: 22 For though thy people､ O Israel､ shall be as the sand of the sea A mere remnant shall return of them,— A full end decreed bringeth in justice like a flood;

content: 23 For a full end and that a decreed one is My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts､ executing in the midst of all the earth.
content_old: 23 For a full end and that a decreed one is My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts､ executing in the midst of all the earth.

content: 24 Therefore､ thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts, Do not fear､ O my people dwelling in Zion､ because of Assyria,— When with his rod he would smite thee, And when his staff he would lift up against thee､ in the manner of Egypt;
content_old: 24 Therefore､ thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts, Do not fear､ O my people dwelling in Zion､ because of Assyria,— When with his rod he would smite thee, And when his staff he would lift up against thee､ in the manner of Egypt;

content: 25 For yet a very little while and displeasure shall end, Yea mine anger over their destruction.
content_old: 25 For yet a very little while and displeasure shall end, Yea mine anger over their destruction.

content: 26 And Yahweh of hosts will brandish over him a scourge��� Like the smiting of Midian､ at the rock Oreb,— And his staff being over the sea He will lift it up in the manner of Egypt;
content_old: 26 And Yahweh of hosts will brandish over him a scourge��� Like the smiting of Midian､ at the rock Oreb,— And his staff being over the sea He will lift it up in the manner of Egypt;

content: 27 And it shall come to pass in that day That his burden shall remove from off thy shoulder, And his yoke from off thy neck,— Yea､ the yoke shall be broken､ because of fatness.
content_old: 27 And it shall come to pass in that day That his burden shall remove from off thy shoulder, And his yoke from off thy neck,— Yea､ the yoke shall be broken､ because of fatness.

content: 28 He hath come in unto Ayyâth､ Hath passed through Migron,— At Michmash storeth his baggage:
content_old: 28 He hath come in unto Ayyâth､ Hath passed through Migron,— At Michmash storeth his baggage:

content: 29 They have passed over the pass, Geba is his halting-place,— Terror-stricken is Ramah, Gibeah of Saul hath fled!
content_old: 29 They have passed over the pass, Geba is his halting-place,— Terror-stricken is Ramah, Gibeah of Saul hath fled!

content: 30 Make shrill thy voice､ O daughter of Gallim! Hearken､ O Laishah; Answer､ O Anathoth!
content_old: 30 Make shrill thy voice､ O daughter of Gallim! Hearken､ O Laishah; Answer､ O Anathoth!

content: 31 Madmenah hath fled,— The inhabitants of Gebim have gone into safety:
content_old: 31 Madmenah hath fled,— The inhabitants of Gebim have gone into safety:

content: 32 While yet to-day､ in Nob､ he tarrieth He brandisheth his hand toward The mount of the daughter of Zion, The hill of Jerusalem.
content_old: 32 While yet to-day､ in Nob､ he tarrieth He brandisheth his hand toward The mount of the daughter of Zion, The hill of Jerusalem.

content: 33 Behold! the Lord､ Yahweh of hosts is about to lop off a tree-crown､ with a crash,— Then shall they who are lifted on high be hewn down, And the lofty be laid low;
content_old: 33 Behold! the Lord､ Yahweh of hosts is about to lop off a tree-crown､ with a crash,— Then shall they who are lifted on high be hewn down, And the lofty be laid low;

content: 1 But there shall come forth a shoot from the stock of Jesse,— And a sprout､ from his roots shall bear fruit;
content_old: 1 But there shall come forth a shoot from the stock of Jesse,— And a sprout､ from his roots shall bear fruit;

content: 2 And the spirit of Yahweh shall rest upon him,— The spirit of wisdom and understanding､ The spirit of counsel and might, The spirit of knowledge､ and reverence of Yahweh;
content_old: 2 And the spirit of Yahweh shall rest upon him,— The spirit of wisdom and understanding､ The spirit of counsel and might, The spirit of knowledge､ and reverence of Yahweh;

content: 3 So will he find fragrance､ in the reverence of Yahweh, And not by the sight of his eyes will he judge, Nor by the hearing of his ears will he decide;
content_old: 3 So will he find fragrance､ in the reverence of Yahweh, And not by the sight of his eyes will he judge, Nor by the hearing of his ears will he decide;

content: 4 But he will judge with righteousness them who are poor, And decide with equity for the oppressed of the land,— And he will smite the land with the sceptre of his mouth, And with the breath of his lips will he slay the lawless one;
content_old: 4 But he will judge with righteousness them who are poor, And decide with equity for the oppressed of the land,— And he will smite the land with the sceptre of his mouth, And with the breath of his lips will he slay the lawless one;

content: 5 And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins､— And faithfulness the girdle of his reins;
content_old: 5 And righteousness shall be the girdle of his loins､— And faithfulness the girdle of his reins;

content: 6 And the wolf shall dwell with the lamb, And the leopard with the kid shall lie down,— And the calf､ and the young lion､ and the fatling—together, With a little child leading them;
content_old: 6 And the wolf shall dwell with the lamb, And the leopard with the kid shall lie down,— And the calf､ and the young lion､ and the fatling—together, With a little child leading them;

content: 7 And the cow with the bear shall find pasture, Together shall their young ones lie down,— And the lion like the ox shall eat straw;
content_old: 7 And the cow with the bear shall find pasture, Together shall their young ones lie down,— And the lion like the ox shall eat straw;

content: 8 And the sucking child shall caress over the hole of the asp, Yea over the viper’s den hath the weaned child stretched out his hand:
content_old: 8 And the sucking child shall caress over the hole of the asp, Yea over the viper’s den hath the weaned child stretched out his hand:

content: 9 They shall not hurt—nor destroy､ in all my holy mountain,— For filled is the land with the knowledge of Yahweh, As the waters to the sea form a covering.
content_old: 9 They shall not hurt—nor destroy､ in all my holy mountain,— For filled is the land with the knowledge of Yahweh, As the waters to the sea form a covering.

content: 10 And there shall come to be in that day A root of Jesse, which shall be standing as an ensign of peoples, Unto him shall nations seek,— And his resting-place shall be glorious.
content_old: 10 And there shall come to be in that day A root of Jesse, which shall be standing as an ensign of peoples, Unto him shall nations seek,— And his resting-place shall be glorious.

content: 11 And it shall come to pass in that day That My Lord will againa second time set his hand, to possess himself of the remnant of his people,—who shall be left—from Assyria and from Egypt､ and from Pathros and from Ethiopia､ and from Elam and from Shinar､ and from Hamath and from the Coastlands of the sea;
content_old: 11 And it shall come to pass in that day That My Lord will againa second time set his hand, to possess himself of the remnant of his people,—who shall be left—from Assyria and from Egypt､ and from Pathros and from Ethiopia､ and from Elam and from Shinar､ and from Hamath and from the Coastlands of the sea;

content: 12 And he will lift up a standard to the nations, And will gather the outcasts of Israel,— And the dispersed of Judah will he collect, From the four corners of the earth.
content_old: 12 And he will lift up a standard to the nations, And will gather the outcasts of Israel,— And the dispersed of Judah will he collect, From the four corners of the earth.

content: 13 And the envy of Ephraim shall be removed, And the vexatious doings of Judah shall be cut off: Ephraim shall not envy Judah, And Judah shall not vex Ephraim;
content_old: 13 And the envy of Ephraim shall be removed, And the vexatious doings of Judah shall be cut off: Ephraim shall not envy Judah, And Judah shall not vex Ephraim;

content: 14 But they shall fly on the wing of the Philistines､ in the west, Together shall they make prey of the sons of the east､— On Edom and Moab putting forth their hand, With the sons of Ammon hearkening unto them.
content_old: 14 But they shall fly on the wing of the Philistines､ in the west, Together shall they make prey of the sons of the east､— On Edom and Moab putting forth their hand, With the sons of Ammon hearkening unto them.

content: 15 And Yahweh will devote to destruction the gulf of the Egyptian sea, And will brandish his hand against the River ､ in the full force of his spirit,— And will smite it in the seven streams､ And cause a marching through in sandals;
content_old: 15 And Yahweh will devote to destruction the gulf of the Egyptian sea, And will brandish his hand against the River ､ in the full force of his spirit,— And will smite it in the seven streams､ And cause a marching through in sandals;

content: 1 Thou shalt say､ therefore､ in that day, I will praise thee､ O Yahweh! Though thou hast been angry with me Thine anger turneth back､ And thou dost comfort me.
content_old: 1 Thou shalt say､ therefore､ in that day, I will praise thee､ O Yahweh! Though thou hast been angry with me Thine anger turneth back､ And thou dost comfort me.

content: 2 Lo GOD is my salvation! I will trust､ and not dread,— For my might and melody is Yah､ Yahweh, And he hath become mine､ by salvation.
content_old: 2 Lo GOD is my salvation! I will trust､ and not dread,— For my might and melody is Yah､ Yahweh, And he hath become mine､ by salvation.

content: 3 Therefore shall ye draw water､ with rejoicing,—out of the fountains of salvation.
content_old: 3 Therefore shall ye draw water､ with rejoicing,—out of the fountains of salvation.

content: 4 And ye shall say in that day, Praise Yahweh､ Call upon his Name, Make known among the peoples､ his doings,— Bring to remembrance､ that exalted is his Name!
content_old: 4 And ye shall say in that day, Praise Yahweh､ Call upon his Name, Make known among the peoples､ his doings,— Bring to remembrance､ that exalted is his Name!

content: 5 Praise in song Yahweh, For a splendid thing hath he done,— Well known is this､ in all the earth.
content_old: 5 Praise in song Yahweh, For a splendid thing hath he done,— Well known is this､ in all the earth.

content: 1 The oracle on Babylon,—of which Isaiah､ son of Amoz､ had vision:—
content_old: 1 The oracle on Babylon,—of which Isaiah､ son of Amoz､ had vision:—

content: 2 Upon a bare mountain lift ye up a standard, Raise high the voice to them,— Wave the hand, That they may enter the doors of nobles.
content_old: 2 Upon a bare mountain lift ye up a standard, Raise high the voice to them,— Wave the hand, That they may enter the doors of nobles.

content: 3 I myself have given charge to my hallowed ones,— Yea I have called My heroes in showing mine anger, My proudly exulting ones.
content_old: 3 I myself have given charge to my hallowed ones,— Yea I have called My heroes in showing mine anger, My proudly exulting ones.

content: 4 The noise of a multitude in the mountains､ A resemblance of many people,— The noise of a tumult of kingdoms､ Nations gathered together, Yahweh of hosts, mustering a host for battle!
content_old: 4 The noise of a multitude in the mountains､ A resemblance of many people,— The noise of a tumult of kingdoms､ Nations gathered together, Yahweh of hosts, mustering a host for battle!

content: 5 They are coming in From a land far away､ From the utmost bound of the heavens,— Yahweh—with his weapons of indignation, To destroy the land.
content_old: 5 They are coming in From a land far away､ From the utmost bound of the heavens,— Yahweh—with his weapons of indignation, To destroy the land.

content: 6 Howl ye! for at hand is the day of Yahweh,— As a veritable destruction from the Almighty shall it come.
content_old: 6 Howl ye! for at hand is the day of Yahweh,— As a veritable destruction from the Almighty shall it come.

content: 7 For this cause— All hands shall hang down,—and Every mortal heart melt.
content_old: 7 For this cause— All hands shall hang down,—and Every mortal heart melt.

content: 8 And they shall be in distress— Writhings and pains shall lay hold, As a woman in childbirth shall they be in pangs,— Every one at his neighbour shall look in amazement, Faces of flames their faces!
content_old: 8 And they shall be in distress— Writhings and pains shall lay hold, As a woman in childbirth shall they be in pangs,— Every one at his neighbour shall look in amazement, Faces of flames their faces!

content: 9 Lo! the day of Yahweh coming in, Fierce and overflowing､ and burning with anger,— To devote the earth to desolation, And her sinners will he destroy out of it.
content_old: 9 Lo! the day of Yahweh coming in, Fierce and overflowing､ and burning with anger,— To devote the earth to desolation, And her sinners will he destroy out of it.

content: 10 For the stars of the heavens､ and their constellations shall not flash forth their light,— Obscured shall be the sun in his going forth, And the moon shall not shed her light.
content_old: 10 For the stars of the heavens､ and their constellations shall not flash forth their light,— Obscured shall be the sun in his going forth, And the moon shall not shed her light.

content: 11 And I will visit upon the inhabited earth calamity, And upon the lawless their punishment,— And will quiet the arrogance of the proud, And the loftiness of tyrants will I lay low.
content_old: 11 And I will visit upon the inhabited earth calamity, And upon the lawless their punishment,— And will quiet the arrogance of the proud, And the loftiness of tyrants will I lay low.

content: 12 I will cause a man to be more precious than fine gold,— Even a son of earth than the finest gold of Ophir.
content_old: 12 I will cause a man to be more precious than fine gold,— Even a son of earth than the finest gold of Ophir.

content: 13 For this cause the heavens will I disturb, And the earth shall tremble out of her place,— In the wrath of Yahweh of hosts, And in the day of the glow of his anger.
content_old: 13 For this cause the heavens will I disturb, And the earth shall tremble out of her place,— In the wrath of Yahweh of hosts, And in the day of the glow of his anger.

content: 14 And it shall be— Like a gazelle that is chased, And like a sheep with none to lift it up,— Each to his own people will they turn, And each to his own land will they flee:
