content_old: 14 And it shall be— Like a gazelle that is chased, And like a sheep with none to lift it up,— Each to his own people will they turn, And each to his own land will they flee:

content: 15 Every one found shall be thrust through,— And every one taken shall fall by the sword;
content_old: 15 Every one found shall be thrust through,— And every one taken shall fall by the sword;

content: 16 And their infants shall be dashed to the ground､ before their eyes,— Plundered shall be their houses, and their wives ravished.
content_old: 16 And their infants shall be dashed to the ground､ before their eyes,— Plundered shall be their houses, and their wives ravished.

content: 17 Behold me! stirring up against them､ the Medes,— Who of silver shall take no account, And as for gold they shall not delight in it;
content_old: 17 Behold me! stirring up against them､ the Medes,— Who of silver shall take no account, And as for gold they shall not delight in it;

content: 18 And bows shall dash the young to pieces,— And on the fruit of the womb will they have no pity, Over children will their eye throw no shield.
content_old: 18 And bows shall dash the young to pieces,— And on the fruit of the womb will they have no pity, Over children will their eye throw no shield.

content: 19 Thus shall Babylon— The most lovely of kingdoms, The majestic beauty of the Chaldees— Become as in the divine overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah.
content_old: 19 Thus shall Babylon— The most lovely of kingdoms, The majestic beauty of the Chaldees— Become as in the divine overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah.

content: 20 It shall not be dwelt in for ever, Neither shall it be inhabited､ from generation to generation,— Neither shall encamp there an Arab, Nor shepherds fold their flocks there.
content_old: 20 It shall not be dwelt in for ever, Neither shall it be inhabited､ from generation to generation,— Neither shall encamp there an Arab, Nor shepherds fold their flocks there.

content: 21 Then shall lie down there､ wild beasts, And filled shall be their houses､ with owls,— Then shall inhabit there､ the ostrich, And shaggy creatures Shall dance there.
content_old: 21 Then shall lie down there､ wild beasts, And filled shall be their houses､ with owls,— Then shall inhabit there､ the ostrich, And shaggy creatures Shall dance there.

content: 1 For Yahweh will have compassion on Jacob､ And will yet choose Israel, And will give them rest upon their own soil,— And the sojourner shall join himself unto them, And they shall attach themselves unto the house of Jacob;
content_old: 1 For Yahweh will have compassion on Jacob､ And will yet choose Israel, And will give them rest upon their own soil,— And the sojourner shall join himself unto them, And they shall attach themselves unto the house of Jacob;

content: 2 And peoples shall take them､ and bring them into their own place, And the house of Israel shall possess themselves of them upon the soil of Yahweh for servants and for handmaids,— Thus shall they be taking captive their captors, And shall tread down their oppressors.
content_old: 2 And peoples shall take them､ and bring them into their own place, And the house of Israel shall possess themselves of them upon the soil of Yahweh for servants and for handmaids,— Thus shall they be taking captive their captors, And shall tread down their oppressors.

content: 3 And it shall come to pass in the day when､ Yahweh shall give thee rest from thy toil､ and from thy disquiet,—and from the hard service which had been laid upon thee
content_old: 3 And it shall come to pass in the day when､ Yahweh shall give thee rest from thy toil､ and from thy disquiet,—and from the hard service which had been laid upon thee

content: 4 that thou shalt take up this taunt over the king of Babylon､ and shalt say:— How hath ceased the oppressor! Ceased the exactress!
content_old: 4 that thou shalt take up this taunt over the king of Babylon､ and shalt say:— How hath ceased the oppressor! Ceased the exactress!

content: 5 Broke hath Yahweh the staff of the lawless,— The sceptre of despots;
content_old: 5 Broke hath Yahweh the staff of the lawless,— The sceptre of despots;

content: 6 Smiting peoples in passion､ With stroke unremitting,— Trampling､ in anger､ on nations, Persecution unhindered.
content_old: 6 Smiting peoples in passion､ With stroke unremitting,— Trampling､ in anger､ on nations, Persecution unhindered.

content: 7 Quiet､ at rest the whole earth,— Men have burst into shouting!
content_old: 7 Quiet､ at rest the whole earth,— Men have burst into shouting!

content: 8 Yea the pine-trees make mirth at thee､ Cedars of Lebanon! Since thou wast laid low No feller hath come up against us!
content_old: 8 Yea the pine-trees make mirth at thee､ Cedars of Lebanon! Since thou wast laid low No feller hath come up against us!

content: 9 Hades､ beneath is excited about thee To meet thine arrival,— Rousing up､ for thee､ Shades, All the he-goats of earth! Maketh rise from their thrones, All the kings of the nations.
content_old: 9 Hades､ beneath is excited about thee To meet thine arrival,— Rousing up､ for thee､ Shades, All the he-goats of earth! Maketh rise from their thrones, All the kings of the nations.

content: 10 All of them answer, and say to thee,— Thou too made strengthless as we! Unto us art thou like!
content_old: 10 All of them answer, and say to thee,— Thou too made strengthless as we! Unto us art thou like!

content: 11 Brought down to Hades thy pride､ The hum of thy harps, Beneath thee is spread out corruption, And thy coverlet—worms!
content_old: 11 Brought down to Hades thy pride､ The hum of thy harps, Beneath thee is spread out corruption, And thy coverlet—worms!

content: 12 How hast thou fallen from heaven､ O Shining One—Son of the Dawn! Hewn down to the earth, O crusher of nations!
content_old: 12 How hast thou fallen from heaven､ O Shining One—Son of the Dawn! Hewn down to the earth, O crusher of nations!

content: 13 Yet thou didst say in thy heart— The heavens will I ascend, Above the stars of GOD will I lift up my throne,— That I may sit in the Mount of Assembly In the Recesses of the North:
content_old: 13 Yet thou didst say in thy heart— The heavens will I ascend, Above the stars of GOD will I lift up my throne,— That I may sit in the Mount of Assembly In the Recesses of the North:

content: 14 I will mount on the hills of the clouds, I will match the Most High!
content_old: 14 I will mount on the hills of the clouds, I will match the Most High!

content: 15 Howbeit to Hades shalt thou be brought down,— To the Recesses of the Pit!
content_old: 15 Howbeit to Hades shalt thou be brought down,— To the Recesses of the Pit!

content: 16 They who see thee upon thee will gaze, Upon thee will thoughtfully muse,— Is this the man who startled the earth? Who terrified kingdoms?
content_old: 16 They who see thee upon thee will gaze, Upon thee will thoughtfully muse,— Is this the man who startled the earth? Who terrified kingdoms?

content: 17 Who made the world like a desert? And its cities brake down? Its prisoners he loosed not､ Each one to his home?
content_old: 17 Who made the world like a desert? And its cities brake down? Its prisoners he loosed not､ Each one to his home?

content: 18 All the kings of the nations—they all are lying in state､ Each one in his crypt;
content_old: 18 All the kings of the nations—they all are lying in state､ Each one in his crypt;

content: 19 But thou art flung out from thy grave､ Like a scion detested, Beshrouded with slain､ the pierced of the sword, Like a carcase trod underfoot:
content_old: 19 But thou art flung out from thy grave､ Like a scion detested, Beshrouded with slain､ the pierced of the sword, Like a carcase trod underfoot:

content: 20 As for them who go down to the stones of the Pit Thou shalt not be united with them in burial; For thy land thou didst ruin､ Thy people didst slay,— Unnamed to times age-abiding Be the seed of the wicked!
content_old: 20 As for them who go down to the stones of the Pit Thou shalt not be united with them in burial; For thy land thou didst ruin､ Thy people didst slay,— Unnamed to times age-abiding Be the seed of the wicked!

content: 21 Prepare—for his sons—shambles､ For the iniquity of their fathers,— They shall not rise､ nor possess the earth, Nor fill the face of the world with cities.
content_old: 21 Prepare—for his sons—shambles､ For the iniquity of their fathers,— They shall not rise､ nor possess the earth, Nor fill the face of the world with cities.

content: 22 I will rise､ then､ against them, Declareth Yahweh of hosts,— And will cut off from Babylon､ Record and remnant､ And scion and seed, Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 22 I will rise､ then､ against them, Declareth Yahweh of hosts,— And will cut off from Babylon､ Record and remnant､ And scion and seed, Declareth Yahweh.

content: 23 And will make her a possession for the bittern､ And marshes of water,— And will sweep it with the besom of destruction, Declareth Yahweh of hosts.
content_old: 23 And will make her a possession for the bittern､ And marshes of water,— And will sweep it with the besom of destruction, Declareth Yahweh of hosts.

content: 24 Yahweh of hosts hath sworn､ saying,— Surely as I intended so hath it come to pass, And as I purposed the same shall stand:—
content_old: 24 Yahweh of hosts hath sworn､ saying,— Surely as I intended so hath it come to pass, And as I purposed the same shall stand:—

content: 25 That I will break in pieces the Assyrian､ in my land, Yea upon my mountains will I tread him underfoot,— So shall be removed from off them､ his yoke, And his burden from off their shoulder shall be removed.
content_old: 25 That I will break in pieces the Assyrian､ in my land, Yea upon my mountains will I tread him underfoot,— So shall be removed from off them､ his yoke, And his burden from off their shoulder shall be removed.

content: 26 This is the purpose that is purposed upon all the earth,— And this the hand outstretched over all the nations;
content_old: 26 This is the purpose that is purposed upon all the earth,— And this the hand outstretched over all the nations;

content: 27 For Yahweh of hosts hath purposed,— And who shall frustrate? And his is the hand outstretched､ And who shall turn it back?
content_old: 27 For Yahweh of hosts hath purposed,— And who shall frustrate? And his is the hand outstretched､ And who shall turn it back?

content: 28 In the year that King Ahaz died came this oracle:—
content_old: 28 In the year that King Ahaz died came this oracle:—

content: 29 Do not rejoice､ Philistia any of thee, In that the rod of him that smote thee is broken,— For out of the root of the serpent shall come forth a viper, And his fruit be a fiery dragon that flieth.
content_old: 29 Do not rejoice､ Philistia any of thee, In that the rod of him that smote thee is broken,— For out of the root of the serpent shall come forth a viper, And his fruit be a fiery dragon that flieth.

content: 30 Then shall feed､ the firstborn of the poor, And the needy in confidence lie down,— And I will kill with famine thy root, And thy residue shall be slain.
content_old: 30 Then shall feed､ the firstborn of the poor, And the needy in confidence lie down,— And I will kill with famine thy root, And thy residue shall be slain.

content: 31 Howl—O gate､ Make outcry—O city, Dispersed art thou､ Philistia all of thee,— For out of the north a smoke cometh in, With no straggler in his ranks.
content_old: 31 Howl—O gate､ Make outcry—O city, Dispersed art thou､ Philistia all of thee,— For out of the north a smoke cometh in, With no straggler in his ranks.

content: 1 The oracle on Moab: Because in a night was laid waste Ar of Moab—destroyed! Because in a night was laid waste Kir of Moab—destroyed
content_old: 1 The oracle on Moab: Because in a night was laid waste Ar of Moab—destroyed! Because in a night was laid waste Kir of Moab—destroyed

content: 2 He hath gone up to Bayith and Dibon､ to the high places､ to weep,— On Nebo and on Medeba Moab is howling, On all their heads a baldness, Every beard clipped.
content_old: 2 He hath gone up to Bayith and Dibon､ to the high places､ to weep,— On Nebo and on Medeba Moab is howling, On all their heads a baldness, Every beard clipped.

content: 3 In their streets have they girded them with sackcloth,— On their housetops､ and in their broadways every one is howling—melting in tears;
content_old: 3 In their streets have they girded them with sackcloth,— On their housetops､ and in their broadways every one is howling—melting in tears;

content: 4 And Heshbon hath made outcry､ and Elealeh, Unto Jahaz hath been heard their voice,— For this cause do the armed men of Moab roar, Every man’s soul quivereth to him.
content_old: 4 And Heshbon hath made outcry､ and Elealeh, Unto Jahaz hath been heard their voice,— For this cause do the armed men of Moab roar, Every man’s soul quivereth to him.

content: 5 Mine own heart for Moab continueth to make outcry, Her fugitive as far as Zoar is like a heifer of three years; For the ascent of Luhith with weeping they ascend, For by the way of Horonaim—an outcry of destruction they excite;
content_old: 5 Mine own heart for Moab continueth to make outcry, Her fugitive as far as Zoar is like a heifer of three years; For the ascent of Luhith with weeping they ascend, For by the way of Horonaim—an outcry of destruction they excite;

content: 6 For the waters of Nimrim shall become desolation,— For grass hath dried up､ Herbage hath failed, Green thing hath not sprung up!
content_old: 6 For the waters of Nimrim shall become desolation,— For grass hath dried up､ Herbage hath failed, Green thing hath not sprung up!

content: 7 For this cause the savings they had made､ and that which they had stored Over the torrent-bed of the willows shall they bear them.
content_old: 7 For this cause the savings they had made､ and that which they had stored Over the torrent-bed of the willows shall they bear them.

content: 8 For the outcry hath gone round the boundary of Moab,— As far as Eglaim the howling thereof, And to Beer-elim the howling thereof.
content_old: 8 For the outcry hath gone round the boundary of Moab,— As far as Eglaim the howling thereof, And to Beer-elim the howling thereof.

content: 1 Send ye the lamb due to the ruler of the land､ From Sela towards the desert,— Unto the mount of the daughter of Zion;
content_old: 1 Send ye the lamb due to the ruler of the land､ From Sela towards the desert,— Unto the mount of the daughter of Zion;

content: 2 Yet shall it be that— Like wandering birds from a nest cast forth Shall be the daughters of Moab, at the fords of Arnon.
content_old: 2 Yet shall it be that— Like wandering birds from a nest cast forth Shall be the daughters of Moab, at the fords of Arnon.

content: 3 Bring thou in counsel､ Execute thou judgment, Make as the night thy shadow､ in the midst of high noon,— Hide thou the outcasts, The wanderer do not thou reveal.
content_old: 3 Bring thou in counsel､ Execute thou judgment, Make as the night thy shadow､ in the midst of high noon,— Hide thou the outcasts, The wanderer do not thou reveal.

content: 4 Let mine own outcasts sojourn with thee, O Moab､ become thou a covert to them､ from the face of the spoiler,— For vanished is the oppressor, At an end is extortion, They who tread down have ceased out of the land.
content_old: 4 Let mine own outcasts sojourn with thee, O Moab､ become thou a covert to them､ from the face of the spoiler,— For vanished is the oppressor, At an end is extortion, They who tread down have ceased out of the land.

content: 5 So shall be established in lovingkindness a throne, And one shall sit thereon in truth in the home of David,— Judging—and seeking justice､ and speeding righteousness.
content_old: 5 So shall be established in lovingkindness a throne, And one shall sit thereon in truth in the home of David,— Judging—and seeking justice､ and speeding righteousness.

content: 6 We have heard of the arrogance of Moab､ Proud exceedingly! His haughtiness and his arrogance and his passion､ Not true are his boastings.
content_old: 6 We have heard of the arrogance of Moab､ Proud exceedingly! His haughtiness and his arrogance and his passion､ Not true are his boastings.

content: 7 Therefore shall Moab howl for Moab､ All that belong to her shall wail,— For the ruins of Kir-hareseth shall they moan out､ Utterly stricken!
content_old: 7 Therefore shall Moab howl for Moab､ All that belong to her shall wail,— For the ruins of Kir-hareseth shall they moan out､ Utterly stricken!

content: 8 For the fields of Heshbon are withered— The vine of Sibmah､ The owners of nations have broken off ruddy branches, Unto Jazer had they reached, They had spread abroad to the desert,— Her boughs had stretched forth､ had gone over to the sea.
content_old: 8 For the fields of Heshbon are withered— The vine of Sibmah､ The owners of nations have broken off ruddy branches, Unto Jazer had they reached, They had spread abroad to the desert,— Her boughs had stretched forth､ had gone over to the sea.

content: 9 For this cause will I bewail､ in the wailing of Jazer､ The vine of Sibmah, I will drench thee with my tears, O Heshbon､ and Elealeh,— For upon thy fruit-harvest､ and upon thy grain-harvest the battle-shout hath fallen.
content_old: 9 For this cause will I bewail､ in the wailing of Jazer､ The vine of Sibmah, I will drench thee with my tears, O Heshbon､ and Elealeh,— For upon thy fruit-harvest､ and upon thy grain-harvest the battle-shout hath fallen.

content: 10 Now shall be withdrawn rejoicing and exultation､ out of the garden-land, And in the vineyards shall be neither singing nor shouting,— Wine in the winepress the treader shall not tread, The vintage-shout have I made to cease.
content_old: 10 Now shall be withdrawn rejoicing and exultation､ out of the garden-land, And in the vineyards shall be neither singing nor shouting,— Wine in the winepress the treader shall not tread, The vintage-shout have I made to cease.

content: 11 For this cause mine inward parts—for Moab like a lyre shall make a plaintive sound,— Yea what is within me for Kir-heres.
content_old: 11 For this cause mine inward parts—for Moab like a lyre shall make a plaintive sound,— Yea what is within me for Kir-heres.

content: 12 And it shall be— When it is seen that Moab hath laboured in vain on the high place He shall enter into his holy place to pray､ and shall not prevail.
content_old: 12 And it shall be— When it is seen that Moab hath laboured in vain on the high place He shall enter into his holy place to pray､ and shall not prevail.

content: 13 This is the word which Yahweh spake concerning Moab in time past;
content_old: 13 This is the word which Yahweh spake concerning Moab in time past;

content: 1 The oracle on Damascus,— Lo! Damascus is to be removed from being a city, And shall become a heap of ruins:
content_old: 1 The oracle on Damascus,— Lo! Damascus is to be removed from being a city, And shall become a heap of ruins:

content: 2 Forsaken are the desolate cities,— For flocks shall they serve, Which shall lie down､ and have none to make them afraid.
content_old: 2 Forsaken are the desolate cities,— For flocks shall they serve, Which shall lie down､ and have none to make them afraid.

content: 3 Then shall the fortress cease from Ephraim, And the kingdom from Damascus､ and the remnant of Syria,—
content_old: 3 Then shall the fortress cease from Ephraim, And the kingdom from Damascus､ and the remnant of Syria,—

content: 4 Like the glory of the sons of Israel shall they be,— Declareth Yahweh of hosts. And it shall come to pass in that day That the glory of Jacob shall be diminished, And the fatness of his flesh shall be wasted;
content_old: 4 Like the glory of the sons of Israel shall they be,— Declareth Yahweh of hosts. And it shall come to pass in that day That the glory of Jacob shall be diminished, And the fatness of his flesh shall be wasted;

content: 5 And it shall come to pass— That as the harvestman gathereth standing corn, And with his arm—the ears he reapeth Yea it shall come to pass— That so shall he be who gleaneth ears､ in the vale of Rephaim;
content_old: 5 And it shall come to pass— That as the harvestman gathereth standing corn, And with his arm—the ears he reapeth Yea it shall come to pass— That so shall he be who gleaneth ears､ in the vale of Rephaim;

content: 6 Yet shall there be left therein､ a gleaning､ As in the beating of an olive-tree,— Two—three berries､ in the head of the tree-top,— Four—five､ among her fruitful boughs, Declareth Yahweh､ God of Israel.
content_old: 6 Yet shall there be left therein､ a gleaning､ As in the beating of an olive-tree,— Two—three berries､ in the head of the tree-top,— Four—five､ among her fruitful boughs, Declareth Yahweh､ God of Israel.

content: 7 In that day shall the son of earth look to him that made him,— And his eyes unto the Holy One of Israel be turned;
content_old: 7 In that day shall the son of earth look to him that made him,— And his eyes unto the Holy One of Israel be turned;

content: 8 And he shall not look unto the altars､ the work of his own hands,— Nor to what his own fingers have made shall his eye be turned, Whether Sacred Stems or Sun-pillars.
content_old: 8 And he shall not look unto the altars､ the work of his own hands,— Nor to what his own fingers have made shall his eye be turned, Whether Sacred Stems or Sun-pillars.

content: 9 In that day shall his fortified cities become Like a neglected bough and a topmost branch, Which they neglected because of the sons of Israel,— So shall there be desolation.
content_old: 9 In that day shall his fortified cities become Like a neglected bough and a topmost branch, Which they neglected because of the sons of Israel,— So shall there be desolation.

content: 10 Because thou didst forget the God of thy salvation, And thy Rock of refuge thou didst not remember For this cause shalt thou plant very pleasant plants, And the slip of a stranger shalt thou set:
content_old: 10 Because thou didst forget the God of thy salvation, And thy Rock of refuge thou didst not remember For this cause shalt thou plant very pleasant plants, And the slip of a stranger shalt thou set:

content: 11 In the day when thou plantest fence thou in, And in the morning cause thou thy slip to blossom,— A harvest will have waved in the day of destiny､ and mortal pain.
content_old: 11 In the day when thou plantest fence thou in, And in the morning cause thou thy slip to blossom,— A harvest will have waved in the day of destiny､ and mortal pain.

content: 12 Alas! the booming of many peoples, Like the booming of the seas shall they boom,— And the rushing of nations ! Like the rushing of mighty waters shall they rush.
content_old: 12 Alas! the booming of many peoples, Like the booming of the seas shall they boom,— And the rushing of nations ! Like the rushing of mighty waters shall they rush.

content: 13 Though nations like the rushing of many waters shall rush Yet shall one rebuke him, And he shall flee far away,— And be chased As the chaff of the mountains before a wind, And as whirling stubble before a storm!
content_old: 13 Though nations like the rushing of many waters shall rush Yet shall one rebuke him, And he shall flee far away,— And be chased As the chaff of the mountains before a wind, And as whirling stubble before a storm!

content: 1 Ho! thou land of the buzzing of wings,— Which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia:
content_old: 1 Ho! thou land of the buzzing of wings,— Which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia:

content: 2 That sendeth､ by the sea､ ambassadors､ Even in vessels of paper-reed､ upon the face of the waters,— Go､ ye swift messengers､ Unto a nation drawn out and polished, Unto a people terrible from their beginning and onwards,— A nation most mighty and subduing, Whose land rivers have cut through.
content_old: 2 That sendeth､ by the sea､ ambassadors､ Even in vessels of paper-reed､ upon the face of the waters,— Go､ ye swift messengers､ Unto a nation drawn out and polished, Unto a people terrible from their beginning and onwards,— A nation most mighty and subduing, Whose land rivers have cut through.

content: 3 All ye inhabitants of the world､ And ye､ that dwell in the earth,— When there is lifted up an ensign on the mountains Ye shall look, And when there is blown a horn Ye shall hearken.
content_old: 3 All ye inhabitants of the world､ And ye､ that dwell in the earth,— When there is lifted up an ensign on the mountains Ye shall look, And when there is blown a horn Ye shall hearken.

content: 4 For thus said Yahweh unto me,— I must be quiet､ I must look on in my fixed place of abode,— Like a bright heat､ on the light, Like a cloud of dew､ in the heat of harvest.
content_old: 4 For thus said Yahweh unto me,— I must be quiet､ I must look on in my fixed place of abode,— Like a bright heat､ on the light, Like a cloud of dew､ in the heat of harvest.

content: 5 For before harvest､ when the bud is perfect, And the blossom becometh a ripening grape Then will one cut down the twigs with pruning-hooks, And the tendrils will he remove and cast down:
content_old: 5 For before harvest､ when the bud is perfect, And the blossom becometh a ripening grape Then will one cut down the twigs with pruning-hooks, And the tendrils will he remove and cast down:

content: 6 They shall be left together､ To the ravenous birds of the mountains, And to the beast of the earth,— Then shall the ravenous bird summer upon them, And every beast of the earth upon them shall winter.
content_old: 6 They shall be left together､ To the ravenous birds of the mountains, And to the beast of the earth,— Then shall the ravenous bird summer upon them, And every beast of the earth upon them shall winter.

content: 1 The oracle on Egypt: Lo! Yahweh､ riding upon a swift cloud､ and he will enter Egypt, And the idols of Egypt shall shake at his presence, And the heart of Egypt shall melt within him;
content_old: 1 The oracle on Egypt: Lo! Yahweh､ riding upon a swift cloud､ and he will enter Egypt, And the idols of Egypt shall shake at his presence, And the heart of Egypt shall melt within him;

content: 2 And I will stir up Egyptians against Egyptians, And they shall fight— Every one against his brother､ and Every one against his neighbour,— City against city, and Kingdom against kingdom.
content_old: 2 And I will stir up Egyptians against Egyptians, And they shall fight— Every one against his brother､ and Every one against his neighbour,— City against city, and Kingdom against kingdom.

content: 3 And the spirit of Egypt shall vanish within them, Yea the sagacity thereof will I swallow up,— And they will seek Unto the idols､ and Unto them that mutter, and Unto them that have familiar spirits､ and Unto the wizards;
content_old: 3 And the spirit of Egypt shall vanish within them, Yea the sagacity thereof will I swallow up,— And they will seek Unto the idols､ and Unto them that mutter, and Unto them that have familiar spirits､ and Unto the wizards;

content: 4 And I will deliver the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel lord,— And a fierce king shall rule over them, Declareth the Lord, Yahweh of hosts.
content_old: 4 And I will deliver the Egyptians into the hand of a cruel lord,— And a fierce king shall rule over them, Declareth the Lord, Yahweh of hosts.

content: 5 And the waters shall be dried up from the great stream,— And the River shall waste and be dry;
content_old: 5 And the waters shall be dried up from the great stream,— And the River shall waste and be dry;

content: 6 And rivers shall stink, The canals of Egypt be shallow and waste, Reed and rush be withered;
content_old: 6 And rivers shall stink, The canals of Egypt be shallow and waste, Reed and rush be withered;

content: 7 The meadows by the Nile､ by the mouth of the Nile､ And all that is sown in the Nile, Shall be dry､ driven away､ and not be!
content_old: 7 The meadows by the Nile､ by the mouth of the Nile､ And all that is sown in the Nile, Shall be dry､ driven away､ and not be!

content: 8 Then shall the fishers lament, And all shall mourn､ who cast in the Nile a hook,— And they who spread nets on the face of the waters shall languish;
content_old: 8 Then shall the fishers lament, And all shall mourn､ who cast in the Nile a hook,— And they who spread nets on the face of the waters shall languish;

content: 9 Then shall turn pale The workers in combed flax,—and The weavers of white linen;
content_old: 9 Then shall turn pale The workers in combed flax,—and The weavers of white linen;

content: 10 Then shall her pillars be crushed,— All who make wages be bowed down in soul.
content_old: 10 Then shall her pillars be crushed,— All who make wages be bowed down in soul.

content: 11 Surely foolish are the princes of Zoan, The wisest counsellors of Pharaoh in counsel are brutish,— How can ye say unto Pharaoh, Son of the wise am I､ Son of the kings of olden time?
content_old: 11 Surely foolish are the princes of Zoan, The wisest counsellors of Pharaoh in counsel are brutish,— How can ye say unto Pharaoh, Son of the wise am I､ Son of the kings of olden time?

content: 12 Where then are thy wise men? Pray let them tell thee! And let them know what Yahweh of hosts hath purposed on Egypt!
content_old: 12 Where then are thy wise men? Pray let them tell thee! And let them know what Yahweh of hosts hath purposed on Egypt!

content: 13 Doting are the princes of Zoan, Deceived are the princes of Nôph: They who are the corner-stone of her tribes have led Egypt astray.
content_old: 13 Doting are the princes of Zoan, Deceived are the princes of Nôph: They who are the corner-stone of her tribes have led Egypt astray.

content: 14 Yahweh hath infused in her midst､ a spirit of perverseness,— And they have led Egypt astray into all his own doings, As a drunken man staggereth into his own vomit;
content_old: 14 Yahweh hath infused in her midst､ a spirit of perverseness,— And they have led Egypt astray into all his own doings, As a drunken man staggereth into his own vomit;

content: 15 And Egypt shall have nothing which can be done, Which head or tail､ palm-top or rush､ can do!
content_old: 15 And Egypt shall have nothing which can be done, Which head or tail､ palm-top or rush､ can do!

content: 16 In that day shall Egypt be like unto women,— And shall start and tremble because of the brandishing of the hand of Yahweh of hosts, which he is about to brandish over it.
content_old: 16 In that day shall Egypt be like unto women,— And shall start and tremble because of the brandishing of the hand of Yahweh of hosts, which he is about to brandish over it.

content: 17 Then shall the soil of Judah become､ to Egypt a terror; Every one to whom it is mentioned will tremble,— Because of the purpose of Yahweh of hosts, which he is purposing against it.
content_old: 17 Then shall the soil of Judah become､ to Egypt a terror; Every one to whom it is mentioned will tremble,— Because of the purpose of Yahweh of hosts, which he is purposing against it.

content: 18 In that day shall there be five cities in the land of Egypt､ Speaking the language of Canaan, And swearing unto Yahweh of hosts,— The city of destruction shall be the name of one!
content_old: 18 In that day shall there be five cities in the land of Egypt､ Speaking the language of Canaan, And swearing unto Yahweh of hosts,— The city of destruction shall be the name of one!

content: 19 In that day shall there be An altar unto Yahweh, in the midst of the land of Egypt,— And a pillar near the boundary thereof､ unto Yahweh;
content_old: 19 In that day shall there be An altar unto Yahweh, in the midst of the land of Egypt,— And a pillar near the boundary thereof､ unto Yahweh;

content: 20 And it shall become a sign and a witness､ unto Yahweh of hosts､ in the land of Egypt,— For they will make outcry unto Yahweh､ because of oppressors, That he would send them a saviour—and a great one､ Then will he deliver them.
content_old: 20 And it shall become a sign and a witness､ unto Yahweh of hosts､ in the land of Egypt,— For they will make outcry unto Yahweh､ because of oppressors, That he would send them a saviour—and a great one､ Then will he deliver them.

content: 21 Then will Yahweh make himself known to the Egyptians, So shall the Egyptians know Yahweh､ in that day,— And they will offer a sacrifice and a present, And will vow a vow unto Yahweh､ and will perform.
content_old: 21 Then will Yahweh make himself known to the Egyptians, So shall the Egyptians know Yahweh､ in that day,— And they will offer a sacrifice and a present, And will vow a vow unto Yahweh､ and will perform.

content: 22 And Yahweh will plague Egypt､ plague and heal,— And they will turn unto Yahweh, And he will be entreated of them､ and will heal them.
content_old: 22 And Yahweh will plague Egypt､ plague and heal,— And they will turn unto Yahweh, And he will be entreated of them､ and will heal them.

content: 23 In that day shall there be a highway､ from Egypt to Assyria, And the Assyrians shall come into Egypt､ And the Egyptians into Assyria; And the Egyptians shall serve with the Assyrians.
content_old: 23 In that day shall there be a highway､ from Egypt to Assyria, And the Assyrians shall come into Egypt､ And the Egyptians into Assyria; And the Egyptians shall serve with the Assyrians.

content: 24 In that day shall Israel be a third with Egypt and with Assyria,— A blessing in the midst of the earth:
content_old: 24 In that day shall Israel be a third with Egypt and with Assyria,— A blessing in the midst of the earth:

content: 1 In the year that Tartan entered Ashdod, when Sargon king of Assyria sent him,—and he fought against Ashdod and captured it,—
content_old: 1 In the year that Tartan entered Ashdod, when Sargon king of Assyria sent him,—and he fought against Ashdod and captured it,—

content: 2 at that time spake Yahweh､ through Isaiah son of Amoz､ saying, Go､ and loose the sackcloth from off thy loins, And thy sandal draw thou off from thy foot,— And he did so, walking disrobed and barefoot.
content_old: 2 at that time spake Yahweh､ through Isaiah son of Amoz､ saying, Go､ and loose the sackcloth from off thy loins, And thy sandal draw thou off from thy foot,— And he did so, walking disrobed and barefoot.

content: 3 Then said Yahweh,— As my servant Isaiah hath walked disrobed and barefoot､ three years､ as a sign and a wonder､ against Egypt and against Ethiopia
content_old: 3 Then said Yahweh,— As my servant Isaiah hath walked disrobed and barefoot､ three years､ as a sign and a wonder､ against Egypt and against Ethiopia

content: 4 So shall the king of Assyria lead away the captives of Egypt､ and the exiles of Ethiopia､ young and old､ disrobed and barefoot,—with their persons behind uncovered the shame of Egypt.
content_old: 4 So shall the king of Assyria lead away the captives of Egypt､ and the exiles of Ethiopia､ young and old､ disrobed and barefoot,—with their persons behind uncovered the shame of Egypt.

content: 5 Thus shall they be confounded､ and turn pale,— For Ethiopia､ their expectation, and For Egypt､ their boast;
content_old: 5 Thus shall they be confounded､ and turn pale,— For Ethiopia､ their expectation, and For Egypt､ their boast;

content: 1 The oracle on the desert of the sea:— As storm-winds in the South which with a rush from the desert do come from a terrible land
content_old: 1 The oracle on the desert of the sea:— As storm-winds in the South which with a rush from the desert do come from a terrible land

content: 2 So hath a grievous vision been told me:— The deceiver is deceiving､ And the spoiler is spoiling, Go up､ O Elam､ Besiege､ O Media, All the sighing she hath caused have I made to cease.
content_old: 2 So hath a grievous vision been told me:— The deceiver is deceiving､ And the spoiler is spoiling, Go up､ O Elam､ Besiege､ O Media, All the sighing she hath caused have I made to cease.

content: 3 for this cause are my loins filled with anguish, Pangs have seized me, as the pangs of her that is giving birth,— I writhe､ so that I cannot hear, I tremble､ so that I cannot see:
content_old: 3 for this cause are my loins filled with anguish, Pangs have seized me, as the pangs of her that is giving birth,— I writhe､ so that I cannot hear, I tremble､ so that I cannot see:

content: 4 My heart fluttereth, A horror terrifieth me,— My twilight of pleasure hath he turned for me into a time of trembling.
content_old: 4 My heart fluttereth, A horror terrifieth me,— My twilight of pleasure hath he turned for me into a time of trembling.

content: 5 Ye thought to prepare the table—spread the mat—eat—drink!… Arise､ ye chieftains､ anoint the shield!
content_old: 5 Ye thought to prepare the table—spread the mat—eat—drink!… Arise､ ye chieftains､ anoint the shield!

content: 6 For thus hath My Lord said unto me,— Go､ set the watchman, What he seeth let him tell!
content_old: 6 For thus hath My Lord said unto me,— Go､ set the watchman, What he seeth let him tell!

content: 7 When he seeth A train of horsemen in double rank, A train of asses､ A train of camels Then shall he hearken attentively､ with diligent heed.
content_old: 7 When he seeth A train of horsemen in double rank, A train of asses､ A train of camels Then shall he hearken attentively､ with diligent heed.

content: 8 Then cried he､ A lion! On the watch O My Lord､ had I been standing continually､ by day, And at my post had I been stationed whole nights;—
content_old: 8 Then cried he､ A lion! On the watch O My Lord､ had I been standing continually､ by day, And at my post had I been stationed whole nights;—

content: 9 When lo! here was a train of men coming､ With horsemen in double rank,— And one began and said､ Fallen! fallen! is Babylon, And all the images of her gods are smashed to the ground!
content_old: 9 When lo! here was a train of men coming､ With horsemen in double rank,— And one began and said､ Fallen! fallen! is Babylon, And all the images of her gods are smashed to the ground!

content: 10 O thou My threshing! And the grain of my corn-floor! That which I have heard from Yahweh of hosts､ the God of Israel Have I declared unto you.
content_old: 10 O thou My threshing! And the grain of my corn-floor! That which I have heard from Yahweh of hosts､ the God of Israel Have I declared unto you.

content: 11 The oracle on Dumah: Unto me is one crying—out of Seir, Watchman! how far gone is the night? Watchman! how far gone is the night?
content_old: 11 The oracle on Dumah: Unto me is one crying—out of Seir, Watchman! how far gone is the night? Watchman! how far gone is the night?

content: 12 Said the watchman, There cometh a morning､ But also a night,— If ye will enquire enquire ye— Come again!
content_old: 12 Said the watchman, There cometh a morning､ But also a night,— If ye will enquire enquire ye— Come again!

content: 13 The oracle on Arabia,— Among the shrubs in Arabia must ye lodge, Ye caravans of Dedanites.
content_old: 13 The oracle on Arabia,— Among the shrubs in Arabia must ye lodge, Ye caravans of Dedanites.

content: 14 To meet the thirsty bring ye water,— Ye dwellers in the land of Tema; With bread for him get in advance of him that is in flight!
content_old: 14 To meet the thirsty bring ye water,— Ye dwellers in the land of Tema; With bread for him get in advance of him that is in flight!

content: 15 For before swords have they fled: Before a sword that is drawn､ Before a bow that is bent, And before the stress of war.
content_old: 15 For before swords have they fled: Before a sword that is drawn､ Before a bow that is bent, And before the stress of war.

content: 16 For thus hath My Lord said unto me,— Within a year according to the years of a hireling shall fail all the glory of Kedar;
content_old: 16 For thus hath My Lord said unto me,— Within a year according to the years of a hireling shall fail all the glory of Kedar;

content: 1 The oracle on the valley of vision,— What aileth thee､ then, That thou art wholly gone up to the housetops?
content_old: 1 The oracle on the valley of vision,— What aileth thee､ then, That thou art wholly gone up to the housetops?

content: 2 With tumults art thou filled, thou citadel in commotion! city exultant! Thy slain are Not the slain of the sword, Nor the dead in battle.
content_old: 2 With tumults art thou filled, thou citadel in commotion! city exultant! Thy slain are Not the slain of the sword, Nor the dead in battle.

content: 3 All thy rulers having fled ､ together by the bow are taken captive: All found in thee have been taken captive together, Far away have they fled.
content_old: 3 All thy rulers having fled ､ together by the bow are taken captive: All found in thee have been taken captive together, Far away have they fled.

content: 4 For this cause I said— Look away from me､ Bitterly will I weep,— Do not press to comfort me, For the ruin of the daughter of my people.
content_old: 4 For this cause I said— Look away from me､ Bitterly will I weep,— Do not press to comfort me, For the ruin of the daughter of my people.

content: 5 For a day of confusion and downtreading and perplexity pertaineth to My Lord Yahweh of hosts, in the valley of vision,—an undermining of walls､ and a crying for help to the mountain.
content_old: 5 For a day of confusion and downtreading and perplexity pertaineth to My Lord Yahweh of hosts, in the valley of vision,—an undermining of walls､ and a crying for help to the mountain.

content: 6 Yea Elam beareth the quiver, With trains of men､ and horsemen,— And Kir hath uncovered the shield.
content_old: 6 Yea Elam beareth the quiver, With trains of men､ and horsemen,— And Kir hath uncovered the shield.

content: 7 And it hath come to pass that the choice of thy vales are full of chariots; Yea the horsemen have set themselves in array at the gate.
content_old: 7 And it hath come to pass that the choice of thy vales are full of chariots; Yea the horsemen have set themselves in array at the gate.

content: 8 Then removed he the veil of Judah,— Yea thou didst peer､ on that day､ into the armoury of the forest-house;
content_old: 8 Then removed he the veil of Judah,— Yea thou didst peer､ on that day､ into the armoury of the forest-house;

content: 9 And the breaches in the city of David ye beheld､ for they were many,— So ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool;
content_old: 9 And the breaches in the city of David ye beheld､ for they were many,— So ye gathered together the waters of the lower pool;

content: 10 And the houses of Jerusalem ye counted,— And brake down the houses, to fortify the wall;
content_old: 10 And the houses of Jerusalem ye counted,— And brake down the houses, to fortify the wall;

content: 11 And a reservoir ye made､ between the two walls, for the waters of the ancient pool,— And had no regard unto him that made it, Nor unto him that formed it long ago had ye respect.
content_old: 11 And a reservoir ye made､ between the two walls, for the waters of the ancient pool,— And had no regard unto him that made it, Nor unto him that formed it long ago had ye respect.

content: 12 And when My Lord Yahweh of hosts called､ in that day,—for weeping､ and for lamentation, and for shaving bare､ and for girding with sackcloth
content_old: 12 And when My Lord Yahweh of hosts called､ in that day,—for weeping､ and for lamentation, and for shaving bare､ and for girding with sackcloth

content: 13 Then lo! joy and rejoicing､ killing oxen､ and slaughtering sheep, eating flesh､ and drinking wine,— Let us eat and drink, For to-morrow we may die!
content_old: 13 Then lo! joy and rejoicing､ killing oxen､ and slaughtering sheep, eating flesh､ and drinking wine,— Let us eat and drink, For to-morrow we may die!

content: 14 Therefore did Yahweh reveal himself in mine ears､ Surely there shall be no propitiatory-covering put over this iniquity for you､ until ye die, Saith My Lord､ Yahweh､ of hosts.
content_old: 14 Therefore did Yahweh reveal himself in mine ears､ Surely there shall be no propitiatory-covering put over this iniquity for you､ until ye die, Saith My Lord､ Yahweh､ of hosts.

content: 15 Thus said My Lord Yahweh of hosts, Come､ go in unto this steward, Unto Shebna､ who is over the house:
content_old: 15 Thus said My Lord Yahweh of hosts, Come､ go in unto this steward, Unto Shebna､ who is over the house:

content: 16 What doest thou here? And whom hast thou here? That thou hast hewn for thyself here a sepulchre,— As one hewing on high his sepulchre, Cutting out in the cliff a habitation for himself?
content_old: 16 What doest thou here? And whom hast thou here? That thou hast hewn for thyself here a sepulchre,— As one hewing on high his sepulchre, Cutting out in the cliff a habitation for himself?

content: 17 Lo! Yahweh is about to hurl thee､ with a hurl, O mighty man,— And roll thee with a roll;
content_old: 17 Lo! Yahweh is about to hurl thee､ with a hurl, O mighty man,— And roll thee with a roll;

content: 18 He will toss thee､ with a toss, like a ball､ into a country wide on both hands,— There shalt thou die､ And there shall thy glorious chariots be the contempt of the house of thy lord.
content_old: 18 He will toss thee､ with a toss, like a ball､ into a country wide on both hands,— There shalt thou die､ And there shall thy glorious chariots be the contempt of the house of thy lord.

content: 19 Thus will I thrust thee out from thine office,— And from thy station shall one tear thee down.
content_old: 19 Thus will I thrust thee out from thine office,— And from thy station shall one tear thee down.

content: 20 And it shall come to pass､ in that day That I will call for my servant, for Eliakim､ son of Hilkiah,
content_old: 20 And it shall come to pass､ in that day That I will call for my servant, for Eliakim､ son of Hilkiah,

content: 21 And will clothe him with thy tunic､ And with thy girdle will I gird him, And thine authority will I deliver into his hand,— So shall he become a father To the inhabitant of Jerusalem and To the house of Judah.
content_old: 21 And will clothe him with thy tunic､ And with thy girdle will I gird him, And thine authority will I deliver into his hand,— So shall he become a father To the inhabitant of Jerusalem and To the house of Judah.

content: 22 And I will lay the key of the house of David､ upon his shoulder,— And he shall open､ and none shall shut, And shut､ and none shall open;
content_old: 22 And I will lay the key of the house of David､ upon his shoulder,— And he shall open､ and none shall shut, And shut､ and none shall open;

content: 23 And I will fasten him as a peg in a sure place,— And he shall become a throne of glory､ to the house of his father;
content_old: 23 And I will fasten him as a peg in a sure place,— And he shall become a throne of glory､ to the house of his father;

content: 24 And they shall hang upon him､ all the weight of his father’s house— The offshoots､ and the side-twigs— All the small vessels, Both the cups and all the jugs
content_old: 24 And they shall hang upon him､ all the weight of his father’s house— The offshoots､ and the side-twigs— All the small vessels, Both the cups and all the jugs

content: 1 The oracle on Tyre,— Howl! ye ships of Tarshish､ For it is laid too waste to be a haven to enter, From the land of Cyprus hath it been unveiled to them.
content_old: 1 The oracle on Tyre,— Howl! ye ships of Tarshish､ For it is laid too waste to be a haven to enter, From the land of Cyprus hath it been unveiled to them.

content: 2 Be dumb､ ye inhabitants of the Coast,— Whom the merchants of Zidon passing over the sea once replenished;
content_old: 2 Be dumb､ ye inhabitants of the Coast,— Whom the merchants of Zidon passing over the sea once replenished;

content: 3 Yea on mighty waters was the grain of Shihor, The harvest of the Nile was her increase,— And so she became a mart of nations.
content_old: 3 Yea on mighty waters was the grain of Shihor, The harvest of the Nile was her increase,— And so she became a mart of nations.

content: 4 Turn thou pale､ O Zidon, For spoken hath the sea, the fortress of the sea､ saying,— I have neither been in pangs nor given birth､ I have neither brought up young men､ nor promoted virgins.
content_old: 4 Turn thou pale､ O Zidon, For spoken hath the sea, the fortress of the sea､ saying,— I have neither been in pangs nor given birth､ I have neither brought up young men､ nor promoted virgins.

content: 5 Like the report of Egypt They shall be in pangs at the like report of Tyre.
content_old: 5 Like the report of Egypt They shall be in pangs at the like report of Tyre.

content: 6 Pass ye over to Tarshish,— Howl､ ye inhabitants of the Coast:
content_old: 6 Pass ye over to Tarshish,— Howl､ ye inhabitants of the Coast:

content: 7 Is this､ to you､ an exultation? Though from ancient days is her antiquity, Yet shall her own feet carry her away､ far off to dwell.
content_old: 7 Is this､ to you､ an exultation? Though from ancient days is her antiquity, Yet shall her own feet carry her away､ far off to dwell.

content: 8 Who hath purposed this, against Tyre､ The bestower of crowns,— Whose merchants are princes, Her traders､ the honourable of the earth?
content_old: 8 Who hath purposed this, against Tyre､ The bestower of crowns,— Whose merchants are princes, Her traders､ the honourable of the earth?

content: 9 Yahweh of hosts hath purposed it,— To humble the pride of all beauty, To make of little esteem all the honourable of the earth.
content_old: 9 Yahweh of hosts hath purposed it,— To humble the pride of all beauty, To make of little esteem all the honourable of the earth.

content: 10 Pass through thy land､ as the Nile,— O daughter of Tarshish､ there is no restraint any longer!
content_old: 10 Pass through thy land､ as the Nile,— O daughter of Tarshish､ there is no restraint any longer!

content: 11 His hand hath he stretched out over the sea, He hath shaken kingdoms,— Yahweh hath given command against the Phœnician coast, To destroy her fortresses.
content_old: 11 His hand hath he stretched out over the sea, He hath shaken kingdoms,— Yahweh hath given command against the Phœnician coast, To destroy her fortresses.

content: 12 Therefore hath he said,— No more､ again do thou exult, Thou violated virgin daughter of Zidon,— To Cyprus arise and pass over, Even there shall one find thee no rest.
content_old: 12 Therefore hath he said,— No more､ again do thou exult, Thou violated virgin daughter of Zidon,— To Cyprus arise and pass over, Even there shall one find thee no rest.

content: 13 Lo! the land of the Chaldeans This is the people､ that was not, Assyria founded it for the inhabitants of the desert,— They set up its siege-towers, They demolished its palaces､ Made it a ruin!
content_old: 13 Lo! the land of the Chaldeans This is the people､ that was not, Assyria founded it for the inhabitants of the desert,— They set up its siege-towers, They demolished its palaces､ Made it a ruin!

content: 14 Howl, ye ships of Tarshish,— For laid waste is your fortress.
content_old: 14 Howl, ye ships of Tarshish,— For laid waste is your fortress.

content: 15 So shall it be in that day That Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, According to the days of a certain king: At the end of seventy years shall it befall Tyre according to the song of the harlot:
content_old: 15 So shall it be in that day That Tyre shall be forgotten seventy years, According to the days of a certain king: At the end of seventy years shall it befall Tyre according to the song of the harlot:

content: 16 Take thou a lyre､ Go round the city､ O harlot forgotten,— Sweetly touch the strings､ Lengthen out the song, That thou mayest be called to mind.
content_old: 16 Take thou a lyre､ Go round the city､ O harlot forgotten,— Sweetly touch the strings､ Lengthen out the song, That thou mayest be called to mind.

content: 17 So shall it be at the end of seventy years That Yahweh will visit Tyre, And she will return to her hire,— Yea she will play the harlot—with all the kingdoms of the earth､ upon the face of the ground.
content_old: 17 So shall it be at the end of seventy years That Yahweh will visit Tyre, And she will return to her hire,— Yea she will play the harlot—with all the kingdoms of the earth､ upon the face of the ground.

content: 1 Lo! Yahweh emptying the earth､ and laying it waste,— And he will overturn the face thereof, And scatter them who dwell therein.
content_old: 1 Lo! Yahweh emptying the earth､ and laying it waste,— And he will overturn the face thereof, And scatter them who dwell therein.

content: 2 And it shall be— As the people so the priest, As the servant so his lord, As the maid so her mistress,— As the buyer so the seller, As the lender so the borrower, As the debtor so his creditor.
content_old: 2 And it shall be— As the people so the priest, As the servant so his lord, As the maid so her mistress,— As the buyer so the seller, As the lender so the borrower, As the debtor so his creditor.

content: 3 Emptied—emptied—shall be the earth､ yea pillaged—pillaged,— For Yahweh hath spoken this word.
content_old: 3 Emptied—emptied—shall be the earth､ yea pillaged—pillaged,— For Yahweh hath spoken this word.

content: 4 Mourneth､ fadeth､ the earth Languisheth､ fadeth､ the world,— Languished have the lofty of the people of the earth.
content_old: 4 Mourneth､ fadeth､ the earth Languisheth､ fadeth､ the world,— Languished have the lofty of the people of the earth.

content: 5 Yea the earth itself is profaned under them who dwell therein,— For they have Set aside laws､ Gone beyond statute, Broken an age-abiding covenant.
content_old: 5 Yea the earth itself is profaned under them who dwell therein,— For they have Set aside laws､ Gone beyond statute, Broken an age-abiding covenant.

content: 6 For this cause a curse hath devoured the earth, And punished are the dwellers therein,— For this cause are burned the inhabitants of the earth, And the men left remaining—are few.
content_old: 6 For this cause a curse hath devoured the earth, And punished are the dwellers therein,— For this cause are burned the inhabitants of the earth, And the men left remaining—are few.

content: 7 Mourneth the new wine､ Withereth the vine,— Sighing are all the merryhearted:
content_old: 7 Mourneth the new wine､ Withereth the vine,— Sighing are all the merryhearted:

content: 8 Ceased hath the mirth of timbrels, Ended is the noise of the uproarious,— Ceased hath the mirth of the lyre:
content_old: 8 Ceased hath the mirth of timbrels, Ended is the noise of the uproarious,— Ceased hath the mirth of the lyre:

content: 9 With a song they drink not wine,— Bitter is strong drink､ to them who drink it:
content_old: 9 With a song they drink not wine,— Bitter is strong drink､ to them who drink it:

content: 10 Broken down is the city of desolation,— Shut up every house､ that it cannot be entered.
content_old: 10 Broken down is the city of desolation,— Shut up every house､ that it cannot be entered.

content: 11 There is an outcry concerning wine in the streets,— Darkened is all joy, Departed the gladness of the earth.
content_old: 11 There is an outcry concerning wine in the streets,— Darkened is all joy, Departed the gladness of the earth.

content: 12 There is left in the city､ desolation,— And to ruins have been broken the gate.
content_old: 12 There is left in the city､ desolation,— And to ruins have been broken the gate.

content: 13 When thus it shall be in the earth､ in the midst of the peoples There shall be like the shaking of an olive-tree, like the going round to pick､ when closed is the harvest.
content_old: 13 When thus it shall be in the earth､ in the midst of the peoples There shall be like the shaking of an olive-tree, like the going round to pick､ when closed is the harvest.

content: 14 They shall lift up their voice— shall raise a tremulous note,— On account of the splendour of Yahweh have they made a shrill cry､ on the West;
content_old: 14 They shall lift up their voice— shall raise a tremulous note,— On account of the splendour of Yahweh have they made a shrill cry､ on the West;

content: 15 For this cause In the Regions of Light give ye glory to Yahweh,— In the Coastlands of the Sea unto the Name of Yahweh､ God of Israel.
content_old: 15 For this cause In the Regions of Light give ye glory to Yahweh,— In the Coastlands of the Sea unto the Name of Yahweh､ God of Israel.

content: 16 From the uttermost part of the earth melodies have we heard— Beauty to the righteous one! But I had said— Ruin to me! Ruin to me! Woe to me! Traitors have betrayed, Yea traitorously have traitors betrayed!
content_old: 16 From the uttermost part of the earth melodies have we heard— Beauty to the righteous one! But I had said— Ruin to me! Ruin to me! Woe to me! Traitors have betrayed, Yea traitorously have traitors betrayed!

content: 17 Terror and pit､ and snare,—are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth!
content_old: 17 Terror and pit､ and snare,—are upon thee, O inhabitant of the earth!

content: 18 So shall it be— He that fleeth from the sound of the terror shall fall into the pit, And he that getteth up out of the midst of the pit shall be captured in the snare,— For the windows on high have opened, And shaken are the foundations of earth.
content_old: 18 So shall it be— He that fleeth from the sound of the terror shall fall into the pit, And he that getteth up out of the midst of the pit shall be captured in the snare,— For the windows on high have opened, And shaken are the foundations of earth.

content: 19 The earth breaketh､ breaketh,— The earth crasheth､ crasheth, The earth tottereth､ tottereth;
content_old: 19 The earth breaketh､ breaketh,— The earth crasheth､ crasheth, The earth tottereth､ tottereth;

content: 20 The earth staggereth—staggereth､ like a drunken man, And rocketh to and fro like a night-hut,— So shall be heavy upon her､ her transgression, And she shall fall､ and not again rise.
content_old: 20 The earth staggereth—staggereth､ like a drunken man, And rocketh to and fro like a night-hut,— So shall be heavy upon her､ her transgression, And she shall fall､ and not again rise.

content: 21 And it shall be in that day That Yahweh will bring punishment Upon the host of the height､ in the height,— And upon the kings of the ground､ on the ground.
content_old: 21 And it shall be in that day That Yahweh will bring punishment Upon the host of the height､ in the height,— And upon the kings of the ground､ on the ground.

content: 22 And they shall be swept together in a crowd, fettered for a pit, And shall be lowered into a dungeon,— And after many days shall they be punished.
content_old: 22 And they shall be swept together in a crowd, fettered for a pit, And shall be lowered into a dungeon,— And after many days shall they be punished.

content: 1 O Yahweh! my God thou art, I will exalt thee､ I will praise thy Name, For thou hast done a wonderful thing,— Purposes of long ago､ Faithfulness in truth.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh! my God thou art, I will exalt thee､ I will praise thy Name, For thou hast done a wonderful thing,— Purposes of long ago､ Faithfulness in truth.

content: 2 For thou hast made､ of a citadel､ a mound, of a defenced city､ a ruin,— palaces for foreigners､ to be no city, To times age-abiding shall it not be built.
content_old: 2 For thou hast made､ of a citadel､ a mound, of a defenced city､ a ruin,— palaces for foreigners､ to be no city, To times age-abiding shall it not be built.

content: 3 For this cause shall glorify thee—a strong people, The city of tyrannous nations shall revere thee;
content_old: 3 For this cause shall glorify thee—a strong people, The city of tyrannous nations shall revere thee;

content: 4 For thou didst become A refuge to the weak､ A refuge to the needy､ when distress was upon him,— A shelter from the storm､ A shade from the heat, When the blast of tyrants was like a storm against a wall.
content_old: 4 For thou didst become A refuge to the weak､ A refuge to the needy､ when distress was upon him,— A shelter from the storm､ A shade from the heat, When the blast of tyrants was like a storm against a wall.

content: 5 As heat in a desert the pomp of foreigners wilt thou subdue,— Heat—with the shade of a cloud, The song of tyrants become low.
content_old: 5 As heat in a desert the pomp of foreigners wilt thou subdue,— Heat—with the shade of a cloud, The song of tyrants become low.

content: 6 Then will Yahweh of hosts prepare for all the peoples in this mountain A banquet of fat things､ A banquet of old wines,— Of fat things full of marrow, Of old wines well refined;
content_old: 6 Then will Yahweh of hosts prepare for all the peoples in this mountain A banquet of fat things､ A banquet of old wines,— Of fat things full of marrow, Of old wines well refined;

content: 7 And he will swallow up in this mountain The mask of the veil､ the veil that is upon all the peoples,— And the web that is woven over all the nations.
content_old: 7 And he will swallow up in this mountain The mask of the veil､ the veil that is upon all the peoples,— And the web that is woven over all the nations.

content: 8 Having swallowed up death itself victoriously My Lord､ Yahweh､ will wipe away tears from off all faces,— And the reproach of his own people will he remove from off all the earth, For Yahweh hath spoken.
content_old: 8 Having swallowed up death itself victoriously My Lord､ Yahweh､ will wipe away tears from off all faces,— And the reproach of his own people will he remove from off all the earth, For Yahweh hath spoken.

content: 9 So shall it be said in that day Lo! our God is this! We waited for him､ that he might save us,— This is Yahweh! We waited for him, Let us exult and rejoice､ in his salvation.
content_old: 9 So shall it be said in that day Lo! our God is this! We waited for him､ that he might save us,— This is Yahweh! We waited for him, Let us exult and rejoice､ in his salvation.

content: 10 For the hand of Yahweh will settle down in this mountain,— Then shall Moab be trodden down in its place, Like the treading down of a strawheap in the water of a dunghill;
content_old: 10 For the hand of Yahweh will settle down in this mountain,— Then shall Moab be trodden down in its place, Like the treading down of a strawheap in the water of a dunghill;

content: 11 Should he spread forth his hands in the midst thereof, As a swimmer spreadeth forth to swim Then would be laid low his pride, together with the devices of his hands.
content_old: 11 Should he spread forth his hands in the midst thereof, As a swimmer spreadeth forth to swim Then would be laid low his pride, together with the devices of his hands.

content: 1 In that day shall be sung this song､ in the land of Judah,— A strong city have we! Salvation will he set for walls and rampart.
content_old: 1 In that day shall be sung this song､ in the land of Judah,— A strong city have we! Salvation will he set for walls and rampart.

content: 2 Open ye the gates,— That there may enter in—a righteous nation preserving fidelity.
content_old: 2 Open ye the gates,— That there may enter in—a righteous nation preserving fidelity.

content: 3 A purpose sustained thou wilt guard､ saying Prosper! Prosper! Because in thee hath he been led to trust.
content_old: 3 A purpose sustained thou wilt guard､ saying Prosper! Prosper! Because in thee hath he been led to trust.

content: 4 Trust ye in Yahweh､ unto futurity,— For in Yah､ Yahweh is a rock of ages.
content_old: 4 Trust ye in Yahweh､ unto futurity,— For in Yah､ Yahweh is a rock of ages.

content: 5 For he hath brought down the inhabitants of the height､ the city exalted,— He layeth it low. Layeth it low､ even to the ground, Levelleth it､ even to the dust:
content_old: 5 For he hath brought down the inhabitants of the height､ the city exalted,— He layeth it low. Layeth it low､ even to the ground, Levelleth it､ even to the dust:

content: 6 The foot trampleth it,— The feet of the lowly､ The steps of the weak.
content_old: 6 The foot trampleth it,— The feet of the lowly､ The steps of the weak.

content: 7 The path of a righteous man is even,— O Upright One! the track of a righteous man thou makest level.
content_old: 7 The path of a righteous man is even,— O Upright One! the track of a righteous man thou makest level.

content: 8 Surely in the path of thy regulations O Yahweh､ we waited for thee,— Unto thy Name and unto thy Memorials was there a longing of soul:
content_old: 8 Surely in the path of thy regulations O Yahweh､ we waited for thee,— Unto thy Name and unto thy Memorials was there a longing of soul:

content: 9 With my soul longed I for thee in the night, Yea with my spirit within me I kept on searching for thee,— For when thy regulations extend to the earth The inhabitants of the world will have learned righteousness.
content_old: 9 With my soul longed I for thee in the night, Yea with my spirit within me I kept on searching for thee,— For when thy regulations extend to the earth The inhabitants of the world will have learned righteousness.

content: 10 Let favour be shewed to the lawless he hath not learned righteousness, In a land of honest dealings he acteth perversely,— And seeth not the splendour of Yahweh.
content_old: 10 Let favour be shewed to the lawless he hath not learned righteousness, In a land of honest dealings he acteth perversely,— And seeth not the splendour of Yahweh.

content: 11 O Yahweh though thy hand be lifted up yet do they not see, Would they might see—and turn pale at a people’s zeal,— Surely the fire of thine enemies must consume them!
content_old: 11 O Yahweh though thy hand be lifted up yet do they not see, Would they might see—and turn pale at a people’s zeal,— Surely the fire of thine enemies must consume them!

content: 12 O Yahweh thou wilt ensure prosperity for us,— For even all our works hast thou wrought for us.
content_old: 12 O Yahweh thou wilt ensure prosperity for us,— For even all our works hast thou wrought for us.

content: 13 O Yahweh､ our God! Lords other than thee､ have owned us,— By thyself alone will we call upon thy Name.
content_old: 13 O Yahweh､ our God! Lords other than thee､ have owned us,— By thyself alone will we call upon thy Name.

content: 14 The dead come not to life again, The shades do not arise,— Therefore thou hast visited and destroyed them, And caused to perish every memorial of them.
content_old: 14 The dead come not to life again, The shades do not arise,— Therefore thou hast visited and destroyed them, And caused to perish every memorial of them.

content: 15 Thou hast increased the nation､ O Yahweh, Thou hast increased the nation､ thou hast gotten thyself glory ,— Thou hast extended far､ all the ends of the land.
content_old: 15 Thou hast increased the nation､ O Yahweh, Thou hast increased the nation､ thou hast gotten thyself glory ,— Thou hast extended far､ all the ends of the land.

content: 16 O Yahweh! in distress they sought thee,— They poured out a whispered prayer, when thy chastening was upon them.
content_old: 16 O Yahweh! in distress they sought thee,— They poured out a whispered prayer, when thy chastening was upon them.

content: 17 Like as a woman with child— Draweth near to giving birth､ Is in pain, Crieth out in her pangs So were we before thee, O Yahweh;—
content_old: 17 Like as a woman with child— Draweth near to giving birth､ Is in pain, Crieth out in her pangs So were we before thee, O Yahweh;—

content: 18 We were with child— We were in pain, As it were we brought forth wind,— Salvation we could not accomplish for the earth, Neither were born the inhabitants of the world.
content_old: 18 We were with child— We were in pain, As it were we brought forth wind,— Salvation we could not accomplish for the earth, Neither were born the inhabitants of the world.

content: 19 Thy dead shall come to life again, My dead body they shall arise,— Awake and shout for joy､ ye that dwell in the dust､ For a dew of light is thy dew, And earth to the shades shall give birth.
content_old: 19 Thy dead shall come to life again, My dead body they shall arise,— Awake and shout for joy､ ye that dwell in the dust､ For a dew of light is thy dew, And earth to the shades shall give birth.

content: 20 Come､ my people､ enter into thy chambers, And shut thy doors behind thee,— Hide thee､ as it were､ a little moment､ Till the indignation pass over.
content_old: 20 Come､ my people､ enter into thy chambers, And shut thy doors behind thee,— Hide thee､ as it were､ a little moment､ Till the indignation pass over.

content: 1 In that day will Yahweh With his sword—the hard and the great and the strong Bring punishment Upon Leviathan､ the fleeing serpent, And upon Leviathan, the crooked serpent,— And will slay the monster which is in the sea.
content_old: 1 In that day will Yahweh With his sword—the hard and the great and the strong Bring punishment Upon Leviathan､ the fleeing serpent, And upon Leviathan, the crooked serpent,— And will slay the monster which is in the sea.

content: 2 In that day A Wine-Vineyard! sing ye unto her:
content_old: 2 In that day A Wine-Vineyard! sing ye unto her:

content: 3 I—Yahweh am watching over her, Every moment will I water her,— Lest anyone injure her Night and day will I watch over her.
content_old: 3 I—Yahweh am watching over her, Every moment will I water her,— Lest anyone injure her Night and day will I watch over her.

content: 4 Fury have I none,— Oh that there were delivered to me､ briars and thorns､ in battle! I would march in among them､ I would set fire to them one and all.
content_old: 4 Fury have I none,— Oh that there were delivered to me､ briars and thorns､ in battle! I would march in among them､ I would set fire to them one and all.

content: 5 Else､ let one lay hold of my protection, Let him make peace with me,— Peace let him make with me.
content_old: 5 Else､ let one lay hold of my protection, Let him make peace with me,— Peace let him make with me.

content: 6 In coming times shall Jacob strike root, Israel shall blossom and bud,— Then shall they fill the face of the world with fruit.
content_old: 6 In coming times shall Jacob strike root, Israel shall blossom and bud,— Then shall they fill the face of the world with fruit.

content: 7 Was it with the smiting of his smiter that he smote him? Or as with the slaying of his slayer was he slain?
content_old: 7 Was it with the smiting of his smiter that he smote him? Or as with the slaying of his slayer was he slain?

content: 8 By driving her away—by dismissing her wouldest thou contend with her? He removed her by his rough wind､ in a day of east wind.
content_old: 8 By driving her away—by dismissing her wouldest thou contend with her? He removed her by his rough wind､ in a day of east wind.

content: 9 Therefore hereby shall a propitiatory-covering be put over the iniquity of Jacob, And all this is the fruit of taking away his sin,— When he maketh all the stones of an altar like chalk-stones that soon crumble Sacred Stems and Sun Images shall not arise.
content_old: 9 Therefore hereby shall a propitiatory-covering be put over the iniquity of Jacob, And all this is the fruit of taking away his sin,— When he maketh all the stones of an altar like chalk-stones that soon crumble Sacred Stems and Sun Images shall not arise.

content: 10 For the fortified city is solitary, The dwelling forsaken､ and left as a wilderness,— There shall the calf feed､ And there lie down､ And shall consume the branches thereof:
content_old: 10 For the fortified city is solitary, The dwelling forsaken､ and left as a wilderness,— There shall the calf feed､ And there lie down､ And shall consume the branches thereof:

content: 11 When the cut-off boughs thereof are dry they shall be broken to pieces, Women coming､ are kindling it! For it is not a people of understanding, For this cause Will he that made him not have compassion upon him And he that formed him will shew him no favour.
content_old: 11 When the cut-off boughs thereof are dry they shall be broken to pieces, Women coming､ are kindling it! For it is not a people of understanding, For this cause Will he that made him not have compassion upon him And he that formed him will shew him no favour.

content: 12 And it shall come to pass in that day That Yahweh will beat off his fruit from the stream of the River ､ unto the torrent-valley of Egypt,— And ye shall be picked up､ one by one､ O sons of Israel.
content_old: 12 And it shall come to pass in that day That Yahweh will beat off his fruit from the stream of the River ､ unto the torrent-valley of Egypt,— And ye shall be picked up､ one by one､ O sons of Israel.

content: 1 Alas! for the proud crown of the drunkards of Ephraim, And for his fading wreath of majestic beauty,— Which is on the head of the fertile valley､ of them who are overcome with wine.
content_old: 1 Alas! for the proud crown of the drunkards of Ephraim, And for his fading wreath of majestic beauty,— Which is on the head of the fertile valley､ of them who are overcome with wine.

content: 2 Lo! My Lord hath one who is strong and bold, Like a storm of hail､ a destroying tempest, Like a storm of mighty waters over-flowing Hath he thrust it down to the earth with force:
content_old: 2 Lo! My Lord hath one who is strong and bold, Like a storm of hail､ a destroying tempest, Like a storm of mighty waters over-flowing Hath he thrust it down to the earth with force:

content: 3 With the feet shall be trodden down the proud crown of the drunkards of Ephraim!
content_old: 3 With the feet shall be trodden down the proud crown of the drunkards of Ephraim!

content: 4 So shall his fading wreath of majestic beauty､ Which is on the head of the fertile valley､ become— Like the first-ripe fig before fruit-harvest, Which when he that looketh upon it seeth､ while it is yet in his hand he swalloweth it up.
content_old: 4 So shall his fading wreath of majestic beauty､ Which is on the head of the fertile valley､ become— Like the first-ripe fig before fruit-harvest, Which when he that looketh upon it seeth､ while it is yet in his hand he swalloweth it up.

content: 5 In that day will Yahweh of hosts become A crown of beauty, and A diadem of majesty,— Unto the remnant of his people:
content_old: 5 In that day will Yahweh of hosts become A crown of beauty, and A diadem of majesty,— Unto the remnant of his people:

content: 6 Even a spirit of justice—to him that presideth over justice, And strength to them who would turn back the battle at the gate.
content_old: 6 Even a spirit of justice—to him that presideth over justice, And strength to them who would turn back the battle at the gate.

content: 7 But as for these With wine do they reel, and With strong drink do they stagger,— Priest and prophet reel with strong drink They are swallowed up through wine､ They stagger through strong drink, They reel in prophetic vision, They totter in pronouncing judgment.
content_old: 7 But as for these With wine do they reel, and With strong drink do they stagger,— Priest and prophet reel with strong drink They are swallowed up through wine､ They stagger through strong drink, They reel in prophetic vision, They totter in pronouncing judgment.

content: 8 For all tables are full of filthy vomit,— There is no place!
content_old: 8 For all tables are full of filthy vomit,— There is no place!

content: 9 Whom would he teach knowledge? And whom would he cause to understand the message? Them who are weaned from the milk? taken from the breasts?
content_old: 9 Whom would he teach knowledge? And whom would he cause to understand the message? Them who are weaned from the milk? taken from the breasts?

content: 10 For it is— Precept upon precept､ precept upon precept, Line upon line､ line upon line,— A little here､ a little there.
content_old: 10 For it is— Precept upon precept､ precept upon precept, Line upon line､ line upon line,— A little here､ a little there.

content: 11 For with a jabbering lip, and with an alien tongue must he speak unto this people!
content_old: 11 For with a jabbering lip, and with an alien tongue must he speak unto this people!

content: 12 To whom he said— This is the rest—give ye rest to the weary, and This is the quietness,— But they were unwilling to hear.
content_old: 12 To whom he said— This is the rest—give ye rest to the weary, and This is the quietness,— But they were unwilling to hear.

content: 13 So the word of Yahweh must be to them— Precept upon precept､ precept upon precept, Line upon line､ line upon line, A little here､ a little there,— That they may go､ and fall backward､ and be torn､ and snared､ and captured.
content_old: 13 So the word of Yahweh must be to them— Precept upon precept､ precept upon precept, Line upon line､ line upon line, A little here､ a little there,— That they may go､ and fall backward､ and be torn､ and snared､ and captured.

content: 14 Wherefore､ hear ye the word of Yahweh, Ye men who scoff,— Ye rulers of this people that is in Jerusalem.
content_old: 14 Wherefore､ hear ye the word of Yahweh, Ye men who scoff,— Ye rulers of this people that is in Jerusalem.

content: 15 Because ye have said— We have solemnised a covenant with death, And with hades have we effected a vision,— The overflowing scourge､ when it sweepeth by shall not reach unto us, For we have made lying our refuge､ And in falsehood have we hid ourselves
content_old: 15 Because ye have said— We have solemnised a covenant with death, And with hades have we effected a vision,— The overflowing scourge､ when it sweepeth by shall not reach unto us, For we have made lying our refuge､ And in falsehood have we hid ourselves

content: 16 Therefore Thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh, Behold me! founding in Zion､ a stone, A stone of testing､ The costly corner of a well-laid foundation, He that trusteth shall not make haste!
content_old: 16 Therefore Thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh, Behold me! founding in Zion､ a stone, A stone of testing､ The costly corner of a well-laid foundation, He that trusteth shall not make haste!

content: 17 But I will make— Justice the line, and Righteousness the plummet,— And the hail shall sweep away your refuge of lying, And your hiding-place the waters shall overflow;
content_old: 17 But I will make— Justice the line, and Righteousness the plummet,— And the hail shall sweep away your refuge of lying, And your hiding-place the waters shall overflow;

content: 18 So shall be wiped out your covenant with death, And your vision with hades not stand,— When the overflowing scourge sweepeth past then shall ye be thereby beaten down:
content_old: 18 So shall be wiped out your covenant with death, And your vision with hades not stand,— When the overflowing scourge sweepeth past then shall ye be thereby beaten down:

content: 19 As often as it sweepeth past it shall take you away, For morning by morning shall it pass along､ By day and by night,— And it shall be nothing less than a terror､ to make out the message;
content_old: 19 As often as it sweepeth past it shall take you away, For morning by morning shall it pass along､ By day and by night,— And it shall be nothing less than a terror､ to make out the message;

content: 20 For too short is the couch to stretch oneself out,— And the coverlet too narrow､ when one draweth up his feet.
content_old: 20 For too short is the couch to stretch oneself out,— And the coverlet too narrow､ when one draweth up his feet.

content: 21 For as in Mount Perazim will Yahweh arise, As in the vale of Gibeon will he be stirred,— To do his work—foreign is his work, And to perform his task—strange is his task.
content_old: 21 For as in Mount Perazim will Yahweh arise, As in the vale of Gibeon will he be stirred,— To do his work—foreign is his work, And to perform his task—strange is his task.
