content: 22 Now therefore､ do not show yourselves scoffers, Lest your fetters be bound fast,— For of a full end､ and that a decreed one have I heard from My Lord Yahweh of hosts､ upon all the land.
content_old: 22 Now therefore､ do not show yourselves scoffers, Lest your fetters be bound fast,— For of a full end､ and that a decreed one have I heard from My Lord Yahweh of hosts､ upon all the land.

content: 23 Give ear､ and hear ye my voice,— Hearken､ and hear ye my speech:—
content_old: 23 Give ear､ and hear ye my voice,— Hearken､ and hear ye my speech:—

content: 24 All day long doth the plowman plow for sowing? Doth he continue laying open and harrowing his soil?
content_old: 24 All day long doth the plowman plow for sowing? Doth he continue laying open and harrowing his soil?

content: 25 Doth he not when he hath levelled the face thereof Cast abroad the fennel? And the cummin doth he not scatter? And plant wheat in rows､ And barley in a lot, And spelt in the border thereof?
content_old: 25 Doth he not when he hath levelled the face thereof Cast abroad the fennel? And the cummin doth he not scatter? And plant wheat in rows､ And barley in a lot, And spelt in the border thereof?

content: 26 Yea､ One hath trained him to good judgment, His God directeth him.
content_old: 26 Yea､ One hath trained him to good judgment, His God directeth him.

content: 27 For not with a sledge must black coriander be threshed, Nor must the wheel of a cart on cummin be turned, But with a staff must fennel be beaten, And cummin with a rod:
content_old: 27 For not with a sledge must black coriander be threshed, Nor must the wheel of a cart on cummin be turned, But with a staff must fennel be beaten, And cummin with a rod:

content: 28 Bread-corn must be crushed,— Yet would he not be evermore threshing it, So he hasteneth over it the wheel of his cart､ with his horsemen, He crusheth it not!
content_old: 28 Bread-corn must be crushed,— Yet would he not be evermore threshing it, So he hasteneth over it the wheel of his cart､ with his horsemen, He crusheth it not!

content: 1 Alas for Ariel, Ariel, The city against which David encamped,— Add ye a year to a year､ Let the festivals come round;
content_old: 1 Alas for Ariel, Ariel, The city against which David encamped,— Add ye a year to a year､ Let the festivals come round;

content: 2 Yet will I bring Ariel into straits,— And she shall become a bewailing and wailing, Yea she shall become to me a veritable Hearth of God.
content_old: 2 Yet will I bring Ariel into straits,— And she shall become a bewailing and wailing, Yea she shall become to me a veritable Hearth of God.

content: 3 And I will encamp round about against thee,— And lay siege against thee with a fort, And raise against thee siege-works;
content_old: 3 And I will encamp round about against thee,— And lay siege against thee with a fort, And raise against thee siege-works;

content: 4 And thou shalt be brought low— Out of the earth shalt thou speak, And out of the dust shalt thou lower thine utterance,— And as one that hath a familiar spirit Out of the earth shall come thy voice, And out of the dust thy speech shall chirp;
content_old: 4 And thou shalt be brought low— Out of the earth shalt thou speak, And out of the dust shalt thou lower thine utterance,— And as one that hath a familiar spirit Out of the earth shall come thy voice, And out of the dust thy speech shall chirp;

content: 5 Then shall be as fine dust the multitude of thy foreigners,— And as chaff that passeth away the multitude of tyrants; And it shall come to pass､ in a twinkling､ suddenly.
content_old: 5 Then shall be as fine dust the multitude of thy foreigners,— And as chaff that passeth away the multitude of tyrants; And it shall come to pass､ in a twinkling､ suddenly.

content: 6 From Yahweh of hosts shalt thou be visited, With thunder､ and with earthquake､ and a great noise,—hurricane and storm､ and a flame of fire devouring;
content_old: 6 From Yahweh of hosts shalt thou be visited, With thunder､ and with earthquake､ and a great noise,—hurricane and storm､ and a flame of fire devouring;

content: 7 And it shall be like the dream of a night vision, With the multitude of all the nations who have been making war against Ariel,— Even with all who have been making war against her､ and her stronghold and who have been laying siege to her;
content_old: 7 And it shall be like the dream of a night vision, With the multitude of all the nations who have been making war against Ariel,— Even with all who have been making war against her､ and her stronghold and who have been laying siege to her;

content: 8 Yea it shall be As when the hungry man dreameth､ and lo! he is eating, But he awaketh､ and his soul is empty , Or as when the thirsty man dreameth､ and lo! he is drinking, But he awaketh､ and lo! he is faint､ and his soul is craving So shall it be with the multitude of all the nations, that have come forth to war against Mount Zion.
content_old: 8 Yea it shall be As when the hungry man dreameth､ and lo! he is eating, But he awaketh､ and his soul is empty , Or as when the thirsty man dreameth､ and lo! he is drinking, But he awaketh､ and lo! he is faint､ and his soul is craving So shall it be with the multitude of all the nations, that have come forth to war against Mount Zion.

content: 9 Stand ye stock still､ and stare, Besmear your eyes､ and be blind,— They are drunken､ but not with wine, They reel､ but not with strong drink;
content_old: 9 Stand ye stock still､ and stare, Besmear your eyes､ and be blind,— They are drunken､ but not with wine, They reel､ but not with strong drink;

content: 10 For Yahweh hath poured out upon you a spirit of deep sleep, Yea hath tightly shut your eyes—the prophets,— And your heads—the seers hath he covered,
content_old: 10 For Yahweh hath poured out upon you a spirit of deep sleep, Yea hath tightly shut your eyes—the prophets,— And your heads—the seers hath he covered,

content: 11 And so all vision hath become unto you､ as the words of a writing that is sealed, Which is delivered unto one acquainted with writing､ saying, Pray thee､ read this, And he saith, I cannot, for it is sealed;
content_old: 11 And so all vision hath become unto you､ as the words of a writing that is sealed, Which is delivered unto one acquainted with writing､ saying, Pray thee､ read this, And he saith, I cannot, for it is sealed;

content: 12 And then the writing is delivered to one unacquainted with writing､ saying, Pray thee､ read this, And he saith､ I am not acquainted with writing.
content_old: 12 And then the writing is delivered to one unacquainted with writing､ saying, Pray thee､ read this, And he saith､ I am not acquainted with writing.

content: 13 Wherefore My Lord hath said,— Because this people hath drawn near with their mouth､ And with their lips have honoured me, But their heart have they moved far from me, And so their reverence of me hath become A commandment of men in which they have been schooled
content_old: 13 Wherefore My Lord hath said,— Because this people hath drawn near with their mouth､ And with their lips have honoured me, But their heart have they moved far from me, And so their reverence of me hath become A commandment of men in which they have been schooled

content: 14 Therefore behold me! again dealing wonderfully with this people､ doing wonderfully a wonderful thing,— So shall perish the wisdom of their wise men, And the intelligence of their intelligent men shall vanish!
content_old: 14 Therefore behold me! again dealing wonderfully with this people､ doing wonderfully a wonderful thing,— So shall perish the wisdom of their wise men, And the intelligence of their intelligent men shall vanish!

content: 15 Alas! for them who would fain have been too deep for Yahweh､ by giving secret counsel,—and therefore in the dark have been their doings, and they have said Who can see us? and— Who can understand us?
content_old: 15 Alas! for them who would fain have been too deep for Yahweh､ by giving secret counsel,—and therefore in the dark have been their doings, and they have said Who can see us? and— Who can understand us?

content: 16 Your perverseness! As if like clay the potter could be reckoned; For shall the thing made say of him that made it He made me not? Or hath the thing fashioned ever said of him that fashioned it He hath no understanding?
content_old: 16 Your perverseness! As if like clay the potter could be reckoned; For shall the thing made say of him that made it He made me not? Or hath the thing fashioned ever said of him that fashioned it He hath no understanding?

content: 17 Is it not yet a very little while, And Lebanon shall be turned into garden land,— And garden land for a forest be reckoned?
content_old: 17 Is it not yet a very little while, And Lebanon shall be turned into garden land,— And garden land for a forest be reckoned?

content: 18 Therefore､ in that day､ shall the deaf hear the words of a book,— And out of gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind shall see;
content_old: 18 Therefore､ in that day､ shall the deaf hear the words of a book,— And out of gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind shall see;

content: 19 And again shall the humbled､ in Yahweh have joy,— And the needy of mankind in the Holy One of Israel exult;
content_old: 19 And again shall the humbled､ in Yahweh have joy,— And the needy of mankind in the Holy One of Israel exult;

content: 20 For the tyrant hath vanished､ And the scoffer is no more, Yea cut off are all who watch for iniquity:—
content_old: 20 For the tyrant hath vanished､ And the scoffer is no more, Yea cut off are all who watch for iniquity:—

content: 21 Who bring a man into condemnation with a rumour, And for him that decideth in the gate lay a snare,— And have driven away､ for a thing of nought､ one who was righteous.
content_old: 21 Who bring a man into condemnation with a rumour, And for him that decideth in the gate lay a snare,— And have driven away､ for a thing of nought､ one who was righteous.

content: 22 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ concerning the house of Jacob, even he saith it who redeemed Abraham;— Not now shall Jacob turn pale, And not now shall their faces whiten;
content_old: 22 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ concerning the house of Jacob, even he saith it who redeemed Abraham;— Not now shall Jacob turn pale, And not now shall their faces whiten;

content: 23 For when he seeth his children､ the work of my hands､ in his midst They will hallow my Name,— Yea they will hallow the Holy One of Jacob, And the God of Israel will they regard with awe.
content_old: 23 For when he seeth his children､ the work of my hands､ in his midst They will hallow my Name,— Yea they will hallow the Holy One of Jacob, And the God of Israel will they regard with awe.

content: 1 Alas! for sons who are rebellious､ Declareth Yahweh. Executing a purpose､ but not from me, And pouring out a libation､ but not from my spirit,— That they may add sin to sin:
content_old: 1 Alas! for sons who are rebellious､ Declareth Yahweh. Executing a purpose､ but not from me, And pouring out a libation､ but not from my spirit,— That they may add sin to sin:

content: 2 Who are setting out to go down to Egypt, But at my mouth have not asked,— Betaking them to the protection of Pharaoh, And seeking refuge under the shadow of Egypt.
content_old: 2 Who are setting out to go down to Egypt, But at my mouth have not asked,— Betaking them to the protection of Pharaoh, And seeking refuge under the shadow of Egypt.

content: 3 Therefore shall the protection of Pharaoh become to you a shame, And the refuge in the shadow of Egypt an insult;
content_old: 3 Therefore shall the protection of Pharaoh become to you a shame, And the refuge in the shadow of Egypt an insult;

content: 4 For their princes have been in Zoan ,— And their messengers unto Hanes would draw near.
content_old: 4 For their princes have been in Zoan ,— And their messengers unto Hanes would draw near.

content: 5 Every one hath felt ashamed of a people that could not serve them,— Neither with help､ nor with service, But they are a shame､ yea even a reproach.
content_old: 5 Every one hath felt ashamed of a people that could not serve them,— Neither with help､ nor with service, But they are a shame､ yea even a reproach.

content: 6 The Oracle on the Beasts of the South,— Through a land of distress and oppression— Lioness and lion coming therefrom､ Viper and fiery flying serpent They would carry､ on the shoulders of young asses､ their wealth､ And､ on the humps of camels､ their treasures､ Unto a people that cannot serve them.
content_old: 6 The Oracle on the Beasts of the South,— Through a land of distress and oppression— Lioness and lion coming therefrom､ Viper and fiery flying serpent They would carry､ on the shoulders of young asses､ their wealth､ And､ on the humps of camels､ their treasures､ Unto a people that cannot serve them.

content: 7 But the Egyptians with vanity and emptiness would help,— Therefore have I proclaimed concerning this, Insolent! they sit still!
content_old: 7 But the Egyptians with vanity and emptiness would help,— Therefore have I proclaimed concerning this, Insolent! they sit still!

content: 8 Now enter— Write it upon a tablet before them､ And upon a scroll inscribe it,— That it may serve for a later day, For futurity､ unto times age-abiding:—
content_old: 8 Now enter— Write it upon a tablet before them､ And upon a scroll inscribe it,— That it may serve for a later day, For futurity､ unto times age-abiding:—

content: 9 That it is a rebellious people Sons､ apt at deceiving,— Sons､ unwilling to hear the law of Yahweh:
content_old: 9 That it is a rebellious people Sons､ apt at deceiving,— Sons､ unwilling to hear the law of Yahweh:

content: 10 Who have said to the seers, Ye must not see! To the prophets､ Ye must not prophesy to us reproofs! Speak to us smooth things, Prophesy delusions:
content_old: 10 Who have said to the seers, Ye must not see! To the prophets､ Ye must not prophesy to us reproofs! Speak to us smooth things, Prophesy delusions:

content: 11 Depart ye from the way, Turn aside from the path,— Desist､ from setting before us the､ Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 11 Depart ye from the way, Turn aside from the path,— Desist､ from setting before us the､ Holy One of Israel.

content: 12 Therefore— Thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye have rejected this word,— And have trusted in oppression and perverseness, And have relied thereon
content_old: 12 Therefore— Thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye have rejected this word,— And have trusted in oppression and perverseness, And have relied thereon

content: 13 Therefore shall this iniquity become to you As a breach ready to fall, A bulging in a high wall,— Whose breaking down cometh suddenly in a twinkling.
content_old: 13 Therefore shall this iniquity become to you As a breach ready to fall, A bulging in a high wall,— Whose breaking down cometh suddenly in a twinkling.

content: 14 Yea he will break it—as the breaking of the pitcher of a potter､ crushed he will not spare; So that there shall not be found､ when it is smashed A sherd wherewith to snatch fire from a hearth, Or to skim off water out of a cistern.
content_old: 14 Yea he will break it—as the breaking of the pitcher of a potter､ crushed he will not spare; So that there shall not be found､ when it is smashed A sherd wherewith to snatch fire from a hearth, Or to skim off water out of a cistern.

content: 15 For thus said my Lord Yahweh､ the Holy One of Israel— By returning and resting shall ye be saved, In keeping quiet and trusting shall be your strength,— Howbeit ye would not!
content_old: 15 For thus said my Lord Yahweh､ the Holy One of Israel— By returning and resting shall ye be saved, In keeping quiet and trusting shall be your strength,— Howbeit ye would not!

content: 16 But ye said､— Nay! but on horses will we flee､ For this cause shall ye indeed flee,— And on the swift will we ride, For this cause swift shall be your pursuers:
content_old: 16 But ye said､— Nay! but on horses will we flee､ For this cause shall ye indeed flee,— And on the swift will we ride, For this cause swift shall be your pursuers:

content: 17 One thousand before the war-cry of one—before the war-cry of five shall ye flee,— Until ye have been left､ As a pole on the top of a mountain, And as an ensign upon a hill.
content_old: 17 One thousand before the war-cry of one—before the war-cry of five shall ye flee,— Until ye have been left､ As a pole on the top of a mountain, And as an ensign upon a hill.

content: 18 And therefore will Yahweh wait､ That he may grant you favour, And therefore will he lift himself up､ That he may show you compassion,— For A God of justice is Yahweh, How happy all they who are waiting for him
content_old: 18 And therefore will Yahweh wait､ That he may grant you favour, And therefore will he lift himself up､ That he may show you compassion,— For A God of justice is Yahweh, How happy all they who are waiting for him

content: 19 For a people In Zion shall dwell In Jerusalem,— As for weeping thou shalt not weep! As for favour he will grant thee favour､ at the sound of thine outcry,— As soon as he heareth he hath answered thee!
content_old: 19 For a people In Zion shall dwell In Jerusalem,— As for weeping thou shalt not weep! As for favour he will grant thee favour､ at the sound of thine outcry,— As soon as he heareth he hath answered thee!

content: 20 Though My Lord should give you bread in short measure､ and water in scant allowance Yet will thy Teacher not hide himself any more, But thine eyes shall ever be looking on thy Teacher.
content_old: 20 Though My Lord should give you bread in short measure､ and water in scant allowance Yet will thy Teacher not hide himself any more, But thine eyes shall ever be looking on thy Teacher.

content: 21 So shall thine own ears hear a word from behind thee saying,— This is the way､ walk ye therein, When ye would turn to the right hand､ Or when ye would turn to the left.
content_old: 21 So shall thine own ears hear a word from behind thee saying,— This is the way､ walk ye therein, When ye would turn to the right hand､ Or when ye would turn to the left.

content: 22 Then will ye defile— The overlaying of thy graven images of silver, And the coating of thy molten image of gold,— Thou wilt cast them away､ as a woman the token of her sickness, Begone! shalt thou say thereto.
content_old: 22 Then will ye defile— The overlaying of thy graven images of silver, And the coating of thy molten image of gold,— Thou wilt cast them away､ as a woman the token of her sickness, Begone! shalt thou say thereto.

content: 23 Then will he give— Rain for thy seed—wherewith thou shalt sow thy ground､ and Bread as the increase of thy ground, which shall be fertile and fat,— Thy cattle､ in that day､ shall feed in broad pasture:
content_old: 23 Then will he give— Rain for thy seed—wherewith thou shalt sow thy ground､ and Bread as the increase of thy ground, which shall be fertile and fat,— Thy cattle､ in that day､ shall feed in broad pasture:

content: 24 And the oxen and the young asses that till the ground salted provender shall eat､ which hath been winnowed with shovel or fan.
content_old: 24 And the oxen and the young asses that till the ground salted provender shall eat､ which hath been winnowed with shovel or fan.

content: 25 Then shall there be､ On every lofty mountain､ and On every lifted hill, Channels､ Conduits of water,— In the great day of slaughter､ When the towers fall.
content_old: 25 Then shall there be､ On every lofty mountain､ and On every lifted hill, Channels､ Conduits of water,— In the great day of slaughter､ When the towers fall.

content: 26 Then shall the light of the moon be as the light of the sun, And the light of the sun shall be sevenfold as the light of seven days,— In the day— When Yahweh bindeth up the laceration of his people, and When the severe wound caused by smiting them he healeth.
content_old: 26 Then shall the light of the moon be as the light of the sun, And the light of the sun shall be sevenfold as the light of seven days,— In the day— When Yahweh bindeth up the laceration of his people, and When the severe wound caused by smiting them he healeth.

content: 27 Lo! the Name of Yahweh coming in from afar, His anger kindling, A heavy storm,— His lips are full of indignation, And his tongue is like a fire that devoureth;
content_old: 27 Lo! the Name of Yahweh coming in from afar, His anger kindling, A heavy storm,— His lips are full of indignation, And his tongue is like a fire that devoureth;

content: 28 And his breath like an overflowing torrent even unto the neck doth reach, To sift nations with a sieve of calamity,— A bridle leading to ruin being upon the jaws of the peoples.
content_old: 28 And his breath like an overflowing torrent even unto the neck doth reach, To sift nations with a sieve of calamity,— A bridle leading to ruin being upon the jaws of the peoples.

content: 29 A song shall ye have, As in the night of hallowing a festival,— And gladness of heart, As when one goeth with the flute to enter Into the mountain of Yahweh､ Unto the Rock of Israel.
content_old: 29 A song shall ye have, As in the night of hallowing a festival,— And gladness of heart, As when one goeth with the flute to enter Into the mountain of Yahweh､ Unto the Rock of Israel.

content: 30 Then will Yahweh cause to be heard —the resounding of his voice､ And the bringing down of his arm shall be seen, In a rage of anger､ And with the flame of a devouring fire,— A burst and a downpour､ and a hailstone!
content_old: 30 Then will Yahweh cause to be heard —the resounding of his voice､ And the bringing down of his arm shall be seen, In a rage of anger､ And with the flame of a devouring fire,— A burst and a downpour､ and a hailstone!

content: 31 For at the voice of Yahweh shall Assyria be crushed ,— With his rod will he smite.
content_old: 31 For at the voice of Yahweh shall Assyria be crushed ,— With his rod will he smite.

content: 32 And it shall come to pass,—that every stroke of the staff of doom､ which Yahweh shall lay upon him shall be with timbrels､ and with lyres,—when with battles of brandished weapons he hath fought against them.
content_old: 32 And it shall come to pass,—that every stroke of the staff of doom､ which Yahweh shall lay upon him shall be with timbrels､ and with lyres,—when with battles of brandished weapons he hath fought against them.

content: 1 Alas! for them who are going down to Egypt for help, On horses would rely,— And have trusted— In chariots—because they are many､ and In horsemen､ because they are very bold, But have not looked unto the Holy One of Israel, And unto Yahweh have not sought.
content_old: 1 Alas! for them who are going down to Egypt for help, On horses would rely,— And have trusted— In chariots—because they are many､ and In horsemen､ because they are very bold, But have not looked unto the Holy One of Israel, And unto Yahweh have not sought.

content: 2 But he also is wise､ and hath brought in calamity, And his own words hath he not set aside,— Therefore will he rise up Against the house of evil-doers, and Against the help of the workers of iniquity.
content_old: 2 But he also is wise､ and hath brought in calamity, And his own words hath he not set aside,— Therefore will he rise up Against the house of evil-doers, and Against the help of the workers of iniquity.

content: 3 Now the Egyptians are men and not GOD, And their horses flesh and not spirit; When Yahweh shall stretch out his hand Then he that is giving help shall stumble､ And he that is receiving help shall fall, And together shall all of them vanish!
content_old: 3 Now the Egyptians are men and not GOD, And their horses flesh and not spirit; When Yahweh shall stretch out his hand Then he that is giving help shall stumble､ And he that is receiving help shall fall, And together shall all of them vanish!

content: 4 For Thus hath Yahweh said unto me— Like as a lion or a young lion growleth over his prey､ Who—though there be called out against him a multitude of shepherds— Will not at their voice be dismayed, Nor at their noise be daunted So will Yahweh of hosts come down､ to make war over Mount Zion, and over the hill thereof.
content_old: 4 For Thus hath Yahweh said unto me— Like as a lion or a young lion growleth over his prey､ Who—though there be called out against him a multitude of shepherds— Will not at their voice be dismayed, Nor at their noise be daunted So will Yahweh of hosts come down､ to make war over Mount Zion, and over the hill thereof.

content: 5 As little mother-birds hovering so will Yahweh of hosts throw a covering over Jerusalem,— Covering so will he rescue､ Passing over so will he deliver!
content_old: 5 As little mother-birds hovering so will Yahweh of hosts throw a covering over Jerusalem,— Covering so will he rescue､ Passing over so will he deliver!

content: 6 Return ye unto him､ against whom the sons of Israel have deeply revolted,
content_old: 6 Return ye unto him､ against whom the sons of Israel have deeply revolted,

content: 7 For in that day will every man reject his idols of silver, and his idols of gold,— Which your hands had made for you as a sin !
content_old: 7 For in that day will every man reject his idols of silver, and his idols of gold,— Which your hands had made for you as a sin !

content: 8 Then shall the Assyrian fall､ by the sword､ not of a great man, And the sword､ not of a mean man shall devour him,— Howbeit he shall take his flight from the face of a sword, And his young men shall come under tribute;
content_old: 8 Then shall the Assyrian fall､ by the sword､ not of a great man, And the sword､ not of a mean man shall devour him,— Howbeit he shall take his flight from the face of a sword, And his young men shall come under tribute;

content: 1 Lo! in righteousness shall reign a king Yea even princes with equity shall bear rule.
content_old: 1 Lo! in righteousness shall reign a king Yea even princes with equity shall bear rule.

content: 2 So shall each one become As a hiding-place from the wind And a covert from the storm,— As channels of water in a dry place, As the shadow of a massive cliff in a weary land.
content_old: 2 So shall each one become As a hiding-place from the wind And a covert from the storm,— As channels of water in a dry place, As the shadow of a massive cliff in a weary land.

content: 3 And the eyes of them who are ready to see､ shall not be closed,— And the ears of them who are ready to hear shall hearken;
content_old: 3 And the eyes of them who are ready to see､ shall not be closed,— And the ears of them who are ready to hear shall hearken;

content: 4 And the heart of the hurried shall take note of knowledge, And the tongue of stammerers shall make haste to speak plainly.
content_old: 4 And the heart of the hurried shall take note of knowledge, And the tongue of stammerers shall make haste to speak plainly.

content: 5 A base man shall no longer be called noble,— Nor a knave be named liberal;
content_old: 5 A base man shall no longer be called noble,— Nor a knave be named liberal;

content: 6 For a base man with baseness will speak, And his heart will practise iniquity,— Practising profanity, And speaking､ against Yahweh that which misleadeth, Emptying the soul of the hungry, And the drink of the thirsty he causeth to fail;
content_old: 6 For a base man with baseness will speak, And his heart will practise iniquity,— Practising profanity, And speaking､ against Yahweh that which misleadeth, Emptying the soul of the hungry, And the drink of the thirsty he causeth to fail;

content: 7 Yea a knave his weapons are wicked,— He base schemes hath devised To ruin the oppressed with speeches of falsehood､ Even when the needy pleadeth for justice.
content_old: 7 Yea a knave his weapons are wicked,— He base schemes hath devised To ruin the oppressed with speeches of falsehood､ Even when the needy pleadeth for justice.

content: 8 But a noble man noble things hath devised,— And he upon noble things will stand.
content_old: 8 But a noble man noble things hath devised,— And he upon noble things will stand.

content: 9 Ye women in comfort! arise､ hear my voice, Ye daughters so confident､ give ear to my speech:—
content_old: 9 Ye women in comfort! arise､ hear my voice, Ye daughters so confident､ give ear to my speech:—

content: 10 Some days beyond a year ye shall be troubled､ ye confident ones,— For failed hath the vintage, No gathering cometh in.
content_old: 10 Some days beyond a year ye shall be troubled､ ye confident ones,— For failed hath the vintage, No gathering cometh in.

content: 11 Tremble､ ye women in comfort, Be troubled､ ye daughters so confident,— Strip! and bare yourselves, and gird somewhat on your loins:
content_old: 11 Tremble､ ye women in comfort, Be troubled､ ye daughters so confident,— Strip! and bare yourselves, and gird somewhat on your loins:

content: 12 Upon your breasts continue smiting: For desirable fields, For fruitful vine.
content_old: 12 Upon your breasts continue smiting: For desirable fields, For fruitful vine.

content: 13 Over the soil of my people thorns and briars shall grow,— Yea､ over all houses of joy, thou city exultant!
content_old: 13 Over the soil of my people thorns and briars shall grow,— Yea､ over all houses of joy, thou city exultant!

content: 14 For the palace is abandoned, The tumult of the city hath ceased— Hill and watch-tower serve as caves､ unto times age-abiding, The joy of wild-asses､ The pasture of flocks:—
content_old: 14 For the palace is abandoned, The tumult of the city hath ceased— Hill and watch-tower serve as caves､ unto times age-abiding, The joy of wild-asses､ The pasture of flocks:—

content: 15 Until there be poured out upon us the spirit､ from on high,— Then shall the wilderness become gardenland, And the garden-land for a forest be reckoned;
content_old: 15 Until there be poured out upon us the spirit､ from on high,— Then shall the wilderness become gardenland, And the garden-land for a forest be reckoned;

content: 16 Then shall justice inhabit the wilderness, And righteousness in the garden-land shall abide;
content_old: 16 Then shall justice inhabit the wilderness, And righteousness in the garden-land shall abide;

content: 17 And the yield of righteousness shall be peace,— And the tillage of righteousness quietness and confidence to times age-abiding;
content_old: 17 And the yield of righteousness shall be peace,— And the tillage of righteousness quietness and confidence to times age-abiding;

content: 18 And my people shall dwell In a home of peace,—and In habitations of security, and In resting-places of comfort､
content_old: 18 And my people shall dwell In a home of peace,—and In habitations of security, and In resting-places of comfort､

content: 19 But it shall hail during the felling of the forest, And in a sunken place shall the city sink.
content_old: 19 But it shall hail during the felling of the forest, And in a sunken place shall the city sink.

content: 1 Alas! thou plunderer､ when thou hadst not been plundered, And thou traitor､ when they had not betrayed thee: When thou hast ceased plundering thou shalt be plundered, When thou hast left off betraying､ they shall betray thee.
content_old: 1 Alas! thou plunderer､ when thou hadst not been plundered, And thou traitor､ when they had not betrayed thee: When thou hast ceased plundering thou shalt be plundered, When thou hast left off betraying､ they shall betray thee.

content: 2 O Yahweh! shew us favour,— For thee have we waited,— Be thou their arm every morning, Yea our salvation in the time of distress.
content_old: 2 O Yahweh! shew us favour,— For thee have we waited,— Be thou their arm every morning, Yea our salvation in the time of distress.

content: 3 At the noise of a tumult the peoples retreated,— When thou didst lift thyself up nations were scattered.
content_old: 3 At the noise of a tumult the peoples retreated,— When thou didst lift thyself up nations were scattered.

content: 4 Then shall your spoil be gathered as the gathering of the caterpillar,— As the swift running of locusts is he about to run upon them.
content_old: 4 Then shall your spoil be gathered as the gathering of the caterpillar,— As the swift running of locusts is he about to run upon them.

content: 5 Exalted is Yahweh, for he inhabiteth a height,— He hath filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
content_old: 5 Exalted is Yahweh, for he inhabiteth a height,— He hath filled Zion with justice and righteousness.

content: 6 So shall a wealth of deliverances､ wisdom and knowledge､ become the stability of thy times,— The reverence of Yahweh the same is his treasure.
content_old: 6 So shall a wealth of deliverances､ wisdom and knowledge､ become the stability of thy times,— The reverence of Yahweh the same is his treasure.

content: 7 Lo! their heroes have cried out openly,— The messengers of peacell in bitterness continue weeping they say:
content_old: 7 Lo! their heroes have cried out openly,— The messengers of peacell in bitterness continue weeping they say:

content: 8 The highways are deserted, The passer-by on the path hath ceased,— He hath broken covenant､ He hath despised cities, He hath made no account of men.
content_old: 8 The highways are deserted, The passer-by on the path hath ceased,— He hath broken covenant､ He hath despised cities, He hath made no account of men.

content: 9 The land mourneth､ languisheth, Lebanon displayeth shame､ is withered,— Sharon hath become as the waste plain, And Bashan and Carmel are shaking off their leaves.
content_old: 9 The land mourneth､ languisheth, Lebanon displayeth shame､ is withered,— Sharon hath become as the waste plain, And Bashan and Carmel are shaking off their leaves.

content: 10 Now will I arise､ Saith Yahweh, Now will I lift myself up, Now will I be exalted!
content_old: 10 Now will I arise､ Saith Yahweh, Now will I lift myself up, Now will I be exalted!

content: 11 Ye shall conceive chaff､ Ye shall bring forth stubble,— Your own breath like fire shall devour you.
content_old: 11 Ye shall conceive chaff､ Ye shall bring forth stubble,— Your own breath like fire shall devour you.

content: 12 So shall peoples become as the burnings of lime,— As thorns lopped off with fire shall they be burned.
content_old: 12 So shall peoples become as the burnings of lime,— As thorns lopped off with fire shall they be burned.

content: 13 Hear—ye that are far off､ what I have done, And know—ye that are near､ my might:
content_old: 13 Hear—ye that are far off､ what I have done, And know—ye that are near､ my might:

content: 14 Terror-stricken in Zion—are sinners, Shuddering hath seized the impious,— Who among us can sojourn with a fire that devoureth? Who among us can sojourn with burnings age-abiding?
content_old: 14 Terror-stricken in Zion—are sinners, Shuddering hath seized the impious,— Who among us can sojourn with a fire that devoureth? Who among us can sojourn with burnings age-abiding?

content: 15 He that walketh righteously, And speaketh uprightly,— He that refuseth the gain of exactions､ That shaketh his hands free from holding a bribe, That stoppeth his ear from hearkening to deeds of blood, And shutteth his eyes from giving countenance to wrong
content_old: 15 He that walketh righteously, And speaketh uprightly,— He that refuseth the gain of exactions､ That shaketh his hands free from holding a bribe, That stoppeth his ear from hearkening to deeds of blood, And shutteth his eyes from giving countenance to wrong

content: 16 He the heights shall inhabit, A stronghold of crags shall be his refuge,— His bread hath been delivered, His waters have been made sure.
content_old: 16 He the heights shall inhabit, A stronghold of crags shall be his refuge,— His bread hath been delivered, His waters have been made sure.

content: 17 Of a king､ in his beauty shall thine eyes have vision: They shall see a land that stretcheth afar.
content_old: 17 Of a king､ in his beauty shall thine eyes have vision: They shall see a land that stretcheth afar.

content: 18 Thy heart may murmur in terror,— Where is the scribe? Where—the receiver? Where—he that maketh a list of the towers?
content_old: 18 Thy heart may murmur in terror,— Where is the scribe? Where—the receiver? Where—he that maketh a list of the towers?

content: 19 The fierce people shalt thou not see,— The people of too deep a lip to be understood, of too barbarous a tongue for thee to comprehend.
content_old: 19 The fierce people shalt thou not see,— The people of too deep a lip to be understood, of too barbarous a tongue for thee to comprehend.

content: 20 Look thou on Zion, the city of our appointed feast,— Thine own eyes shall see Jerusalem— A home of comfort､ A tent which shall not be packed up— Whose pins shall not be pulled out for ever, And none of whose cords shall be broken.
content_old: 20 Look thou on Zion, the city of our appointed feast,— Thine own eyes shall see Jerusalem— A home of comfort､ A tent which shall not be packed up— Whose pins shall not be pulled out for ever, And none of whose cords shall be broken.

content: 21 But there shall Yahweh be our majestic one, A place of rivers—streams broad on both hands, Wherein shall go no galley with oars, Neither shall majestic ship traverse it;
content_old: 21 But there shall Yahweh be our majestic one, A place of rivers—streams broad on both hands, Wherein shall go no galley with oars, Neither shall majestic ship traverse it;

content: 22 For Yahweh is our judge, Yahweh is our lawgiver,— Yahweh is our king､ He will save us!
content_old: 22 For Yahweh is our judge, Yahweh is our lawgiver,— Yahweh is our king､ He will save us!

content: 23 Loosed are thy ropes,— They cannot strengthen the socket of their mast､ They have not unfurled a sail, Now can be apportioned spoil､ in abundance, The lame have captured prey!
content_old: 23 Loosed are thy ropes,— They cannot strengthen the socket of their mast､ They have not unfurled a sail, Now can be apportioned spoil､ in abundance, The lame have captured prey!

content: 1 Come near､ ye nations､ to hear, And､ ye races､ attend,— Let the earth hear､ and the fulness thereof, The world､ and all things produced therefrom:
content_old: 1 Come near､ ye nations､ to hear, And､ ye races､ attend,— Let the earth hear､ and the fulness thereof, The world､ and all things produced therefrom:

content: 2 That Yahweh hath wrath against all the nations, and indignation against all their host,— He hath devoted them to destruction､ He hath delivered them to slaughter;
content_old: 2 That Yahweh hath wrath against all the nations, and indignation against all their host,— He hath devoted them to destruction､ He hath delivered them to slaughter;

content: 3 And their slain shall be cast out, And their carcases the stench of them shall ascend,— And the mountains shall melt away with their blood.
content_old: 3 And their slain shall be cast out, And their carcases the stench of them shall ascend,— And the mountains shall melt away with their blood.

content: 4 Then shall be dissolved all the host of the heavens, And the heavens shall roll up as a scroll,— Yea all their host shall fade— Like the fading and falling of a leaf from a vine, and Like what fadeth and falleth from a fig-tree.
content_old: 4 Then shall be dissolved all the host of the heavens, And the heavens shall roll up as a scroll,— Yea all their host shall fade— Like the fading and falling of a leaf from a vine, and Like what fadeth and falleth from a fig-tree.

content: 5 For my sword hath been sated in the heavens,— Lo! upon Edom shall it descend, Even on the people whom I have devoted to justice.
content_old: 5 For my sword hath been sated in the heavens,— Lo! upon Edom shall it descend, Even on the people whom I have devoted to justice.

content: 6 A sword hath Yahweh— Glutted with blood､ Sated with fat,— With the blood of well-fed Iambs､ and he-goats, With the fat of the kidneys of rams,— For a sacrifice hath Yahweh､ in Bozrah, Yea a great slaughter､ in the land of Edom;
content_old: 6 A sword hath Yahweh— Glutted with blood､ Sated with fat,— With the blood of well-fed Iambs､ and he-goats, With the fat of the kidneys of rams,— For a sacrifice hath Yahweh､ in Bozrah, Yea a great slaughter､ in the land of Edom;

content: 7 Then shall buffaloes come down with them, And bullocks with bulls,— So shall their land be soaked with blood, And their dust with fat shall be enriched.
content_old: 7 Then shall buffaloes come down with them, And bullocks with bulls,— So shall their land be soaked with blood, And their dust with fat shall be enriched.

content: 8 For a day of avenging hath Yahweh,— A year of requitals､ for the quarrel of Zion.
content_old: 8 For a day of avenging hath Yahweh,— A year of requitals､ for the quarrel of Zion.

content: 9 Then shall the torrents thereof be turned into pitch, And the dust thereof into brimstone,— So shall her land become burning pitch:
content_old: 9 Then shall the torrents thereof be turned into pitch, And the dust thereof into brimstone,— So shall her land become burning pitch:

content: 10 Neither night nor day shall it be quenched, To times age-abiding shall ascend the smoke thereof,— From generation to generation shall it lie waste, Never､ never shall any pass through it:
content_old: 10 Neither night nor day shall it be quenched, To times age-abiding shall ascend the smoke thereof,— From generation to generation shall it lie waste, Never､ never shall any pass through it:

content: 11 That the vomiting pelican and the bittern may possess it: And the great owl and the raven dwell therein; Then will he stretch out over it､ The line of desolation, and The plummet of emptiness.
content_old: 11 That the vomiting pelican and the bittern may possess it: And the great owl and the raven dwell therein; Then will he stretch out over it､ The line of desolation, and The plummet of emptiness.

content: 12 Her nobles (but none are there!) unto royalty will call,— All all her princes shall become nought.
content_old: 12 Her nobles (but none are there!) unto royalty will call,— All all her princes shall become nought.

content: 13 Then shall come up､ in her palaces､ thorns Nettles and thistles､ in her fortresses,— And she shall become A home for wild dogs, An enclosure for ostriches;
content_old: 13 Then shall come up､ in her palaces､ thorns Nettles and thistles､ in her fortresses,— And she shall become A home for wild dogs, An enclosure for ostriches;

content: 14 Then shall criers meet with howlers, And the shaggy creature unto his fellow shall call,— Only there shall the night-spectre Make her settlement, And find for herself a place of rest:
content_old: 14 Then shall criers meet with howlers, And the shaggy creature unto his fellow shall call,— Only there shall the night-spectre Make her settlement, And find for herself a place of rest:

content: 15 There shall the arrow-snake Make her nest and lay, And hatch､ and gather under her shadow,— Only there shall be gathered the falcons､ every one with her mate.
content_old: 15 There shall the arrow-snake Make her nest and lay, And hatch､ and gather under her shadow,— Only there shall be gathered the falcons､ every one with her mate.

content: 16 Seek ye out of the scroll of Yahweh､ and read, Not one from among them is lacking, None hath missed her mate,— For a mouth hath itself commanded, And his spirit hath itself gathered them:
content_old: 16 Seek ye out of the scroll of Yahweh､ and read, Not one from among them is lacking, None hath missed her mate,— For a mouth hath itself commanded, And his spirit hath itself gathered them:

content: 1 Wilderness and parched land shall be glad for them,— And the waste plain shall exult and blossom as the lily:
content_old: 1 Wilderness and parched land shall be glad for them,— And the waste plain shall exult and blossom as the lily:

content: 2 It shall blossom abundantly､ and exult, Yea with exultation and shouts of triumph, The glory of Lebanon hath been given to it, The splendour of Carmel､ and Sharon,— They shall see the glory of Yahweh､ the splendour of our God.
content_old: 2 It shall blossom abundantly､ and exult, Yea with exultation and shouts of triumph, The glory of Lebanon hath been given to it, The splendour of Carmel､ and Sharon,— They shall see the glory of Yahweh､ the splendour of our God.

content: 3 Strengthen ye the weak hands,— The trembling knees make ye firm:
content_old: 3 Strengthen ye the weak hands,— The trembling knees make ye firm:

content: 4 Say to the hurried in heart, Be strong､ Do not fear,— Lo! your God with avenging doth come, With the recompence of God, He doth come to save you.
content_old: 4 Say to the hurried in heart, Be strong､ Do not fear,— Lo! your God with avenging doth come, With the recompence of God, He doth come to save you.

content: 5 Then shall be opened the eyes of the blind,— And the ears of the deaf be unstopped:
content_old: 5 Then shall be opened the eyes of the blind,— And the ears of the deaf be unstopped:

content: 6 Then shall leap as a hart the lame, Then shall shout the tongue of the dumb, For there have broken forth— In the desert—waters, And streams､ in the waste plain:
content_old: 6 Then shall leap as a hart the lame, Then shall shout the tongue of the dumb, For there have broken forth— In the desert—waters, And streams､ in the waste plain:

content: 7 Then shall the glowing sand､ become a lake, And thirsty ground—springs of water,— In the home of the wild dog—its lair Shall be an enclosure for cane and paper-reed.
content_old: 7 Then shall the glowing sand､ become a lake, And thirsty ground—springs of water,— In the home of the wild dog—its lair Shall be an enclosure for cane and paper-reed.

content: 8 And there shall be there a raised way—even a high road､ And the Highroad of Holiness shall it be called, There shall not pass over it one who is unclean; But He Himself shall be one of them､ travelling the road, And the perverse shall not stray there-into.
content_old: 8 And there shall be there a raised way—even a high road､ And the Highroad of Holiness shall it be called, There shall not pass over it one who is unclean; But He Himself shall be one of them､ travelling the road, And the perverse shall not stray there-into.

content: 9 There shall be there no lion､ Nor shall ravenous beast go up thereon, It shall not be found there,— Thus shall travel the redeemed;
content_old: 9 There shall be there no lion､ Nor shall ravenous beast go up thereon, It shall not be found there,— Thus shall travel the redeemed;

content: 1 Now it came to pass､ in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up､ against all the fortified cities of Judah､ and took them.
content_old: 1 Now it came to pass､ in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up､ against all the fortified cities of Judah､ and took them.

content: 2 Then did the king of Assyria send Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem､ unto King Hezekiah､ with a heavy force,—and he took his stand by the upper channel of the pool, in the highway of the fuller’s field.
content_old: 2 Then did the king of Assyria send Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem､ unto King Hezekiah､ with a heavy force,—and he took his stand by the upper channel of the pool, in the highway of the fuller’s field.

content: 3 And there went out to him—Eliakim son of Hilkiah､ who was over the household,—and Shebna､ the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph､ the recorder.
content_old: 3 And there went out to him—Eliakim son of Hilkiah､ who was over the household,—and Shebna､ the scribe, and Joah son of Asaph､ the recorder.

content: 4 And Rabshakeh said unto them, Pray you say unto Hezekiah,— Thus saith the great king､ the king of Assyria, What is this trust､ wherewith thou dost trust?
content_old: 4 And Rabshakeh said unto them, Pray you say unto Hezekiah,— Thus saith the great king､ the king of Assyria, What is this trust､ wherewith thou dost trust?

content: 5 I have said sayest thou—they are only words of the lips— Counsel and might have I for the war,— Now upon whom dost thou trust, that thou hast rebelled against me?
content_old: 5 I have said sayest thou—they are only words of the lips— Counsel and might have I for the war,— Now upon whom dost thou trust, that thou hast rebelled against me?

content: 6 Lo! thou dost trust on the support of this bruised cane､ on Egypt, whereon､ if a man lean､ it will enter his hand､ and lay it open,— So is Pharaoh､ king of Egypt､ to all who trust upon him.
content_old: 6 Lo! thou dost trust on the support of this bruised cane､ on Egypt, whereon､ if a man lean､ it will enter his hand､ and lay it open,— So is Pharaoh､ king of Egypt､ to all who trust upon him.

content: 7 But if thou shouldst say unto me, In Yahweh our God do we trust Then is that not he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath removed, and said unto Judah and unto Jerusalem, Before this altar shall ye bow yourselves down?
content_old: 7 But if thou shouldst say unto me, In Yahweh our God do we trust Then is that not he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath removed, and said unto Judah and unto Jerusalem, Before this altar shall ye bow yourselves down?

content: 8 Now therefore, pledge thyself､ I pray thee､ with my lord､ the king of Assyria,— That I supply thee with two thousand horses, If thou､ on thy part､ be able to set riders upon them;
content_old: 8 Now therefore, pledge thyself､ I pray thee､ with my lord､ the king of Assyria,— That I supply thee with two thousand horses, If thou､ on thy part､ be able to set riders upon them;

content: 9 How then wilt thou turn away the face of one pasha of the least of my lord’s servants? Or hast thou､ on thy part､ trusted upon Egypt, for chariots and for horsemen?
content_old: 9 How then wilt thou turn away the face of one pasha of the least of my lord’s servants? Or hast thou､ on thy part､ trusted upon Egypt, for chariots and for horsemen?

content: 10 But now is it without Yahweh that I have come up against this land､ to destroy it? Yahweh himself said unto me, Go thou up against this land､ and destroy it!
content_old: 10 But now is it without Yahweh that I have come up against this land､ to destroy it? Yahweh himself said unto me, Go thou up against this land､ and destroy it!

content: 11 Then said Eliakim､ and Shebna､ and Joah､ unto Rabshakeh— Speak､ we pray thee､ unto thy servants in the Syrian language, for we can understand it,—and do not speak unto us in the Jews’ language, in the ears of the people who are upon the wall.
content_old: 11 Then said Eliakim､ and Shebna､ and Joah､ unto Rabshakeh— Speak､ we pray thee､ unto thy servants in the Syrian language, for we can understand it,—and do not speak unto us in the Jews’ language, in the ears of the people who are upon the wall.

content: 12 But Rabshakeh said— Is it unto thy lord and unto thee that my lord hath sent me, to speak these things? Is it not concerning the men who are tarrying upon the wall, that they may eat and drink what cometh from them､ with you?
content_old: 12 But Rabshakeh said— Is it unto thy lord and unto thee that my lord hath sent me, to speak these things? Is it not concerning the men who are tarrying upon the wall, that they may eat and drink what cometh from them､ with you?

content: 13 So then Rabshakeh took his stand, and cried out with a loud voice､ in the Jews’ language, and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria:
content_old: 13 So then Rabshakeh took his stand, and cried out with a loud voice､ in the Jews’ language, and said, Hear ye the words of the great king, the king of Assyria:

content: 14 Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you,—for he shall not be able to deliver you.
content_old: 14 Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you,—for he shall not be able to deliver you.

content: 15 Neither let Hezekiah cause you to trust in Yahweh､ saying, Yahweh will certainly deliver us,—this city shall not be given over into the hand of the king of Assyria.
content_old: 15 Neither let Hezekiah cause you to trust in Yahweh､ saying, Yahweh will certainly deliver us,—this city shall not be given over into the hand of the king of Assyria.

content: 16 Do not hearken unto Hezekiah,—for thus saith the king of Assyria, Deal with me thankfully､ and come out unto me､ Then shall ye eat､ Every one of his own vine､ and Every one of his own fig-tree, And drink､ every one the waters of his own cistern:
content_old: 16 Do not hearken unto Hezekiah,—for thus saith the king of Assyria, Deal with me thankfully､ and come out unto me､ Then shall ye eat､ Every one of his own vine､ and Every one of his own fig-tree, And drink､ every one the waters of his own cistern:

content: 17 Until I come and take you､ into A land like your own land,— A land of corn､ and new wine, A land of bread､ and vineyards:—
content_old: 17 Until I come and take you､ into A land like your own land,— A land of corn､ and new wine, A land of bread､ and vineyards:—

content: 18 Lest Hezekiah persuade you､ saying, Yahweh will deliver us! Have the gods of the nations delivered—any one of them—his country､ out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
content_old: 18 Lest Hezekiah persuade you､ saying, Yahweh will deliver us! Have the gods of the nations delivered—any one of them—his country､ out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

content: 19 Where are the gods of Hamath､ and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? If indeed they had only delivered Samaria､ out of my hand!
content_old: 19 Where are the gods of Hamath､ and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? If indeed they had only delivered Samaria､ out of my hand!

content: 20 Who are they､ among all the gods of these countries､ that have delivered their country out of my hand? That Yahweh should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand!
content_old: 20 Who are they､ among all the gods of these countries､ that have delivered their country out of my hand? That Yahweh should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand!

content: 21 But they held their peace, and answered him not a word,—for the command of the king it was､ saying,— Ye must not answer him.
content_old: 21 But they held their peace, and answered him not a word,—for the command of the king it was､ saying,— Ye must not answer him.

content: 1 And it came to pass, when King Hezekiah heard it that he rent his clothes,—and covered himself with sackcloth, and entered the house of Yahweh;
content_old: 1 And it came to pass, when King Hezekiah heard it that he rent his clothes,—and covered himself with sackcloth, and entered the house of Yahweh;

content: 2 and sent Eliakim who was over the household､ and Shebna the scribe､ and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth,—unto Isaiah the prophet､ son of Amoz;
content_old: 2 and sent Eliakim who was over the household､ and Shebna the scribe､ and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth,—unto Isaiah the prophet､ son of Amoz;

content: 3 and they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, A day of distress and rebuke and reviling is this day,— For children are come to the birth, and strength is there none to bring forth.
content_old: 3 and they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, A day of distress and rebuke and reviling is this day,— For children are come to the birth, and strength is there none to bring forth.

content: 4 It may be that Yahweh thy God will hear the words of Rabshakeh､ whom the king of Assyria､ his lord､ hath sent to reproach a Living God, and will rebuke the words which Yahweh thy God hath heard,— Wherefore lift thou up a prayer､ for the remnant that remaineth.
content_old: 4 It may be that Yahweh thy God will hear the words of Rabshakeh､ whom the king of Assyria､ his lord､ hath sent to reproach a Living God, and will rebuke the words which Yahweh thy God hath heard,— Wherefore lift thou up a prayer､ for the remnant that remaineth.

content: 5 So the servants of King Hezekiah came unto Isaiah.
content_old: 5 So the servants of King Hezekiah came unto Isaiah.

content: 6 And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye surely say unto your lord,— Thus saith Yahweh— Be not thou afraid because of the words which thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have reviled Me.
content_old: 6 And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye surely say unto your lord,— Thus saith Yahweh— Be not thou afraid because of the words which thou hast heard, wherewith the servants of the king of Assyria have reviled Me.

content: 7 Behold me! about to let go against him､ a blast of alarm, and when he heareth the report then will he return to his own country,—and I will cause him to fall by the sword､ in his own land.
content_old: 7 Behold me! about to let go against him､ a blast of alarm, and when he heareth the report then will he return to his own country,—and I will cause him to fall by the sword､ in his own land.

content: 8 So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria, warring against Libnah,—for he had heard, that he had broken up from Lachish.
content_old: 8 So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria, warring against Libnah,—for he had heard, that he had broken up from Lachish.

content: 9 And he heard it reported concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia､ saying, He hath come forth to fight with thee,— so when he heard it he sent messengers unto Hezekiah､ saying:
content_old: 9 And he heard it reported concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia､ saying, He hath come forth to fight with thee,— so when he heard it he sent messengers unto Hezekiah､ saying:

content: 10 Thus shall ye surely speak unto Hezekiah king of Judah､ saying, Let not thy God､ in whom thou art trusting､ beguile thee, saying,— Jerusalem shall not be given over into the hand of the king of Assyria.
content_old: 10 Thus shall ye surely speak unto Hezekiah king of Judah､ saying, Let not thy God､ in whom thou art trusting､ beguile thee, saying,— Jerusalem shall not be given over into the hand of the king of Assyria.

content: 11 Lo! thou thyself hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands､ in devoting them to destruction,—and shalt thou be delivered?
content_old: 11 Lo! thou thyself hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands､ in devoting them to destruction,—and shalt thou be delivered?

content: 12 Did the gods of the nations deliver them whom my fathers destroyed,—Gozan､ and Haran,—and Rezeph､ and the sons of Eden､ who were in Telassar?
content_old: 12 Did the gods of the nations deliver them whom my fathers destroyed,—Gozan､ and Haran,—and Rezeph､ and the sons of Eden､ who were in Telassar?

content: 13 Where are the king of Hamath､ and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim,—of Hena､ and Ivvah?
content_old: 13 Where are the king of Hamath､ and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim,—of Hena､ and Ivvah?

content: 14 And when Hezekiah had received the letter at the hand of the messengers､ and had read it then went he up to the house of Yahweh, and Hezekiah spread it out before Yahweh.
content_old: 14 And when Hezekiah had received the letter at the hand of the messengers､ and had read it then went he up to the house of Yahweh, and Hezekiah spread it out before Yahweh.

content: 15 And Hezekiah prayed unto Yahweh､ saying:
content_old: 15 And Hezekiah prayed unto Yahweh､ saying:

content: 16 O Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel—inhabiting the cherubim, Thou thyself art GOD､ even thou alone, for all the kingdoms of the earth: Thou didst make the heavens and the earth.
content_old: 16 O Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel—inhabiting the cherubim, Thou thyself art GOD､ even thou alone, for all the kingdoms of the earth: Thou didst make the heavens and the earth.

content: 17 Bow down､ O Yahweh､ thine ear—and hear, Open､ O Yahweh､ thine eyes—and see,— Yea hear thou all the words of Sennacherib, who hath sent—to reproach a Living God.
content_old: 17 Bow down､ O Yahweh､ thine ear—and hear, Open､ O Yahweh､ thine eyes—and see,— Yea hear thou all the words of Sennacherib, who hath sent—to reproach a Living God.

content: 18 Of a truth O Yahweh,—the kings of Assyria have devoted to destruction all the countries､ and their land;
content_old: 18 Of a truth O Yahweh,—the kings of Assyria have devoted to destruction all the countries､ and their land;

content: 19 and have put their gods in the fire,—for no-gods were they, but the work of the hands of men—wood and stone､ and so they destroyed them.
content_old: 19 and have put their gods in the fire,—for no-gods were they, but the work of the hands of men—wood and stone､ and so they destroyed them.

content: 20 Now therefore､ O Yahweh our God, save us out of his hand,— That all the kingdoms of the earth may know, That thou art Yahweh､ thou alone.
content_old: 20 Now therefore､ O Yahweh our God, save us out of his hand,— That all the kingdoms of the earth may know, That thou art Yahweh､ thou alone.

content: 21 Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah､ saying,— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, In that thou hast prayed unto me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria
content_old: 21 Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent unto Hezekiah､ saying,— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, In that thou hast prayed unto me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria

content: 22 this is the word which Yahweh hath spoken concerning him,— The virgin daughter of Zion laugheth thee to scorn—mocketh thee, The daughter of Jerusalem after thee doth wag her head!
content_old: 22 this is the word which Yahweh hath spoken concerning him,— The virgin daughter of Zion laugheth thee to scorn—mocketh thee, The daughter of Jerusalem after thee doth wag her head!

content: 23 Whom hast thou reproached､ and insulted? And against whom hast thou lifted high thy voice? Yea thou hast proudly raised thine eyes against the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 23 Whom hast thou reproached､ and insulted? And against whom hast thou lifted high thy voice? Yea thou hast proudly raised thine eyes against the Holy One of Israel.

content: 24 Through thy servants thou hast reproached My Lord､ and hast said,— With my multitude of chariots have I ascended The height of the mountains､ The recesses of Lebanon, That I may cut down Its tallest cedars､ Its choicest firs, That I may enter Its highest summit, Its thick garden forest:
content_old: 24 Through thy servants thou hast reproached My Lord､ and hast said,— With my multitude of chariots have I ascended The height of the mountains､ The recesses of Lebanon, That I may cut down Its tallest cedars､ Its choicest firs, That I may enter Its highest summit, Its thick garden forest:

content: 25 I have digged､ and drunk waters,— That I may dry up､ with the soles of my feet､ all the Nile-streams of Egypt.
content_old: 25 I have digged､ and drunk waters,— That I may dry up､ with the soles of my feet､ all the Nile-streams of Egypt.

content: 26 Hast thou not heard— That long ago that is what I appointed､ And from days of old devised? Now have I brought it to pass, That thou mightest serve to lay waste in desolate ruins fortified cities;
content_old: 26 Hast thou not heard— That long ago that is what I appointed､ And from days of old devised? Now have I brought it to pass, That thou mightest serve to lay waste in desolate ruins fortified cities;

content: 27 And their inhabitants､ being powerless were overthrown､ and put to shame,— They became— Grass of the field､ and Young herbage, Grass on housetops, and Seed parched before it came up.
content_old: 27 And their inhabitants､ being powerless were overthrown､ and put to shame,— They became— Grass of the field､ and Young herbage, Grass on housetops, and Seed parched before it came up.

content: 28 Howbeit thine abode､ and thy coming out and thy going in I know,—and thy raging against me.
content_old: 28 Howbeit thine abode､ and thy coming out and thy going in I know,—and thy raging against me.

content: 29 Because thy raging against me, and thy contempt have come up into mine ears Therefore will I put My ring in thy nose､ and My bit in thy lips, And will turn thee back, by the way by which thou camest.
content_old: 29 Because thy raging against me, and thy contempt have come up into mine ears Therefore will I put My ring in thy nose､ and My bit in thy lips, And will turn thee back, by the way by which thou camest.

content: 30 And this unto thee is the sign, Eating this year the growth of scattered seeds, And in the second year that which shooteth up of itself,— Then in the third year Sow ye—and reap､ and Plant ye vineyards､ and eat the fruit thereof.
content_old: 30 And this unto thee is the sign, Eating this year the growth of scattered seeds, And in the second year that which shooteth up of itself,— Then in the third year Sow ye—and reap､ and Plant ye vineyards､ and eat the fruit thereof.

content: 31 Then shall the escaped of the house of Judah that remain､ again Take root downward,— And bear fruit upward.
content_old: 31 Then shall the escaped of the house of Judah that remain､ again Take root downward,— And bear fruit upward.

content: 32 For out of Jerusalem shall come forth a remnant, And that which hath escaped､ out of Mount Zion,— The jealousy of Yahweh of hosts will perform this.
content_old: 32 For out of Jerusalem shall come forth a remnant, And that which hath escaped､ out of Mount Zion,— The jealousy of Yahweh of hosts will perform this.

content: 33 Therefore､ thus saith Yahweh､ concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not enter this city, Nor shoot there､ an arrow,— Nor attack it with shield, Nor cast up against it a mound:
content_old: 33 Therefore､ thus saith Yahweh､ concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not enter this city, Nor shoot there､ an arrow,— Nor attack it with shield, Nor cast up against it a mound:

content: 34 By the way that he came in By the same shall he return,— And into this city shall he not enter､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 34 By the way that he came in By the same shall he return,— And into this city shall he not enter､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 35 Thus will I throw a covering over this city､ to save it,— For mine own sake, And for the sake of David my servant.
content_old: 35 Thus will I throw a covering over this city､ to save it,— For mine own sake, And for the sake of David my servant.

content: 36 Then went forth the messenger of Yahweh､ and smote—in the camp of the Assyrians—a hundred and eighty-five thousand,—and when men arose early in the morning lo! they were all dead bodies!
content_old: 36 Then went forth the messenger of Yahweh､ and smote—in the camp of the Assyrians—a hundred and eighty-five thousand,—and when men arose early in the morning lo! they were all dead bodies!

content: 37 So Sennacherib the king of Assyria､ brake up､ and went his way, and returned,—and remained in Nineveh.
content_old: 37 So Sennacherib the king of Assyria､ brake up､ and went his way, and returned,—and remained in Nineveh.

content: 1 In those days was Hezekiah sick､ unto death,—and Isaiah the prophet､ son of Amoz､ came in unto him, and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh, Set in order thy house, for about to die thou art､ and shalt not recover.
content_old: 1 In those days was Hezekiah sick､ unto death,—and Isaiah the prophet､ son of Amoz､ came in unto him, and said unto him— Thus saith Yahweh, Set in order thy house, for about to die thou art､ and shalt not recover.

content: 2 Then Hezekiah turned his face unto the wall,—and prayed unto Yahweh;
content_old: 2 Then Hezekiah turned his face unto the wall,—and prayed unto Yahweh;

content: 3 and said,— I beseech thee､ O Yahweh remember､ I pray thee､ how I have walked before thee､ in faithfulness and with an undivided heart, and that which is good in thine eyes have I done. And Hezekiah wept aloud.
content_old: 3 and said,— I beseech thee､ O Yahweh remember､ I pray thee､ how I have walked before thee､ in faithfulness and with an undivided heart, and that which is good in thine eyes have I done. And Hezekiah wept aloud.

content: 4 Then came the word of Yahweh unto Isaiah, saying:
content_old: 4 Then came the word of Yahweh unto Isaiah, saying:

content: 5 Go､ and say unto Hezekiah— Thus saith Yahweh､ the God of David thy father: I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears,— Behold me! about to add unto thy days, fifteen years;
content_old: 5 Go､ and say unto Hezekiah— Thus saith Yahweh､ the God of David thy father: I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears,— Behold me! about to add unto thy days, fifteen years;

content: 6 And out of the hand of the king of Assyria will I deliver thee, and this city; And I will throw a covering over this city.
content_old: 6 And out of the hand of the king of Assyria will I deliver thee, and this city; And I will throw a covering over this city.

content: 7 And this to thee shall be the sign､ from Yahweh,—that Yahweh will do this thing which he hath spoken:—
content_old: 7 And this to thee shall be the sign､ from Yahweh,—that Yahweh will do this thing which he hath spoken:—

content: 8 Behold me! causing the shadow on the steps, which hath come gone down on the steps of Ahaz with the sun, to return backwards ten steps. So the sun returned ten steps, by the steps which it had come down.
content_old: 8 Behold me! causing the shadow on the steps, which hath come gone down on the steps of Ahaz with the sun, to return backwards ten steps. So the sun returned ten steps, by the steps which it had come down.

content: 9 The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick､ and then recovered from his sickness:—
content_old: 9 The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick､ and then recovered from his sickness:—

content: 10 I said— ln the noontide of my days I must enter the gates of hades,— I am deprived of the residue of my years!
content_old: 10 I said— ln the noontide of my days I must enter the gates of hades,— I am deprived of the residue of my years!

content: 11 I said— I shall not see Yah, Yah､ in the land of the living, I shall discern the son of earth no longer､ with the dwellers in the quiet land.
content_old: 11 I said— I shall not see Yah, Yah､ in the land of the living, I shall discern the son of earth no longer､ with the dwellers in the quiet land.

content: 12 My dwelling hath been broken up､ And is stripped from me､ like a shepherd’s tent,— I have rolled up—as a weaver—my life､ From the loom doth he cut me off, From day until night I said— Thou wilt finish me.
content_old: 12 My dwelling hath been broken up､ And is stripped from me､ like a shepherd’s tent,— I have rolled up—as a weaver—my life､ From the loom doth he cut me off, From day until night I said— Thou wilt finish me.

content: 13 I cried out､ until morning､ like a lion, Thus will he break all my bones! From day until night, Thou wilt finish me!
content_old: 13 I cried out､ until morning､ like a lion, Thus will he break all my bones! From day until night, Thou wilt finish me!

content: 14 As a twittering swallow so do I chatter, I coo as a dove,— Mine eyes languish through looking on high, O My Lord! distress is upon me—my Surety!
content_old: 14 As a twittering swallow so do I chatter, I coo as a dove,— Mine eyes languish through looking on high, O My Lord! distress is upon me—my Surety!

content: 15 What can I say? Sinee he hath promised for me Himself will perform. I will go softly､ all my years､ Because of the bitterness of my soul.
content_old: 15 What can I say? Sinee he hath promised for me Himself will perform. I will go softly､ all my years､ Because of the bitterness of my soul.

content: 16 O My Lord! on those things do men live,— And altogether in them is the life of my spirit, When thou hast strengthened me､ and made me live.
content_old: 16 O My Lord! on those things do men live,— And altogether in them is the life of my spirit, When thou hast strengthened me､ and made me live.

content: 17 Lo! for well-being I had bitterness—bitterness,— But thou cleaving unto my soul hast raised me from the pit of corruption, For thou hast cast､ behind thy back､ all my sins.
content_old: 17 Lo! for well-being I had bitterness—bitterness,— But thou cleaving unto my soul hast raised me from the pit of corruption, For thou hast cast､ behind thy back､ all my sins.

content: 18 For hades cannot praise thee､ Nor death celebrate thee,— They who go down to the pit cannot wait for thy faithfulness.
content_old: 18 For hades cannot praise thee､ Nor death celebrate thee,— They who go down to the pit cannot wait for thy faithfulness.

content: 19 The living､ the living he can praise thee､ As I do this day,— A father to his children can make known thy faithfulness.
content_old: 19 The living､ the living he can praise thee､ As I do this day,— A father to his children can make known thy faithfulness.

content: 20 Yahweh was willing to save me,— Therefore on my stringed instruments will we play— All the days of our life��� By the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 20 Yahweh was willing to save me,— Therefore on my stringed instruments will we play— All the days of our life��� By the house of Yahweh.

content: 21 And Isaiah had said, Let them take a cake of figs, and let them press it over the boil､ that he may recover.
content_old: 21 And Isaiah had said, Let them take a cake of figs, and let them press it over the boil､ that he may recover.

content: 1 At that time Merodach-baladan son of Baladan､ king of Babylon､ sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah,—for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick､ and had recovered.
content_old: 1 At that time Merodach-baladan son of Baladan､ king of Babylon､ sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah,—for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick､ and had recovered.

content: 2 And Hezekiah rejoiced over them, and showed them his house of precious things—the silver and the gold and the spices and the precious ointment､ and all his armoury—and all that was found among his treasures,—there was nothing､ which Hezekiah did not show them—in his house､ or in all his dominion.
content_old: 2 And Hezekiah rejoiced over them, and showed them his house of precious things—the silver and the gold and the spices and the precious ointment､ and all his armoury—and all that was found among his treasures,—there was nothing､ which Hezekiah did not show them—in his house､ or in all his dominion.

content: 3 Then came Isaiah the prophet, unto King Hezekiah,—and said unto him—, What said these men? and whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, From a land far away came they unto me､ from Babylon!
content_old: 3 Then came Isaiah the prophet, unto King Hezekiah,—and said unto him—, What said these men? and whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, From a land far away came they unto me､ from Babylon!

content: 4 And he said, What have they seen in thy house? Then said Hezekiah,— All that is in my house have they seen, there is nothing which I shewed them not､ among my treasures.
content_old: 4 And he said, What have they seen in thy house? Then said Hezekiah,— All that is in my house have they seen, there is nothing which I shewed them not､ among my treasures.

content: 5 Then said Isaiah unto Hezekiah,— Hear thou the word of Yahweh of hosts:
content_old: 5 Then said Isaiah unto Hezekiah,— Hear thou the word of Yahweh of hosts:

content: 6 Lo! days are coming, when all that is in thy house, and that which thy fathers have treasured up until this day, shall be carried away unto Babylon,—nothing shall be left､ Saith Yahweh.
content_old: 6 Lo! days are coming, when all that is in thy house, and that which thy fathers have treasured up until this day, shall be carried away unto Babylon,—nothing shall be left､ Saith Yahweh.

content: 7 And of thy sons who shall issue from thee､ whom thou shalt beget shall they take away,—and they shall become eunuchs､ in the palace of the king of Babylon.
content_old: 7 And of thy sons who shall issue from thee､ whom thou shalt beget shall they take away,—and they shall become eunuchs､ in the palace of the king of Babylon.

content: 1 Comfort ye—comfort ye､ my people,— Saith your God.
content_old: 1 Comfort ye—comfort ye､ my people,— Saith your God.

content: 2 Speak ye unto the heart of Jerusalem､ And cry unto her,— That accomplished is her warfare, That accepted is her punishment,— That she hath received､ at the hand of Yahweh, According to the full measure of all her sins.
content_old: 2 Speak ye unto the heart of Jerusalem､ And cry unto her,— That accomplished is her warfare, That accepted is her punishment,— That she hath received､ at the hand of Yahweh, According to the full measure of all her sins.

content: 3 A voice of one crying!— In the desert prepare ye the way of Yahweh,— Make smooth in the waste plain a highway for our God:
content_old: 3 A voice of one crying!— In the desert prepare ye the way of Yahweh,— Make smooth in the waste plain a highway for our God:

content: 4 Let every valley be exalted, And every mountain and hill be made low,— And the steep ground become level, And the chain of hills—a plain:
content_old: 4 Let every valley be exalted, And every mountain and hill be made low,— And the steep ground become level, And the chain of hills—a plain:

content: 5 Then shall be revealed the glory of Yahweh,— And all flesh shall see it together, For the mouth of Yahweh hath spoken!
content_old: 5 Then shall be revealed the glory of Yahweh,— And all flesh shall see it together, For the mouth of Yahweh hath spoken!

content: 6 A voice saying Cry! And one said— What should I cry? All flesh is grass, And all the grace thereof like the flower of the field:
content_old: 6 A voice saying Cry! And one said— What should I cry? All flesh is grass, And all the grace thereof like the flower of the field:

content: 7 The grass hath withered The flower hath faded, Because the breath of Yahweh hath blown upon it! Surely the people is grass!
content_old: 7 The grass hath withered The flower hath faded, Because the breath of Yahweh hath blown upon it! Surely the people is grass!

content: 8 The grass hath withered The flower hath faded,— But the word of our God shall stand unto times age-abiding!
content_old: 8 The grass hath withered The flower hath faded,— But the word of our God shall stand unto times age-abiding!

content: 9 To a high mountain get ye up､ O herald-band of Zion, Lift high with strength your voice, O herald-band of Jerusalem,— Lift it high､ do not fear, Say to the cities of Judah— Lo! your God!
content_old: 9 To a high mountain get ye up､ O herald-band of Zion, Lift high with strength your voice, O herald-band of Jerusalem,— Lift it high､ do not fear, Say to the cities of Judah— Lo! your God!

content: 10 Lo! My Lord､ Yahweh as a mighty one doth come, And his own arm is about to rule for him,— Lo! his reward is with him, And his recompense before him;
content_old: 10 Lo! My Lord､ Yahweh as a mighty one doth come, And his own arm is about to rule for him,— Lo! his reward is with him, And his recompense before him;

content: 11 Like a shepherd his flock will he tend, In his own arm will he take up the lambs, And in his own bosom will he carry them,— Them which are with young will he lead to a place of rest.
content_old: 11 Like a shepherd his flock will he tend, In his own arm will he take up the lambs, And in his own bosom will he carry them,— Them which are with young will he lead to a place of rest.

content: 12 Who hath measured､ with the hollow of his hand the waters､ Or the heavens with a span hath meted out, Or hath comprehended in a measure the dust of the earth, Or weighed in scales the mountains, Or the hills in a balance?
