content_old: 12 Who hath measured､ with the hollow of his hand the waters､ Or the heavens with a span hath meted out, Or hath comprehended in a measure the dust of the earth, Or weighed in scales the mountains, Or the hills in a balance?

content: 13 Who hath proved the spirit of Yahweh? Or､ being his counsellor､ hath been giving him knowledge?
content_old: 13 Who hath proved the spirit of Yahweh? Or､ being his counsellor､ hath been giving him knowledge?

content: 14 With whom hath he taken counsel— And he hath given him intelligence, And instructed him in the path of justice,— And taught him knowledge, And in the way of intelligence hath been giving him understanding?
content_old: 14 With whom hath he taken counsel— And he hath given him intelligence, And instructed him in the path of justice,— And taught him knowledge, And in the way of intelligence hath been giving him understanding?

content: 15 Lo! nations Are as a drop on a bucket, And as fine dust on a balance are accounted,— Lo! islands like an atom can he hoist;
content_old: 15 Lo! nations Are as a drop on a bucket, And as fine dust on a balance are accounted,— Lo! islands like an atom can he hoist;

content: 16 And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn,— Nor the beasts thereof sufficient for an ascending-sacrifice!
content_old: 16 And Lebanon is not sufficient to burn,— Nor the beasts thereof sufficient for an ascending-sacrifice!

content: 17 All nations are as nothing before him,— A thing of nought or a waste are they accounted unto him?
content_old: 17 All nations are as nothing before him,— A thing of nought or a waste are they accounted unto him?

content: 18 Unto whom､ then､ can ye liken GOD? Or what likeness can ye compare unto him?
content_old: 18 Unto whom､ then､ can ye liken GOD? Or what likeness can ye compare unto him?

content: 19 The image hath been cast by an artificer, And a goldsmith with gold overlayeth it,— And chains of silver he worketh.
content_old: 19 The image hath been cast by an artificer, And a goldsmith with gold overlayeth it,— And chains of silver he worketh.

content: 20 The needy offerer of a tree that will not rot maketh choice,— A skilled artificer seeketh he out for himself､ to construct an image that shall not totter!
content_old: 20 The needy offerer of a tree that will not rot maketh choice,— A skilled artificer seeketh he out for himself､ to construct an image that shall not totter!

content: 21 Have ye never taken note? Have ye never heard? Hath it not､ from the beginning､ been told you? Have ye not been led to discern, from the foundations of the earth?
content_old: 21 Have ye never taken note? Have ye never heard? Hath it not､ from the beginning､ been told you? Have ye not been led to discern, from the foundations of the earth?

content: 22 It is he who sitteth upon the circle of the earth, While the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers,— Who stretcheth forth as a curtain the heavens, And spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in;
content_old: 22 It is he who sitteth upon the circle of the earth, While the inhabitants thereof are as grasshoppers,— Who stretcheth forth as a curtain the heavens, And spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in;

content: 23 Who delivereth dignitaries to nothingness,— Judges of earth like a desolation hath he made:
content_old: 23 Who delivereth dignitaries to nothingness,— Judges of earth like a desolation hath he made:

content: 24 Scarcely have they been planted､ Scarcely have they been sown, Scarcely hath their stock begun to take root in the earth When he hath just blown upon them､ and they have withered, And a whirlwind as though they had been chaff carrieth them away.
content_old: 24 Scarcely have they been planted､ Scarcely have they been sown, Scarcely hath their stock begun to take root in the earth When he hath just blown upon them､ and they have withered, And a whirlwind as though they had been chaff carrieth them away.

content: 25 Unto whom then､ can ye liken me､ or can I be equal? Saith the Holy One.
content_old: 25 Unto whom then､ can ye liken me､ or can I be equal? Saith the Holy One.

content: 26 Lift on high､ your eyes—and see､ who hath created these, That bringeth forth by number their host,— To all of them､ by name doth call, Because of the abundance of vigour and alertness of strength not one is missing!
content_old: 26 Lift on high､ your eyes—and see､ who hath created these, That bringeth forth by number their host,— To all of them､ by name doth call, Because of the abundance of vigour and alertness of strength not one is missing!

content: 27 Wherefore shouldest thou say､ O Jacob, or speak､ O Israel,— Hidden is my path from Yahweh, And from my God my vindication will pass?
content_old: 27 Wherefore shouldest thou say､ O Jacob, or speak､ O Israel,— Hidden is my path from Yahweh, And from my God my vindication will pass?

content: 28 Hast thou not known, Hast thou not heard､ That The God of age-past time— Yahweh､ The Creator of the ends of the earth､ Fainteth not､ neither groweth weary､— There is no searching of his understanding:
content_old: 28 Hast thou not known, Hast thou not heard､ That The God of age-past time— Yahweh､ The Creator of the ends of the earth､ Fainteth not､ neither groweth weary､— There is no searching of his understanding:

content: 29 Giving to him that fainteth strength, And to him that hath no vigour he causeth power to abound?
content_old: 29 Giving to him that fainteth strength, And to him that hath no vigour he causeth power to abound?

content: 30 Youths both faint and grow weary, And young warriors—they fall､ they fall;
content_old: 30 Youths both faint and grow weary, And young warriors—they fall､ they fall;

content: 1 Be silent and hearken unto me､ O ye Coastlands, And let the Races of Men renew their strength,— Let them approach､ then let them speak, Together for controversy let us draw near:—
content_old: 1 Be silent and hearken unto me､ O ye Coastlands, And let the Races of Men renew their strength,— Let them approach､ then let them speak, Together for controversy let us draw near:—

content: 2 Who roused up one from the East, In righteousness called him to his feet,— Set before him､ nations､ And over kings caused him to rule, His sword made them like dust, His bow like driven chaff:
content_old: 2 Who roused up one from the East, In righteousness called him to his feet,— Set before him､ nations､ And over kings caused him to rule, His sword made them like dust, His bow like driven chaff:

content: 3 He pursued them､ passed along safely,— Upon the path of his own feet entered he not?
content_old: 3 He pursued them､ passed along safely,— Upon the path of his own feet entered he not?

content: 4 Who hath wrought and performed, Calling the generations､ in advance? I､ Yahwell､ who am First, And with them who are last I am the Same!
content_old: 4 Who hath wrought and performed, Calling the generations､ in advance? I､ Yahwell､ who am First, And with them who are last I am the Same!

content: 5 Coastlands have seen､ so they fear, The ends of the earth are in dread,— They have drawn near､ and have come:
content_old: 5 Coastlands have seen､ so they fear, The ends of the earth are in dread,— They have drawn near､ and have come:

content: 6 Every man to his neighbour giveth help,— And to his brother saith､ Take courage!
content_old: 6 Every man to his neighbour giveth help,— And to his brother saith､ Take courage!

content: 7 So the carver hath encouraged the goldsmith, He that maketh smooth with the hammer､ him that smiteth the anvil,— Saying of the welding, It is good! Then hath he fastened it with nails—it must not totter!
content_old: 7 So the carver hath encouraged the goldsmith, He that maketh smooth with the hammer､ him that smiteth the anvil,— Saying of the welding, It is good! Then hath he fastened it with nails—it must not totter!

content: 8 But thou､ Israel､ my Servant, Jacob､ whom I have chosen,— The seed of Abraham､ my loving one;
content_old: 8 But thou､ Israel､ my Servant, Jacob､ whom I have chosen,— The seed of Abraham､ my loving one;

content: 9 Thou whom I have taken hold of from the ends of the earth, And from the extremities thereof have called thee,— And said to thee My Servant thou! I have chosen thee､ and not cast thee off
content_old: 9 Thou whom I have taken hold of from the ends of the earth, And from the extremities thereof have called thee,— And said to thee My Servant thou! I have chosen thee､ and not cast thee off

content: 10 Do not fear, for with thee I am! Look not around､ for I am thy God,— I have emboldened thee､ Yea I have helped thee, Yea I have upheld thee､ with my righteous right-hand.
content_old: 10 Do not fear, for with thee I am! Look not around､ for I am thy God,— I have emboldened thee､ Yea I have helped thee, Yea I have upheld thee､ with my righteous right-hand.

content: 11 Lo! they shall turn pale and be ashamed— All they who have been incensed against thee,— They shall become as nothing and perish— The men who have been thine accusers:
content_old: 11 Lo! they shall turn pale and be ashamed— All they who have been incensed against thee,— They shall become as nothing and perish— The men who have been thine accusers:

content: 12 Thou shalt seek them､ but shalt not find them— The men who have contended with thee, They shall become as nothing､ and as a thing of nought— The men who have warred against thee;
content_old: 12 Thou shalt seek them､ but shalt not find them— The men who have contended with thee, They shall become as nothing､ and as a thing of nought— The men who have warred against thee;

content: 13 For I､Yahweh､ thy God am firmly grasping thy right-hand,— Who am saying unto thee Do not fear! I have become thy helper!
content_old: 13 For I､Yahweh､ thy God am firmly grasping thy right-hand,— Who am saying unto thee Do not fear! I have become thy helper!

content: 14 Do not fear! Thou worm Jacob, Ye men of Israel,— I have become thy helper､ Declareth Yahweh, And thy redeemer､ The Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 14 Do not fear! Thou worm Jacob, Ye men of Israel,— I have become thy helper､ Declareth Yahweh, And thy redeemer､ The Holy One of Israel.

content: 15 Lo! I have made of thee a new pointed threshing sledge､ owning teeth,— Thou shalt thresh mountains､ and crush them, And hills—like chaff shalt thou make:
content_old: 15 Lo! I have made of thee a new pointed threshing sledge､ owning teeth,— Thou shalt thresh mountains､ and crush them, And hills—like chaff shalt thou make:

content: 16 Thou shalt fan them､ and a wind shall carry them away, And a whirlwind scatter them,— But thou shalt exult in Yahweh, And in the Holy One of Israel shalt thou boast thyself.
content_old: 16 Thou shalt fan them､ and a wind shall carry them away, And a whirlwind scatter them,— But thou shalt exult in Yahweh, And in the Holy One of Israel shalt thou boast thyself.

content: 17 As for the oppressed and the needy､ Seeking water､ when there is none, Their tongue with thirst being parched I—Yahweh will answer them, The God of Israel I will not forsake them:
content_old: 17 As for the oppressed and the needy､ Seeking water､ when there is none, Their tongue with thirst being parched I—Yahweh will answer them, The God of Israel I will not forsake them:

content: 18 I will open On bare hills rivers, and In the midst of plains fountains,— I will make The desert a lake of water, and Parched land springs of water;
content_old: 18 I will open On bare hills rivers, and In the midst of plains fountains,— I will make The desert a lake of water, and Parched land springs of water;

content: 19 I will set in the desert Cedar､ acacia, and myrtle､ and oil-tree,— I will place in the waste plain Cypress､ holm-oak and sherbin-cedar､ together
content_old: 19 I will set in the desert Cedar､ acacia, and myrtle､ and oil-tree,— I will place in the waste plain Cypress､ holm-oak and sherbin-cedar､ together

content: 20 That men may see and observe､ and consider and understand at once, That the hand of Yahweh hath done this, That the Holy One of Israel hath created it.
content_old: 20 That men may see and observe､ and consider and understand at once, That the hand of Yahweh hath done this, That the Holy One of Israel hath created it.

content: 21 Bring near your contention､ Saith Yahweh,— Advance your defences､ Saith the King of Jacob:
content_old: 21 Bring near your contention､ Saith Yahweh,— Advance your defences､ Saith the King of Jacob:

content: 22 Let them advance them､ and tell us, What shall happen,— Things known in advance—what they were tell ye, That we may lay them to our heart､ and mark the after-story of them, Or things yet to come let us hear:
content_old: 22 Let them advance them､ and tell us, What shall happen,— Things known in advance—what they were tell ye, That we may lay them to our heart､ and mark the after-story of them, Or things yet to come let us hear:

content: 23 Tell ye the events which shall be hereafter, That we may perceive that gods ye are,— Surely ye must do something—good or bad, That we may be amazed､ and behold it at once.
content_old: 23 Tell ye the events which shall be hereafter, That we may perceive that gods ye are,— Surely ye must do something—good or bad, That we may be amazed､ and behold it at once.

content: 24 Lo! ye are of nought, And your work is a puff of breath,— An abomination he that chooseth you!
content_old: 24 Lo! ye are of nought, And your work is a puff of breath,— An abomination he that chooseth you!

content: 25 I have roused up one from the North､ and he hath come, From the rising of the sun calleth he on my Name,— And he hath come on deputies as though they were mortar, And as a potter treadeth clay.
content_old: 25 I have roused up one from the North､ and he hath come, From the rising of the sun calleth he on my Name,— And he hath come on deputies as though they were mortar, And as a potter treadeth clay.

content: 26 Who hath told in advance､ that we might know, And beforetime､ that we might say Right! Nay､ there is none who can tell､ Nay､ there is none who can let us hear, Nay､ there is none who can understand what ye utter.
content_old: 26 Who hath told in advance､ that we might know, And beforetime､ that we might say Right! Nay､ there is none who can tell､ Nay､ there is none who can let us hear, Nay､ there is none who can understand what ye utter.

content: 27 He who is First can say To Zion, Lo! there they are! And to Jerusalem, A herald of good-tidings do I give.
content_old: 27 He who is First can say To Zion, Lo! there they are! And to Jerusalem, A herald of good-tidings do I give.

content: 28 So I look, And there is not, a Man! Even among these And there is none to advise,— That when I ask them can answer a word.
content_old: 28 So I look, And there is not, a Man! Even among these And there is none to advise,— That when I ask them can answer a word.

content: 1 Lo! my Servant I will uphold him, My chosen well-pleased is my soul,— I have put my spirit upon him, Justice—to the nations will he bring forth:
content_old: 1 Lo! my Servant I will uphold him, My chosen well-pleased is my soul,— I have put my spirit upon him, Justice—to the nations will he bring forth:

content: 2 He will not cry out､ nor will he speak loud,— Nor cause to be heard in the street his voice:
content_old: 2 He will not cry out､ nor will he speak loud,— Nor cause to be heard in the street his voice:

content: 3 Cane that is crushed will he not break, And wick that is fading will he not quench,— Faithfully will he bring forth justice:
content_old: 3 Cane that is crushed will he not break, And wick that is fading will he not quench,— Faithfully will he bring forth justice:

content: 4 He will not fade､ nor will he be crushed, Until he establish in the earth justice, And for his instruction Coastlands wait.
content_old: 4 He will not fade､ nor will he be crushed, Until he establish in the earth justice, And for his instruction Coastlands wait.

content: 5 Thus saith GOD himself— Yahweh､— Creator of the heavens､ that stretched them forth, Out-spreader of earth､ and the products thereof,— Giver of breath to the people thereon, And of spirit to them who walk therein
content_old: 5 Thus saith GOD himself— Yahweh､— Creator of the heavens､ that stretched them forth, Out-spreader of earth､ and the products thereof,— Giver of breath to the people thereon, And of spirit to them who walk therein

content: 6 I—Yahweh have called thee in righteousness､ And will firmly grasp thy hand,— And will keep thee､ And give thee— As the covenant of a people､ As the light of nations:
content_old: 6 I—Yahweh have called thee in righteousness､ And will firmly grasp thy hand,— And will keep thee､ And give thee— As the covenant of a people､ As the light of nations:

content: 7 To open eyes that are blind,— To bring forth Out of the dungeon､ the captive, Out of the prison､ the dwellers in darkness.
content_old: 7 To open eyes that are blind,— To bring forth Out of the dungeon､ the captive, Out of the prison､ the dwellers in darkness.

content: 8 I am Yahweh､ that is my Name,— And my glory to another will I not give, Nor my praise to images.
content_old: 8 I am Yahweh､ that is my Name,— And my glory to another will I not give, Nor my praise to images.

content: 9 Things told in advance lo! they have come to pass,— And new things am I telling, Ere yet they spring forth I let you hear them.
content_old: 9 Things told in advance lo! they have come to pass,— And new things am I telling, Ere yet they spring forth I let you hear them.

content: 10 Sing to Yahweh､ a song that is new, His praise from the end of the earth,— Ye that go down to the sea､ and the fulness thereof, The Coastlands､ and ye who dwell therein.
content_old: 10 Sing to Yahweh､ a song that is new, His praise from the end of the earth,— Ye that go down to the sea､ and the fulness thereof, The Coastlands､ and ye who dwell therein.

content: 11 Let the wilderness shout､ and the cities thereof, The villages､ wherein dwelleth Kedar,— Let the inhabitants of the crag､ raise shouts of triumph, From the top of the mountains let them cry aloud:
content_old: 11 Let the wilderness shout､ and the cities thereof, The villages､ wherein dwelleth Kedar,— Let the inhabitants of the crag､ raise shouts of triumph, From the top of the mountains let them cry aloud:

content: 12 Let them render unto Yahweh glory,— And his praise in the Coastlands let them tell.
content_old: 12 Let them render unto Yahweh glory,— And his praise in the Coastlands let them tell.

content: 13 Yahweh as a hero goeth forth, As a man of war he stirreth up jealousy,— He giveth a cry､ yea he raiseth a war-cry, Over his foes he showeth his strength.
content_old: 13 Yahweh as a hero goeth forth, As a man of war he stirreth up jealousy,— He giveth a cry､ yea he raiseth a war-cry, Over his foes he showeth his strength.

content: 14 I have held my peace from age-past times, I kept still､ I restrained myself,— As a travailing woman I pant, I breathe hard and gasp､ all at onceI!
content_old: 14 I have held my peace from age-past times, I kept still､ I restrained myself,— As a travailing woman I pant, I breathe hard and gasp､ all at onceI!

content: 15 I will lay waste mountains､ and hills, And all their vegetation will I wither,— And I will make rivers to be shores, And lakes will I dry up:
content_old: 15 I will lay waste mountains､ and hills, And all their vegetation will I wither,— And I will make rivers to be shores, And lakes will I dry up:

content: 16 Thus will I lead the blind､ by a way they know not, In paths they know not will I guide them,— I will make the place that was dark before them to be light､ And crooked ways､ to be straight, These things have I done unto them､ And have not forsaken them.
content_old: 16 Thus will I lead the blind､ by a way they know not, In paths they know not will I guide them,— I will make the place that was dark before them to be light､ And crooked ways､ to be straight, These things have I done unto them､ And have not forsaken them.

content: 17 They have drawn back They turn very pale Who have been trusting in a graven image,— Who have been saying to a molten image､ Ye are our gods!
content_old: 17 They have drawn back They turn very pale Who have been trusting in a graven image,— Who have been saying to a molten image､ Ye are our gods!

content: 18 Ye deaf､ hear! And ye blind､ look around that ye may see!
content_old: 18 Ye deaf､ hear! And ye blind､ look around that ye may see!

content: 19 Who is blind､ if not my Servant? Or deaf､ like my messenger whom I send? Who is blind､ like an intimate friend? Or blind､ like the Servant of Yahweh?
content_old: 19 Who is blind､ if not my Servant? Or deaf､ like my messenger whom I send? Who is blind､ like an intimate friend? Or blind､ like the Servant of Yahweh?

content: 20 Seeing many things yet thou heedest not, Opening the ears��� yet he heareth not.
content_old: 20 Seeing many things yet thou heedest not, Opening the ears��� yet he heareth not.

content: 21 Yahweh is well-pleased for his own righteousness’ sake, He magnifieth instruction and maketh it majestic.
content_old: 21 Yahweh is well-pleased for his own righteousness’ sake, He magnifieth instruction and maketh it majestic.

content: 22 But that is a people preyed upon and plundered, Snared in holes､ all of them, And in houses of restraint concealed,— They have become a prey､ and there is none to deliver,— A booty､ and there is none to say— Restore!
content_old: 22 But that is a people preyed upon and plundered, Snared in holes､ all of them, And in houses of restraint concealed,— They have become a prey､ and there is none to deliver,— A booty､ and there is none to say— Restore!

content: 23 Who among you will give ear to this,— Let him hearken and hear for an af tertime?
content_old: 23 Who among you will give ear to this,— Let him hearken and hear for an af tertime?

content: 24 Who gave as a booty Jacob､ And Israel to them who were ready to take prey? Was it not Yahweh? He against whom we have sinned, And they were not willing in his ways to walk, Neither hearkened they to his instruction?
content_old: 24 Who gave as a booty Jacob､ And Israel to them who were ready to take prey? Was it not Yahweh? He against whom we have sinned, And they were not willing in his ways to walk, Neither hearkened they to his instruction?

content: 1 Now therefore, Thus saith Yahweh— Creating thee､ O Jacob, and Fashioning thee､ O Israel,— Do not fear､ For I have redeemed thee, I have called thee by thy name､ Mine thou art!
content_old: 1 Now therefore, Thus saith Yahweh— Creating thee､ O Jacob, and Fashioning thee､ O Israel,— Do not fear､ For I have redeemed thee, I have called thee by thy name､ Mine thou art!

content: 2 When thou passest through the waters with thee I am, Or through the rivers they shall not overflow thee,— When thou walkest through fire thou shalt not be scorched, And a flame shall not kindle upon thee;
content_old: 2 When thou passest through the waters with thee I am, Or through the rivers they shall not overflow thee,— When thou walkest through fire thou shalt not be scorched, And a flame shall not kindle upon thee;

content: 3 For l—Yahweh am Thy God, The Holy One of Israel､ Ready to save thee,— I have given as thy ransom Egypt, Ethiopia and Seba in thy stead.
content_old: 3 For l—Yahweh am Thy God, The Holy One of Israel､ Ready to save thee,— I have given as thy ransom Egypt, Ethiopia and Seba in thy stead.

content: 4 Because thou art precious in mine eyes､ art honoured､ And I love thee,— And will give mankind in thy stead Yea peoples for thy life
content_old: 4 Because thou art precious in mine eyes､ art honoured､ And I love thee,— And will give mankind in thy stead Yea peoples for thy life

content: 5 Do not fear､ for with thee I am,— From the East will I bring in thy seed, And from the West will I gather thee;
content_old: 5 Do not fear､ for with thee I am,— From the East will I bring in thy seed, And from the West will I gather thee;

content: 6 I will say to the North､ Give up! And to the South､ Do not withhold! Bring in My sons from far, and My daughters､ from the end of the earth;
content_old: 6 I will say to the North､ Give up! And to the South､ Do not withhold! Bring in My sons from far, and My daughters､ from the end of the earth;

content: 7 Every one who is called by my Name, Whom for mine own glory I have created—formed—yea made!
content_old: 7 Every one who is called by my Name, Whom for mine own glory I have created—formed—yea made!

content: 8 Bring forth A blind people､ that have eyes, and A deaf､ that have ears.
content_old: 8 Bring forth A blind people､ that have eyes, and A deaf､ that have ears.

content: 9 All the nations are gathered together､ Yea there is an assembling of peoples, Who among them can tell this, And things in advance can let us hear? Let them set forth their witnesses､ that they may get their right, Or let them hear､ and say Truth!
content_old: 9 All the nations are gathered together､ Yea there is an assembling of peoples, Who among them can tell this, And things in advance can let us hear? Let them set forth their witnesses､ that they may get their right, Or let them hear､ and say Truth!

content: 10 Ye are my witnesses､ Declareth Yahweh, And my Servant､ whom I have chosen,— That ye may take note—and believe me､ And perceive that I am He, Before me was not formed a GOD, Nor after me shall one come into being:
content_old: 10 Ye are my witnesses､ Declareth Yahweh, And my Servant､ whom I have chosen,— That ye may take note—and believe me､ And perceive that I am He, Before me was not formed a GOD, Nor after me shall one come into being:

content: 11 I—I am Yahweh,— And there is none､ besides me､ ready to save:
content_old: 11 I—I am Yahweh,— And there is none､ besides me､ ready to save:

content: 12 I have told—and will save､ and make known, That there is､ among you､ no strange one; And ye are my witnesses､ Declareth Yahweh､ That I am GOD.
content_old: 12 I have told—and will save､ and make known, That there is､ among you､ no strange one; And ye are my witnesses､ Declareth Yahweh､ That I am GOD.

content: 13 Even from To-day I am He, And none out of my hand can deliver,— I work､ and who reverseth?
content_old: 13 Even from To-day I am He, And none out of my hand can deliver,— I work､ and who reverseth?

content: 14 Thus saith Yahweh､ Your Redeemer､ The Holy One of Israel,— For your sakes have I sent into Babylon, And will bring down as fugitives all of them,— Even the Chaldeans､ in the ships which cause them loud outcry.
content_old: 14 Thus saith Yahweh､ Your Redeemer､ The Holy One of Israel,— For your sakes have I sent into Babylon, And will bring down as fugitives all of them,— Even the Chaldeans､ in the ships which cause them loud outcry.

content: 15 I—Yahweh am Your Holy One,— The Creator of Israel､ Your King.
content_old: 15 I—Yahweh am Your Holy One,— The Creator of Israel､ Your King.

content: 16 Thus saith Yahweh,— Who setteth in the sea a way,— And in the mighty waters a path;
content_old: 16 Thus saith Yahweh,— Who setteth in the sea a way,— And in the mighty waters a path;

content: 17 Who bringeth forth Chariot and horse､ Force and strength Together shall they lie down､ They shall not arise, They are extinguished､ Like a wick are they quenched!
content_old: 17 Who bringeth forth Chariot and horse､ Force and strength Together shall they lie down､ They shall not arise, They are extinguished､ Like a wick are they quenched!

content: 18 Do not keep in mind､ former things,— And things of old do not consider:
content_old: 18 Do not keep in mind､ former things,— And things of old do not consider:

content: 19 Behold me! doing a new thing､ Now shall it spring forth, Will ye not take note thereof? Surely I will set In the desert a way, In a desolate land rivers:
content_old: 19 Behold me! doing a new thing､ Now shall it spring forth, Will ye not take note thereof? Surely I will set In the desert a way, In a desolate land rivers:

content: 20 The wild beast of the field shall honour me, Jackals､ and ostriches, Because I have given— In the desert waters, Rivers in a desolate land, To give drink unto my people､ my chosen:
content_old: 20 The wild beast of the field shall honour me, Jackals､ and ostriches, Because I have given— In the desert waters, Rivers in a desolate land, To give drink unto my people､ my chosen:

content: 21 A people which I have fashioned for myself, My praise shall they record.
content_old: 21 A people which I have fashioned for myself, My praise shall they record.

content: 22 Yet not upon me hast thou called､ O Jacob,— For thou hast been wearied of me､ O Israel:
content_old: 22 Yet not upon me hast thou called､ O Jacob,— For thou hast been wearied of me､ O Israel:

content: 23 Thou hast not brought in to me small cattle as thine ascending-offerings, Nor with thy sacrifices hast thou honoured me,— I have not oppressed thee with meal-offerings, Nor have I wearied thee with frankincense;
content_old: 23 Thou hast not brought in to me small cattle as thine ascending-offerings, Nor with thy sacrifices hast thou honoured me,— I have not oppressed thee with meal-offerings, Nor have I wearied thee with frankincense;

content: 24 Thou hast not bought for me､ with silver､ fragrant calamus, Nor with the fat of thy sacrifices hast thou sated me,— Thou hast done nothing but oppress me with thy sins, Thou hast wearied me with thine iniquities.
content_old: 24 Thou hast not bought for me､ with silver､ fragrant calamus, Nor with the fat of thy sacrifices hast thou sated me,— Thou hast done nothing but oppress me with thy sins, Thou hast wearied me with thine iniquities.

content: 25 I—I am he that is ready To wipe out thy transgressions､ for mine own sake,— And thy sins not remember.
content_old: 25 I—I am he that is ready To wipe out thy transgressions､ for mine own sake,— And thy sins not remember.

content: 26 Put me in mind, Let us enter into judgment､ at once,— Recount thou that thou mayest be justified:
content_old: 26 Put me in mind, Let us enter into judgment､ at once,— Recount thou that thou mayest be justified:

content: 27 Thy chief father hath sinned,— And thine interpreters have transgressed against me;
content_old: 27 Thy chief father hath sinned,— And thine interpreters have transgressed against me;

content: 1 Now then—hear､ O Jacob my Servant,—and Israel､ whom I have chosen:
content_old: 1 Now then—hear､ O Jacob my Servant,—and Israel､ whom I have chosen:

content: 2 Thus saith Yahweh— Who made thee and formed thee from birth､ Who helpeth thee: Do not fear､ O my Servant Jacob, and Jeshurun､ whom I have chosen;
content_old: 2 Thus saith Yahweh— Who made thee and formed thee from birth､ Who helpeth thee: Do not fear､ O my Servant Jacob, and Jeshurun､ whom I have chosen;

content: 3 For I will pour Water upon the thirsty soil, and Floods upon the dry ground,— I will pour My spirit upon thy seed, and My blessing upon thine offspring;
content_old: 3 For I will pour Water upon the thirsty soil, and Floods upon the dry ground,— I will pour My spirit upon thy seed, and My blessing upon thine offspring;

content: 4 So will they spring up among the grass, As willows by the water-courses:
content_old: 4 So will they spring up among the grass, As willows by the water-courses:

content: 5 This one will say Yahweh’s am I, and That one will call himself by the name of Jacob, and Yonder one will write on his hand— Yahweh’s, And after the name of Israel will one entitle himself.
content_old: 5 This one will say Yahweh’s am I, and That one will call himself by the name of Jacob, and Yonder one will write on his hand— Yahweh’s, And after the name of Israel will one entitle himself.

content: 6 Thus saith Yahweh—King of Israel､ Even his Redeemer Yahweh of hosts,— I am First､ and I Last, And besides me there is no God.
content_old: 6 Thus saith Yahweh—King of Israel､ Even his Redeemer Yahweh of hosts,— I am First､ and I Last, And besides me there is no God.

content: 7 Who､ then､ like me can call､ and declare it､ and order it､ for me, Seeing that I appointed an age-abiding people,— Or things yet to be､ and that shall come to pass Let them declare､ on their part.
content_old: 7 Who､ then､ like me can call､ and declare it､ and order it､ for me, Seeing that I appointed an age-abiding people,— Or things yet to be､ and that shall come to pass Let them declare､ on their part.

content: 8 Do not ye dread､ nor yet be alarmed, Have I not from olden time told thee and declared? So that ye are my witnesses,— Whether there is a God besides me? Or is no Rock— I know of none!
content_old: 8 Do not ye dread､ nor yet be alarmed, Have I not from olden time told thee and declared? So that ye are my witnesses,— Whether there is a God besides me? Or is no Rock— I know of none!

content: 9 The fashioners of an image—all of them are emptiness, And the things they delight in cannot profit,— And their witnesses they neither see nor know, That they may be ashamed.
content_old: 9 The fashioners of an image—all of them are emptiness, And the things they delight in cannot profit,— And their witnesses they neither see nor know, That they may be ashamed.

content: 10 Who hath fashioned a GOD, Or an image hath molten? It cannot profit!
content_old: 10 Who hath fashioned a GOD, Or an image hath molten? It cannot profit!

content: 11 Lo! all his partners turn pale, Even the artificers themselves are of the sons of earth,— Let them gather themselves together—all of them､ Let them take their stand, Let them dread､ and turn pale together!
content_old: 11 Lo! all his partners turn pale, Even the artificers themselves are of the sons of earth,— Let them gather themselves together—all of them､ Let them take their stand, Let them dread､ and turn pale together!

content: 12 As for the smith､ with his cutting-tool— When he hath wrought in the live coals, And with hammers hath fashioned it,— And hath wrought it with his strong arm Anon he is hungry､ and hath no strength, He hath drunk no water､ and so hath become faint!
content_old: 12 As for the smith､ with his cutting-tool— When he hath wrought in the live coals, And with hammers hath fashioned it,— And hath wrought it with his strong arm Anon he is hungry､ and hath no strength, He hath drunk no water､ and so hath become faint!

content: 13 As for the carpenter— He hath stretched out a line､ hath drawn it with a pencil､ Hath made it with carving tools, With compasses hath rounded it,— And so hath made it after the figure of a great man, After the beauty of a son of earth､ that it may remain in a house!
content_old: 13 As for the carpenter— He hath stretched out a line､ hath drawn it with a pencil､ Hath made it with carving tools, With compasses hath rounded it,— And so hath made it after the figure of a great man, After the beauty of a son of earth､ that it may remain in a house!

content: 14 When one was cutting him down cedars Then took he a holm-tree､ and an oak, And secured them for himself､ among the trees of the forest,— He planted a fir-tree､ and the pouring rain made it grow;
content_old: 14 When one was cutting him down cedars Then took he a holm-tree､ and an oak, And secured them for himself､ among the trees of the forest,— He planted a fir-tree､ and the pouring rain made it grow;

content: 15 So it serveth for a man to burn, And he hath taken of the branches and warmed himself, Also he kindleth a fire､ and baketh bread,— Also he maketh a GOD､ and hath bowed himself down, Hath made of it a carved image､ and adored it:
content_old: 15 So it serveth for a man to burn, And he hath taken of the branches and warmed himself, Also he kindleth a fire､ and baketh bread,— Also he maketh a GOD､ and hath bowed himself down, Hath made of it a carved image､ and adored it:

content: 16 The half thereof hath he burned in the fire, Over half thereof he eateth flesh, He roasteth roast､ that he may be satisfied,— Also he warmeth himself､ and saith､ Aha! I am warm､ I have seen a blaze;
content_old: 16 The half thereof hath he burned in the fire, Over half thereof he eateth flesh, He roasteth roast､ that he may be satisfied,— Also he warmeth himself､ and saith､ Aha! I am warm､ I have seen a blaze;

content: 17 And the residue thereof Into a GOD he maketh､ Into his carved image,— Adoreth it､ and boweth down､ and prayeth unto it､ And saith､ Deliver me, for my GOD thou art!
content_old: 17 And the residue thereof Into a GOD he maketh､ Into his carved image,— Adoreth it､ and boweth down､ and prayeth unto it､ And saith､ Deliver me, for my GOD thou art!

content: 18 They have not taken note､ neither can they perceive,— He hath besmeared—past seeing—their eyes, Past understanding､ their hearts;
content_old: 18 They have not taken note､ neither can they perceive,— He hath besmeared—past seeing—their eyes, Past understanding､ their hearts;

content: 19 And no one reflecteth— There is neither knowledge nor discernment—to say, Half thereof have I burned up in the fire､ Moreover also I have baked on the coals thereof bread, I roasted flesh､ and have been eating,— And of the remainder thereof an abomination shall I make? And to a log of wood shall I pay adoration?
content_old: 19 And no one reflecteth— There is neither knowledge nor discernment—to say, Half thereof have I burned up in the fire､ Moreover also I have baked on the coals thereof bread, I roasted flesh､ and have been eating,— And of the remainder thereof an abomination shall I make? And to a log of wood shall I pay adoration?

content: 20 He is feeding on ashes, A deluded heart hath turned him aside,— And he cannot deliver his own soul､ nor say, Is there not a falsehood in my right hand?
content_old: 20 He is feeding on ashes, A deluded heart hath turned him aside,— And he cannot deliver his own soul､ nor say, Is there not a falsehood in my right hand?

content: 21 Remember these things､ O Jacob, And Israel､—for my Servant thou art,— I have fashioned thee､ a Servant of mine thou art.
content_old: 21 Remember these things､ O Jacob, And Israel､—for my Servant thou art,— I have fashioned thee､ a Servant of mine thou art.

content: 22 O Israel､ thou shalt not be forgotten of me. I have wiped out､ As with a thick cloud､ thy transgressions, And as with a broad cloud thy sins,— Return unto me､ for I have redeemed thee.
content_old: 22 O Israel､ thou shalt not be forgotten of me. I have wiped out､ As with a thick cloud､ thy transgressions, And as with a broad cloud thy sins,— Return unto me､ for I have redeemed thee.

content: 23 Shout in triumph､ ye heavens､ for Yahweh hath effectually wrought､ Shout､ O ye underparts of the earth, Ring out､ Ye mountains､ into cries of triumph, Thou forest､ and every tree therein,— For Yahweh hath redeemed Jacob, And in Israel will he get himself glory.
content_old: 23 Shout in triumph､ ye heavens､ for Yahweh hath effectually wrought､ Shout､ O ye underparts of the earth, Ring out､ Ye mountains､ into cries of triumph, Thou forest､ and every tree therein,— For Yahweh hath redeemed Jacob, And in Israel will he get himself glory.

content: 24 Thus saith Yahweh､ Who hath redeemed thee, Who hath fashioned thee from birth,— I—Yahweh am the maker of all things, Stretching out the heavens､ alone, Spreading forth the earth､ of myself;
content_old: 24 Thus saith Yahweh､ Who hath redeemed thee, Who hath fashioned thee from birth,— I—Yahweh am the maker of all things, Stretching out the heavens､ alone, Spreading forth the earth､ of myself;

content: 25 Frustrating the signs of praters, And diviners he confoundeth,— Turning wise men backwards, And their knowledge he maketh folly;
content_old: 25 Frustrating the signs of praters, And diviners he confoundeth,— Turning wise men backwards, And their knowledge he maketh folly;

content: 26 Establishing the word of his Servant, And the counsel of his Messengers he maketh good,— Who saith of Jerusalem— She shall be inhabited! And of the cities of Judah— They shall be built! And the ruins thereof will I set up!
content_old: 26 Establishing the word of his Servant, And the counsel of his Messengers he maketh good,— Who saith of Jerusalem— She shall be inhabited! And of the cities of Judah— They shall be built! And the ruins thereof will I set up!

content: 27 Who saith to the deep— Be dry! and Thy rivers will I drain!
content_old: 27 Who saith to the deep— Be dry! and Thy rivers will I drain!

content: 1 Thus saith Yahweh､ to his Anointed､ to Cyrus— Whose right hand I have firmly grasped､ To subdue､ before him nations, And the loins of kings will I ungird,— To open､ before him､ the two-leaved doors, And the gates shall not be shut:
content_old: 1 Thus saith Yahweh､ to his Anointed､ to Cyrus— Whose right hand I have firmly grasped､ To subdue､ before him nations, And the loins of kings will I ungird,— To open､ before him､ the two-leaved doors, And the gates shall not be shut:

content: 2 I before thee will go, And the hills will I level,— The doors of bronze will I break in pieces, And the bars of iron will I cut asunder;
content_old: 2 I before thee will go, And the hills will I level,— The doors of bronze will I break in pieces, And the bars of iron will I cut asunder;

content: 3 Then will I give thee The treasures of darkness, Even the hoards of hidden places,— That thou mayest get to know That I—Yahweh､ who am calling thee by thy name am the God of Israel.
content_old: 3 Then will I give thee The treasures of darkness, Even the hoards of hidden places,— That thou mayest get to know That I—Yahweh､ who am calling thee by thy name am the God of Israel.

content: 4 For the sake of my servant Jacob, Even Israel my chosen Therefore have I called unto thee by thy name, I give thee a title though thou hast not known me,—
content_old: 4 For the sake of my servant Jacob, Even Israel my chosen Therefore have I called unto thee by thy name, I give thee a title though thou hast not known me,—

content: 5 I am Yahweh､ and there is none else, Besides me there is no God,— I gird thee､ though thou hast not known me:
content_old: 5 I am Yahweh､ and there is none else, Besides me there is no God,— I gird thee､ though thou hast not known me:

content: 6 That men may get to know､ From the rising of the sun､ And from the west､ That there is none besides me,— I am Yahweh､ and there is none else:
content_old: 6 That men may get to know､ From the rising of the sun､ And from the west､ That there is none besides me,— I am Yahweh､ and there is none else:

content: 7 Forming light､ and creating darkness, Making prosperity､ and creating misfortune,— I—Yahweh who doeth all these.
content_old: 7 Forming light､ and creating darkness, Making prosperity､ and creating misfortune,— I—Yahweh who doeth all these.

content: 8 Let the drops fall､ ye heavens､ from above, Yea､ let the skies pour down righteousness,— Let the earth open､ and let them bear as their fruit—deliverance､ And let justice spring forth therewith, I—Yahweh have created it.
content_old: 8 Let the drops fall､ ye heavens､ from above, Yea､ let the skies pour down righteousness,— Let the earth open､ and let them bear as their fruit—deliverance､ And let justice spring forth therewith, I—Yahweh have created it.

content: 9 Alas for him who contendeth with his Fashioner,— A potsherd should contend with the potsherds of the ground! Shall it be said by the clay unto him that is fashioning it, What wouldst thou make? Or thy work say of thee, He hath no hands?
content_old: 9 Alas for him who contendeth with his Fashioner,— A potsherd should contend with the potsherds of the ground! Shall it be said by the clay unto him that is fashioning it, What wouldst thou make? Or thy work say of thee, He hath no hands?

content: 10 Alas for one who saith to a father､ What begettest thou; Or to a woman､ What dost thou bring forth?
content_old: 10 Alas for one who saith to a father､ What begettest thou; Or to a woman､ What dost thou bring forth?

content: 11 Thus saith Yahweh The Holy One of Israel And his Fashioner, As to things to come they have asked me, Concerning my sons and concerning the work of my hands they would command me!
content_old: 11 Thus saith Yahweh The Holy One of Israel And his Fashioner, As to things to come they have asked me, Concerning my sons and concerning the work of my hands they would command me!

content: 12 I made the earth, And man upon it I created,— I—mine own hands, stretched out the heavens, And all their host I commanded:
content_old: 12 I made the earth, And man upon it I created,— I—mine own hands, stretched out the heavens, And all their host I commanded:

content: 13 I have roused him up in righteousness, And all his roads will I level,— He shall build my city､ And my captives shall he let go, Not for price､ nor for bribe Saith Yahweh of hosts.
content_old: 13 I have roused him up in righteousness, And all his roads will I level,— He shall build my city､ And my captives shall he let go, Not for price､ nor for bribe Saith Yahweh of hosts.

content: 14 Thus saith Yahweh— The produce of Egypt and the gain of Ethiopia､ and the Sabeans､ men of great stature Unto thee shall come over､ And thine shall they become, After thee shall they journey, In chains shall they come over,— And unto thee shall they bow down､ Unto thee shall they pray saying,— Surely in thee is a GOD､ And there is none else—no God!
content_old: 14 Thus saith Yahweh— The produce of Egypt and the gain of Ethiopia､ and the Sabeans､ men of great stature Unto thee shall come over､ And thine shall they become, After thee shall they journey, In chains shall they come over,— And unto thee shall they bow down､ Unto thee shall they pray saying,— Surely in thee is a GOD､ And there is none else—no God!

content: 15 Surely thou art a GOD utterly hiding thyself,— O God of Israel､ able to save!
content_old: 15 Surely thou art a GOD utterly hiding thyself,— O God of Israel､ able to save!

content: 16 They have turned pale and even been put to shame all of them,— Together have they gone into disgrace, have the makers of images:
content_old: 16 They have turned pale and even been put to shame all of them,— Together have they gone into disgrace, have the makers of images:

content: 17 Israel hath been delivered by Yahweh, with an age-abiding deliverance,— Ye shall neither turn pale nor be put to shame､ unto the ages of futurity.
content_old: 17 Israel hath been delivered by Yahweh, with an age-abiding deliverance,— Ye shall neither turn pale nor be put to shame､ unto the ages of futurity.

content: 18 For Thus saith Yahweh､ Who created the heavens､ God himself Who fashioned the earth— And made it､ Himself established it, … Not a waste created he it､ To be dwelt in he fashioned it, … I am Yahweh､ and there is none else:
content_old: 18 For Thus saith Yahweh､ Who created the heavens､ God himself Who fashioned the earth— And made it､ Himself established it, … Not a waste created he it､ To be dwelt in he fashioned it, … I am Yahweh､ and there is none else:

content: 19 Not in secret have I spoken In a place of the earth that is dark,— I have not said unto the seed of Jacob､ In a waste seek ye me,— I am Yahweh､ Speaking the thing that is right, Declaring the things that are just.
content_old: 19 Not in secret have I spoken In a place of the earth that is dark,— I have not said unto the seed of Jacob､ In a waste seek ye me,— I am Yahweh､ Speaking the thing that is right, Declaring the things that are just.

content: 20 Assemble yourselves and come､ Draw near together､ ye escaped of the nations,— They know not Who carry the wood of their carved image, And pray unto a GOD who cannot save.
content_old: 20 Assemble yourselves and come､ Draw near together､ ye escaped of the nations,— They know not Who carry the wood of their carved image, And pray unto a GOD who cannot save.

content: 21 Tell ye—and bring near, Yea let them take counsel together,— Who let this be known aforetime､ In time past declared it? Was it not I—Yahweh? And there is none else that is God､ besides me, A GOD､ righteous and ready to save, There is none､ besides me!
content_old: 21 Tell ye—and bring near, Yea let them take counsel together,— Who let this be known aforetime､ In time past declared it? Was it not I—Yahweh? And there is none else that is God､ besides me, A GOD､ righteous and ready to save, There is none､ besides me!

content: 22 Turn unto me—and be ye saved､ all ye ends of the earth,— For I am GOD､ and there is none else.
content_old: 22 Turn unto me—and be ye saved､ all ye ends of the earth,— For I am GOD､ and there is none else.

content: 23 By myself have I sworn, Gone forth out of my mouth is righteousness as a decree､ And shall not turn back,— That unto myself Shall bow every knee, Shall swear every tongue:
content_old: 23 By myself have I sworn, Gone forth out of my mouth is righteousness as a decree､ And shall not turn back,— That unto myself Shall bow every knee, Shall swear every tongue:

content: 24 Only in Yahweh—for me Hath one said､ Is there righteousness and strength. Unto him shall come and turn pale— All who have been incensed against him:
content_old: 24 Only in Yahweh—for me Hath one said､ Is there righteousness and strength. Unto him shall come and turn pale— All who have been incensed against him:

content: 1 Bel hath crouched､ Nebo is cowering, Their images are delivered up to beast､ and to cattle,— The things ye carried about are become a load, A burden to the weary!
content_old: 1 Bel hath crouched､ Nebo is cowering, Their images are delivered up to beast､ and to cattle,— The things ye carried about are become a load, A burden to the weary!

content: 2 They have cowered､ they have crouchedat once, And they cannot rescue the burden,— But their own soul into captivity hath departed.
content_old: 2 They have cowered､ they have crouchedat once, And they cannot rescue the burden,— But their own soul into captivity hath departed.

content: 3 Hearken unto me､ O house of Jacob, Even all the remnant of the house of Israel,— Who have been borne from birth, Who have been carried from nativity:
content_old: 3 Hearken unto me､ O house of Jacob, Even all the remnant of the house of Israel,— Who have been borne from birth, Who have been carried from nativity:

content: 4 Even unto old age I am the same, And unto grey hairs I will bear the burden,— l have made､ and I will carry, Yea I will bear the burden and will deliver.
content_old: 4 Even unto old age I am the same, And unto grey hairs I will bear the burden,— l have made､ and I will carry, Yea I will bear the burden and will deliver.

content: 5 To whom can ye liken me､ or make me equal? Or compare me､ and we be like?
content_old: 5 To whom can ye liken me､ or make me equal? Or compare me､ and we be like?

content: 6 They who pour gold out of a purse, And who weigh silver in a balance,— Who hire a goldsmith､ that he may make it into a GOD, They adore､ yea they bow down;
content_old: 6 They who pour gold out of a purse, And who weigh silver in a balance,— Who hire a goldsmith､ that he may make it into a GOD, They adore､ yea they bow down;

content: 7 They carry him about on the shoulder､ They bear the burden of him—and set him in his place､ that he may stand,— Out of his place will he not move,— Though one even make outcry unto him he will not answer, Out of one’s trouble he will not save him.
content_old: 7 They carry him about on the shoulder､ They bear the burden of him—and set him in his place､ that he may stand,— Out of his place will he not move,— Though one even make outcry unto him he will not answer, Out of one’s trouble he will not save him.

content: 8 Remember ye this､ and shew yourselves men,— Bring it back､ ye transgressors､ to your minds;
content_old: 8 Remember ye this､ and shew yourselves men,— Bring it back､ ye transgressors､ to your minds;

content: 9 Remember ye the things named in advance､ from age-past times,— For I am The Mighty One､ and there is none else, The Adorable､ and there is none like me!
content_old: 9 Remember ye the things named in advance､ from age-past times,— For I am The Mighty One､ and there is none else, The Adorable､ and there is none like me!

content: 10 Declaring from the beginning the latter end, And from olden time that which had never been done,— Saying My purpose shall stand, and All my pleasure will I perform;
content_old: 10 Declaring from the beginning the latter end, And from olden time that which had never been done,— Saying My purpose shall stand, and All my pleasure will I perform;

content: 11 Calling From the East､ a Bird of Prey, From a far country､ the Man I intended,,— Yea I have spoken､ I will also bring it to pass, I have planned､ I will also do it.
content_old: 11 Calling From the East､ a Bird of Prey, From a far country､ the Man I intended,,— Yea I have spoken､ I will also bring it to pass, I have planned､ I will also do it.

content: 12 Hearken unto me､ Ye valiant of heart,— Who are far away from righteousness:
content_old: 12 Hearken unto me､ Ye valiant of heart,— Who are far away from righteousness:

content: 1 Down—and sit in the dust､ O virgin､ Daughter of Babylon, Sit on the ground—throneless､ Daughter of the Chaldeans; For thou shalt no more be called Tender and Dainty.
content_old: 1 Down—and sit in the dust､ O virgin､ Daughter of Babylon, Sit on the ground—throneless､ Daughter of the Chaldeans; For thou shalt no more be called Tender and Dainty.

content: 2 Take millstones､ and grind meal,— Put back thy veil—tuck up thy train､ Bare the leg､ wade through streams:
content_old: 2 Take millstones､ and grind meal,— Put back thy veil—tuck up thy train､ Bare the leg､ wade through streams:

content: 3 Bared shall be thy shame, Yea seen thy reproach,— An avenging will I take, And will accept no son of earth.
content_old: 3 Bared shall be thy shame, Yea seen thy reproach,— An avenging will I take, And will accept no son of earth.

content: 4 Our Redeemer Yahweh of hosts is his name! The Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 4 Our Redeemer Yahweh of hosts is his name! The Holy One of Israel.

content: 5 Sit silent､ and get into darkness, Daughter of the Chaldeans! For thou shalt no more be called､ Mistress of Kingdoms.
content_old: 5 Sit silent､ and get into darkness, Daughter of the Chaldeans! For thou shalt no more be called､ Mistress of Kingdoms.

content: 6 I had been provoked with my people､ Had profaned mine inheritance, And given them into thy hand, … Thou shewedst them no compassion, Upon the elder madest thou very heavy thy yoke.
content_old: 6 I had been provoked with my people､ Had profaned mine inheritance, And given them into thy hand, … Thou shewedst them no compassion, Upon the elder madest thou very heavy thy yoke.

content: 7 And thou saidst, Unto times age-abiding shall I be Mistress,— Insomuch that thou laidst not these things to thy heart, Didst not keep in mind the issue thereof.
content_old: 7 And thou saidst, Unto times age-abiding shall I be Mistress,— Insomuch that thou laidst not these things to thy heart, Didst not keep in mind the issue thereof.

content: 8 Now therefore､ hear this､ Thou Lady of pleasure､ Who dwelleth securely, Who saith in her heart,— I am, and there is no one besides, I shall not sit a widow, Nor know loss of children.
content_old: 8 Now therefore､ hear this､ Thou Lady of pleasure､ Who dwelleth securely, Who saith in her heart,— I am, and there is no one besides, I shall not sit a widow, Nor know loss of children.

content: 9 Yet shall there come to thee—both these､ in a moment､ in one day､ Loss of children and widowhood,— To their full have they come on thee, Spite of the mass of thine incantations, Spite of the great throng of thy spells.
content_old: 9 Yet shall there come to thee—both these､ in a moment､ in one day､ Loss of children and widowhood,— To their full have they come on thee, Spite of the mass of thine incantations, Spite of the great throng of thy spells.

content: 10 And so thou didst trust in thy wickedness､ Thou saidst No one seeth me, Thy wisdom and knowledge the same seduced thee,— Therefore saidst thou in thy heart, I am ､ and there is no one besides.
content_old: 10 And so thou didst trust in thy wickedness､ Thou saidst No one seeth me, Thy wisdom and knowledge the same seduced thee,— Therefore saidst thou in thy heart, I am ､ and there is no one besides.

content: 11 Therefore shall come on thee—Mischief､ Thou shalt not know how to charm it away, Yea there shall fall on thee､ Ruin, Thou shalt not be able to appease it,— And there shall come on thee､ suddenly､ Desolation､ Thou shalt not know.
content_old: 11 Therefore shall come on thee—Mischief､ Thou shalt not know how to charm it away, Yea there shall fall on thee､ Ruin, Thou shalt not be able to appease it,— And there shall come on thee､ suddenly､ Desolation､ Thou shalt not know.

content: 12 Take thy stand､ I pray thee､ With thy spells､ And with the throng of thine incantations､ wherein thou hast wearied thyself from thy youth,— Peradventure thou mayest be able to profit､ Peradventure thou mayest strike me with terror.
content_old: 12 Take thy stand､ I pray thee､ With thy spells､ And with the throng of thine incantations､ wherein thou hast wearied thyself from thy youth,— Peradventure thou mayest be able to profit､ Peradventure thou mayest strike me with terror.

content: 13 Thou hast worn thyself out with the mass of thy consultations,— Let them take their stand､ I pray thee､ that they may save thee— The dividers of the heavens— The gazers at the stars, They who make known by new moons, Somewhat of the things which shall come upon thee.
content_old: 13 Thou hast worn thyself out with the mass of thy consultations,— Let them take their stand､ I pray thee､ that they may save thee— The dividers of the heavens— The gazers at the stars, They who make known by new moons, Somewhat of the things which shall come upon thee.

content: 14 Lo! they have become as straw—a fire hath burned them up, They shall not deliver their own soul from the grasp of the flame,— There is no live coal to warm them, nor blaze to sit before.
content_old: 14 Lo! they have become as straw—a fire hath burned them up, They shall not deliver their own soul from the grasp of the flame,— There is no live coal to warm them, nor blaze to sit before.

content: 1 Hear ye this—O house of Jacob､ Ye who call yourselves by the name of Israel, Yea from the waters of Judah came they forth,— Who swear by the name of Yahweh､ And by the God of Israel call to remembrance— Not in truth､ nor in righteousness;
content_old: 1 Hear ye this—O house of Jacob､ Ye who call yourselves by the name of Israel, Yea from the waters of Judah came they forth,— Who swear by the name of Yahweh､ And by the God of Israel call to remembrance— Not in truth､ nor in righteousness;

content: 2 For of the holy city do they call themselves, And on the God of Israel do they stay themselves,— Yahweh of hosts is his name.
content_old: 2 For of the holy city do they call themselves, And on the God of Israel do they stay themselves,— Yahweh of hosts is his name.

content: 3 Things in advance of old I declared, Yea out of mine own mouth came they forth､ that I might let them be known,— Suddenly I wrought､ and they came to pass.
content_old: 3 Things in advance of old I declared, Yea out of mine own mouth came they forth､ that I might let them be known,— Suddenly I wrought､ and they came to pass.

content: 4 Because I knew that— Obstinate thou wast,— And a sinew of iron was thy neck, And thy brow､ brazen
content_old: 4 Because I knew that— Obstinate thou wast,— And a sinew of iron was thy neck, And thy brow､ brazen

content: 5 Therefore told I thee—in time past, Ere yet it came I let thee hear,— Lest thou shouldest say— Mine idol wrought them, Yea my carved image and my molten image commanded them!
content_old: 5 Therefore told I thee—in time past, Ere yet it came I let thee hear,— Lest thou shouldest say— Mine idol wrought them, Yea my carved image and my molten image commanded them!

content: 6 Thou hast heard—see it whole And will ye not tell? I have let thee hear new things—from the present time, Even secrets､ which ye knew not.
content_old: 6 Thou hast heard—see it whole And will ye not tell? I have let thee hear new things—from the present time, Even secrets､ which ye knew not.

content: 7 Now are they created､ and not in time past, And before to-day thou hadst not heard of them,— Lest thou shouldest say､ Lo! I knew them!
content_old: 7 Now are they created､ and not in time past, And before to-day thou hadst not heard of them,— Lest thou shouldest say､ Lo! I knew them!

content: 8 Nay! thou hadst not heard､ Nay! thou hadst not known, Nay! in time past thine ear was not opened,— For I knew that thou wouldst be treacherous, Yea a transgressor from birth hast thou been called.
content_old: 8 Nay! thou hadst not heard､ Nay! thou hadst not known, Nay! in time past thine ear was not opened,— For I knew that thou wouldst be treacherous, Yea a transgressor from birth hast thou been called.

content: 9 For the sake of mine own Name will I defer mine anger, And for my praise will I restrain myself towards thee,— So as not to cut thee off.
content_old: 9 For the sake of mine own Name will I defer mine anger, And for my praise will I restrain myself towards thee,— So as not to cut thee off.

content: 10 Lo! I have refined thee､ but not as silver,— I have tested thee､ in a smelting-pot of affliction.
content_old: 10 Lo! I have refined thee､ but not as silver,— I have tested thee､ in a smelting-pot of affliction.

content: 11 For mine own sake—for mine own sake will I effectually work､ For how should it be profaned? And my glory—to another will I not give.
content_old: 11 For mine own sake—for mine own sake will I effectually work､ For how should it be profaned? And my glory—to another will I not give.

content: 12 Hearken unto me､ O Jacob, And Israel､ my called one,— I am the Same､ I the first, yea l the last:
content_old: 12 Hearken unto me､ O Jacob, And Israel､ my called one,— I am the Same､ I the first, yea l the last:

content: 13 Surely mine own hand founded the earth, And my right hand stretched out the heavens,— While I was calling unto them they stood forth at once
content_old: 13 Surely mine own hand founded the earth, And my right hand stretched out the heavens,— While I was calling unto them they stood forth at once

content: 14 Assemble yourselves—all of you､ and hear, Who among them hath told these things? He whom Yahweh loveth will execute— His pleasure､ on Babylon, And his stroke､ on the Chaldeans.
content_old: 14 Assemble yourselves—all of you､ and hear, Who among them hath told these things? He whom Yahweh loveth will execute— His pleasure､ on Babylon, And his stroke､ on the Chaldeans.

content: 15 I—I have spoken､ Yea I have called him,— I have brought him in､ and he shall make prosperous his way.
content_old: 15 I—I have spoken､ Yea I have called him,— I have brought him in､ and he shall make prosperous his way.

content: 16 Draw ye near unto me—hear ye this､ Not in advance､ in secret have I spoken, From the very time it cometh into being there am I,— And now My Lord Yahweh hath sent me､ and his spirit.
content_old: 16 Draw ye near unto me—hear ye this､ Not in advance､ in secret have I spoken, From the very time it cometh into being there am I,— And now My Lord Yahweh hath sent me､ and his spirit.

content: 17 Thus saith Yahweh— Thy Redeemer､ The Holy One of Israel,— I—Yahweh am thy God, Teaching thee to profit, Guiding thee in the way thou shouldest go.
content_old: 17 Thus saith Yahweh— Thy Redeemer､ The Holy One of Israel,— I—Yahweh am thy God, Teaching thee to profit, Guiding thee in the way thou shouldest go.

content: 18 Oh! that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments,— Then had been like a river thy prosperity, And thy righteonsness､ like the waves of the sea:
content_old: 18 Oh! that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments,— Then had been like a river thy prosperity, And thy righteonsness､ like the waves of the sea:

content: 19 Then had been like the sand thy seed, And the offspring of thy body like the grains thereof,— Neither cut off nor destroyed had been his name from before me.
content_old: 19 Then had been like the sand thy seed, And the offspring of thy body like the grains thereof,— Neither cut off nor destroyed had been his name from before me.

content: 20 Come ye forth out of Babylon､ Flee from among the Chaldeans, With triumphant voice tell ye—let this be heard, Let it go forth as far as the end of the earth,— Say ye— Yahweh hath redeemed his servant Jacob!
content_old: 20 Come ye forth out of Babylon､ Flee from among the Chaldeans, With triumphant voice tell ye—let this be heard, Let it go forth as far as the end of the earth,— Say ye— Yahweh hath redeemed his servant Jacob!

content: 21 And they thirsted not､ when through dry places he led them, Waters out of the rock caused he to flow out to them,— Yea he cleft a rock､ and there gushed out waters.
content_old: 21 And they thirsted not､ when through dry places he led them, Waters out of the rock caused he to flow out to them,— Yea he cleft a rock､ and there gushed out waters.

content: 1 Hearken､ ye Coastlands､ unto me, And give ear､ ye peoples afar off,— Yahweh called me from my birth, From my nativity made he mention of my name;
content_old: 1 Hearken､ ye Coastlands､ unto me, And give ear､ ye peoples afar off,— Yahweh called me from my birth, From my nativity made he mention of my name;

content: 2 And he made my mouth､ like a sharp sword, In the shadow of his hand he concealed me,— And made of me a polished arrow, In his quiver he hid me;
content_old: 2 And he made my mouth､ like a sharp sword, In the shadow of his hand he concealed me,— And made of me a polished arrow, In his quiver he hid me;

content: 3 And said to me My Servant thou art,— Israel in whom I will get myself glory.
content_old: 3 And said to me My Servant thou art,— Israel in whom I will get myself glory.

content: 4 But I said, To no purpose have I toiled, For waste and mist—my vigour have I spent,— Surely my vindication is with Yahweh, And my recompence with my God.
content_old: 4 But I said, To no purpose have I toiled, For waste and mist—my vigour have I spent,— Surely my vindication is with Yahweh, And my recompence with my God.

content: 5 Now therefore､ said Yahweh— Fashioning me from birth To be Servant to him, To restore Jacob unto him, And that Israel unto him might be gathered､ And I be honourable in the eyes of Yahweh, And my God be proved to have been my strength
content_old: 5 Now therefore､ said Yahweh— Fashioning me from birth To be Servant to him, To restore Jacob unto him, And that Israel unto him might be gathered､ And I be honourable in the eyes of Yahweh, And my God be proved to have been my strength

content: 6 Yea he said— It is too small a thing､ for being my Servant､ That thou shouldest raise up the tribes of Jacob, And the preserved of Israel shouldst restore,— So I will give thee to become a light of nations, That my salvation may reach as far as the end of the earth.
content_old: 6 Yea he said— It is too small a thing､ for being my Servant､ That thou shouldest raise up the tribes of Jacob, And the preserved of Israel shouldst restore,— So I will give thee to become a light of nations, That my salvation may reach as far as the end of the earth.

content: 7 Thus saith Yahweh—the Redeemer of Israel､ his Holy One､ To him that is despised of the soul､ To the abhorred of the nation､ To the servant of rulers Kings shall see and arise, Princes lo! they have bowed themselves down,— Because of Yahweh､ who is faithful, The Holy One of Israel､ lo! he hath chosen thee.
content_old: 7 Thus saith Yahweh—the Redeemer of Israel､ his Holy One､ To him that is despised of the soul､ To the abhorred of the nation､ To the servant of rulers Kings shall see and arise, Princes lo! they have bowed themselves down,— Because of Yahweh､ who is faithful, The Holy One of Israel､ lo! he hath chosen thee.

content: 8 Thus saith Yahweh— In a time of acceptance have I answered thee, In a day of salvation have I helped thee,— That I may preserve thee､ And give thee as the covenant of a people, To establish the land, To bring into possession the desolate heritages;
content_old: 8 Thus saith Yahweh— In a time of acceptance have I answered thee, In a day of salvation have I helped thee,— That I may preserve thee､ And give thee as the covenant of a people, To establish the land, To bring into possession the desolate heritages;

content: 9 Saying To them who are bound､ Go forth, To them who are in darkness､ Shew yourselves,— By the roads shall they graze, And on all bare places shall be their pasture:
content_old: 9 Saying To them who are bound､ Go forth, To them who are in darkness､ Shew yourselves,— By the roads shall they graze, And on all bare places shall be their pasture:

content: 10 They shall neither hunger､ nor thirst, Nor shall smite them the glowing sand､ or the glaring sun,— For he that hath compassion upon them will lead them, And unto springs of water will he conduct them.
content_old: 10 They shall neither hunger､ nor thirst, Nor shall smite them the glowing sand､ or the glaring sun,— For he that hath compassion upon them will lead them, And unto springs of water will he conduct them.

content: 11 Then will I make of all my mountains､ a road, And my highways shall be upraised.
content_old: 11 Then will I make of all my mountains､ a road, And my highways shall be upraised.

content: 12 Lo! these from afar shall come in,— And lo! these from the North and from the West, And these from the land of Sinim.
content_old: 12 Lo! these from afar shall come in,— And lo! these from the North and from the West, And these from the land of Sinim.

content: 13 Shout in triumph—O heavens! And exult—O earth! And break forth､ ye mountains､ into shouts of triumph,— For Yahweh hath comforted his people, And on his humbled ones taketh he compassion.
content_old: 13 Shout in triumph—O heavens! And exult—O earth! And break forth､ ye mountains､ into shouts of triumph,— For Yahweh hath comforted his people, And on his humbled ones taketh he compassion.

content: 14 But Zion had said､ Yahweh hath forsaken me,— Even My Lord hath forgotten me!
content_old: 14 But Zion had said､ Yahweh hath forsaken me,— Even My Lord hath forgotten me!

content: 15 Can a woman forget her sucking child, Past taking compassion on the son of her womb? Even these may forget, Yet will I not forget thee:
content_old: 15 Can a woman forget her sucking child, Past taking compassion on the son of her womb? Even these may forget, Yet will I not forget thee:

content: 16 Lo! on the palms of my hands have I portrayed thee,— Thy walls are before me continually.
content_old: 16 Lo! on the palms of my hands have I portrayed thee,— Thy walls are before me continually.

content: 17 In haste are thy sons,— They who have been tearing thee down and laying thee waste out of thee let them go forth!
content_old: 17 In haste are thy sons,— They who have been tearing thee down and laying thee waste out of thee let them go forth!

content: 18 Lift up､ round about､ thine eyes､ and see, All those have gathered themselves together—have come to thee! As I live Declareth Yahweh,— Surely all those—as an ornament shalt thou put on, And bind them about thee for a girdle､ as a bride.
content_old: 18 Lift up､ round about､ thine eyes､ and see, All those have gathered themselves together—have come to thee! As I live Declareth Yahweh,— Surely all those—as an ornament shalt thou put on, And bind them about thee for a girdle､ as a bride.

content: 19 Surely as for thy wastes､ and thy desolations, and thy land of ruins Surely now shalt thou be too strait for thine inhabitants, And far off shall be they who have been swallowing thee up.
content_old: 19 Surely as for thy wastes､ and thy desolations, and thy land of ruins Surely now shalt thou be too strait for thine inhabitants, And far off shall be they who have been swallowing thee up.

content: 20 The children of whom thou wast bereaved shall yet say in thine ears,— Too strait for me is the place､ Make room for me､ that I may settle down.
content_old: 20 The children of whom thou wast bereaved shall yet say in thine ears,— Too strait for me is the place､ Make room for me､ that I may settle down.

content: 21 Then shalt thou say in thy heart,— Who hath borne me these, Seeing I have been bereaved､ and unfruitful, a captive and banished? These therefore, who hath brought them up? Lo! I was left alone, These where were they?
content_old: 21 Then shalt thou say in thy heart,— Who hath borne me these, Seeing I have been bereaved､ and unfruitful, a captive and banished? These therefore, who hath brought them up? Lo! I was left alone, These where were they?

content: 22 Thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh— Lo! I will lift up､ unto nations､ my hand, Yea unto peoples will I raise high my banner,— And they shall bring in thy sons in their bosom, And thy daughters on the shoulder shall be borne;
content_old: 22 Thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh— Lo! I will lift up､ unto nations､ my hand, Yea unto peoples will I raise high my banner,— And they shall bring in thy sons in their bosom, And thy daughters on the shoulder shall be borne;

content: 23 And kings shall be thy foster-fathers､ And their queens thy nursing mothers, With face to the ground shall they bow down to thee, The dust of thy feet shall they lick,— So shalt thou know that I am Yahweh, In that they shall not be put to shame Who were waiting for me.
content_old: 23 And kings shall be thy foster-fathers､ And their queens thy nursing mothers, With face to the ground shall they bow down to thee, The dust of thy feet shall they lick,— So shalt thou know that I am Yahweh, In that they shall not be put to shame Who were waiting for me.

content: 24 Shall prey be taken from a mighty one? Or the captive of one in the right be delivered?
content_old: 24 Shall prey be taken from a mighty one? Or the captive of one in the right be delivered?

content: 25 Surely thus saith Yahweh— Even the captive of the mighty one shall be taken away, And the prey of the tyrant be delivered; And thine opposers I will oppose, And thy children I will save;
content_old: 25 Surely thus saith Yahweh— Even the captive of the mighty one shall be taken away, And the prey of the tyrant be delivered; And thine opposers I will oppose, And thy children I will save;

content: 1 Thus saith Yahweh— Where then is the scroll of your mother’s divorce､ whom I have put away? Or which of my creditors is it､ to whom I have sold you? Lo! for your iniquities have ye been sold, And for your transgressions hath your mother been put away.
content_old: 1 Thus saith Yahweh— Where then is the scroll of your mother’s divorce､ whom I have put away? Or which of my creditors is it､ to whom I have sold you? Lo! for your iniquities have ye been sold, And for your transgressions hath your mother been put away.

content: 2 Wherefore When I came in was there no one? When I called was there none to answer? Is mine own hand really shortened that it cannot redeem? Or is there not in me strength､ to deliver? Lo! by my rebuke I dry up the sea､ I make rivers a desert, Their fish Stinketh､ for want of water, Yea dieth､ for thirst:
content_old: 2 Wherefore When I came in was there no one? When I called was there none to answer? Is mine own hand really shortened that it cannot redeem? Or is there not in me strength､ to deliver? Lo! by my rebuke I dry up the sea､ I make rivers a desert, Their fish Stinketh､ for want of water, Yea dieth､ for thirst:

content: 3 I clothe the heavens with gloom, And of sackcloth make I their covering.
content_old: 3 I clothe the heavens with gloom, And of sackcloth make I their covering.

content: 4 My Lord､ Yahweh hath given unto me the tongue of the instructed, That I should know how to succour the fainting､ with discourse,— He kept wakening—morning by morning､ He kept wakening mine ear, to hearken as do the instructed;
content_old: 4 My Lord､ Yahweh hath given unto me the tongue of the instructed, That I should know how to succour the fainting､ with discourse,— He kept wakening—morning by morning､ He kept wakening mine ear, to hearken as do the instructed;

content: 5 My Lord､ Yahweh opened mine ear, And I was not rebellious,— Away turned I not:
content_old: 5 My Lord､ Yahweh opened mine ear, And I was not rebellious,— Away turned I not:

content: 6 My back gave I to smiters, and My cheeks to them who pulled out the beard,— My face hid I not from insult and spitting.
content_old: 6 My back gave I to smiters, and My cheeks to them who pulled out the beard,— My face hid I not from insult and spitting.

content: 7 Because My Lord､ Yahweh would help me Therefore was I not deterred by insult,— Therefore did I set my face like flint, And I knew that I should not be put to shame.
content_old: 7 Because My Lord､ Yahweh would help me Therefore was I not deterred by insult,— Therefore did I set my face like flint, And I knew that I should not be put to shame.

content: 8 At hand is one who can justify me, Who will contend with me? let us stand forth together,— Who can accuse me? let him draw near to me!
content_old: 8 At hand is one who can justify me, Who will contend with me? let us stand forth together,— Who can accuse me? let him draw near to me!

content: 9 Lo! My Lord､ Yahweh will help me, Who is he that shall prove me lawless? Lo! they all as a garment shall fall to pieces, The moth shall consume them.
content_old: 9 Lo! My Lord､ Yahweh will help me, Who is he that shall prove me lawless? Lo! they all as a garment shall fall to pieces, The moth shall consume them.

content: 10 Who among you､ revereth Yahweh, Hearkening unto the voice of his Servant,— That hath walked in dark places､ And hath had no gleam of light? Let him trust in the name of Yahweh, And lean upon his God.
content_old: 10 Who among you､ revereth Yahweh, Hearkening unto the voice of his Servant,— That hath walked in dark places､ And hath had no gleam of light? Let him trust in the name of Yahweh, And lean upon his God.

content: 1 Hearken unto me､ Ye that pursue righteousness､ Ye that seek Yahweh,— Look well unto the rock whence ye were hewn, And unto the quarry whence ye were digged:
content_old: 1 Hearken unto me､ Ye that pursue righteousness､ Ye that seek Yahweh,— Look well unto the rock whence ye were hewn, And unto the quarry whence ye were digged:

content: 2 Look well unto Abraham your father, And unto Sarah who gave you birth,— For he was alone when called I him, And I blessed him､ that I might make him many.
content_old: 2 Look well unto Abraham your father, And unto Sarah who gave you birth,— For he was alone when called I him, And I blessed him､ that I might make him many.

content: 3 For Yahweh hath comforted Zion､ He hath comforted all her waste places, And hath made her wilderness like Eden, And her waste plain like the garden of Yahweh,— Joy and gladness shall be found in her, Thanksgiving､ and the voice of melody.
content_old: 3 For Yahweh hath comforted Zion､ He hath comforted all her waste places, And hath made her wilderness like Eden, And her waste plain like the garden of Yahweh,— Joy and gladness shall be found in her, Thanksgiving､ and the voice of melody.

content: 4 Attend unto me､ O my people, And O my nation unto me give ear,— For instruction from me shall go forth, And my justice—for a light of peoples will I establish:
content_old: 4 Attend unto me､ O my people, And O my nation unto me give ear,— For instruction from me shall go forth, And my justice—for a light of peoples will I establish:

content: 5 At hand is my righteousness､ Gone forth hath my salvation, And mine own arms unto the peoples shall give justice,— Upon me Coastlands shall wait, And for mine arm shall they hope.
