content_old: 5 At hand is my righteousness､ Gone forth hath my salvation, And mine own arms unto the peoples shall give justice,— Upon me Coastlands shall wait, And for mine arm shall they hope.

content: 6 Lift up—to the heavens—your eyes､ And look around to the earth beneath､ Though the heavens like smoke should have vanished､ And the earth like a garment should fall to pieces, And her inhabitants in like manner should die′ Yet my salvation unto times age-abiding shall continue, And my righteousness shall not be broken down.
content_old: 6 Lift up—to the heavens—your eyes､ And look around to the earth beneath､ Though the heavens like smoke should have vanished､ And the earth like a garment should fall to pieces, And her inhabitants in like manner should die′ Yet my salvation unto times age-abiding shall continue, And my righteousness shall not be broken down.

content: 7 Hearken unto me､ ye who discern righteousness, The people in whose heart is my law,— Do not fear the reproach of frail men, Nor at their revilings be dismayed;
content_old: 7 Hearken unto me､ ye who discern righteousness, The people in whose heart is my law,— Do not fear the reproach of frail men, Nor at their revilings be dismayed;

content: 8 For like a garment shall they be eaten of the moth, And like wool shall they be eaten of the larva; But my righteousness unto times age-abiding shall continue, And my salvation unto the remotest generation.
content_old: 8 For like a garment shall they be eaten of the moth, And like wool shall they be eaten of the larva; But my righteousness unto times age-abiding shall continue, And my salvation unto the remotest generation.

content: 9 Awake､ awake､ put on strength､ O arm of Yahweh, Awake､ As in days of old, The generations of bygone ages: Art not thou that which— Hewed down Rahab､ Piercing the Crocodile?
content_old: 9 Awake､ awake､ put on strength､ O arm of Yahweh, Awake､ As in days of old, The generations of bygone ages: Art not thou that which— Hewed down Rahab､ Piercing the Crocodile?

content: 10 Art not thou that which dried up— The Sea, The waters of the mighty Deep,— That which made of the abysses of the sea a road for the passing over of the redeemed?
content_old: 10 Art not thou that which dried up— The Sea, The waters of the mighty Deep,— That which made of the abysses of the sea a road for the passing over of the redeemed?

content: 11 Therefore the ransomed of Yahweh shall again come unto Zion､ with shouts of triumph, With gladness age-abiding on their head,— Joy and gladness shall overtake them ､ Sorrow and sighing have fled away.
content_old: 11 Therefore the ransomed of Yahweh shall again come unto Zion､ with shouts of triumph, With gladness age-abiding on their head,— Joy and gladness shall overtake them ､ Sorrow and sighing have fled away.

content: 12 I—I am he that comforteth you,— Who art thou that thou hast feared Frail man that dieth, and A son of the earthborn who as grass shall be delivered up?
content_old: 12 I—I am he that comforteth you,— Who art thou that thou hast feared Frail man that dieth, and A son of the earthborn who as grass shall be delivered up?

content: 13 That thou hast forgotten Yahweh thy maker､ Who stretched out the heavens､ And founded the earth? That thou hast dreaded continually､ all the day､ by reason of the fury of the oppressor, in that he was ready to destroy? Where then､ is the fury of the oppressor?
content_old: 13 That thou hast forgotten Yahweh thy maker､ Who stretched out the heavens､ And founded the earth? That thou hast dreaded continually､ all the day､ by reason of the fury of the oppressor, in that he was ready to destroy? Where then､ is the fury of the oppressor?

content: 14 The captive hath hastened to be loosed,— That he might not die in the pit､ Neither should his bread be cut off.
content_old: 14 The captive hath hastened to be loosed,— That he might not die in the pit､ Neither should his bread be cut off.

content: 15 But I—Yahweh am thy God, Who threw into commotion the sea､ And the waves thereof roared,— Yahweh of hosts is his name.
content_old: 15 But I—Yahweh am thy God, Who threw into commotion the sea､ And the waves thereof roared,— Yahweh of hosts is his name.

content: 16 Therefore have I put my words in thy mouth, And with the shadow of my hand have I covered thee,— To plant the heavens､ and To lay the foundations of the earth, and To say unto Zion､ My people thou art!
content_old: 16 Therefore have I put my words in thy mouth, And with the shadow of my hand have I covered thee,— To plant the heavens､ and To lay the foundations of the earth, and To say unto Zion､ My people thou art!

content: 17 Rouse thee—rouse thee､ stand up､ O Jerusalem, Who hast drunk､ at the hand of Yahweh､ his cup of indignation: The goblet-cup of confusion hast thou drunk—hast thou drained.
content_old: 17 Rouse thee—rouse thee､ stand up､ O Jerusalem, Who hast drunk､ at the hand of Yahweh､ his cup of indignation: The goblet-cup of confusion hast thou drunk—hast thou drained.

content: 18 There is none to guide her, Among all the sons she hath borne,— There is none to grasp her hand, Among all the sons she hath brought up.
content_old: 18 There is none to guide her, Among all the sons she hath borne,— There is none to grasp her hand, Among all the sons she hath brought up.

content: 19 Twain are the things befalling thee, Who will lament for thee? Wasting and destruction､ and famine and sword､ By whom shall I comfort thee?
content_old: 19 Twain are the things befalling thee, Who will lament for thee? Wasting and destruction､ and famine and sword､ By whom shall I comfort thee?

content: 20 Thy sons have fainted､ They lie at the head of all the streets､ like a gazelle in a net,— Who､ indeed､ are full of The indignation of Yahweh､ The rebuke of thy God.
content_old: 20 Thy sons have fainted､ They lie at the head of all the streets､ like a gazelle in a net,— Who､ indeed､ are full of The indignation of Yahweh､ The rebuke of thy God.

content: 21 Therefore hear､ I pray thee､ this､ thou humbled one,— And drunken､ but not with wine:—
content_old: 21 Therefore hear､ I pray thee､ this､ thou humbled one,— And drunken､ but not with wine:—

content: 22 Thus saith Thy Lord Yahweh､ Even thy God who pleadeth the cause of his people:��� Lo! I have taken､ out of thy hand the cup of confusion,— As for the goblet-cup of mine indignation Thou shalt not again drink it､ any more;
content_old: 22 Thus saith Thy Lord Yahweh､ Even thy God who pleadeth the cause of his people:��� Lo! I have taken､ out of thy hand the cup of confusion,— As for the goblet-cup of mine indignation Thou shalt not again drink it､ any more;

content: 1 Awake､ awake､ Put on thy strength､ O Zion,— Put on thy beautiful garments､ O Jerusalem—thou holy city, For there shall not again come into thee any more the uncircumcised and unclean.
content_old: 1 Awake､ awake､ Put on thy strength､ O Zion,— Put on thy beautiful garments､ O Jerusalem—thou holy city, For there shall not again come into thee any more the uncircumcised and unclean.

content: 2 Shake thyself from the dust､ arise—sit down､ O Jerusalem,— Loose thyself from the bonds of thy neck, O captive! daughter of Zion!
content_old: 2 Shake thyself from the dust､ arise—sit down､ O Jerusalem,— Loose thyself from the bonds of thy neck, O captive! daughter of Zion!

content: 3 For thus saith Yahweh, For nought ye sold yourselves,— And not with silver shall ye be redeemed.
content_old: 3 For thus saith Yahweh, For nought ye sold yourselves,— And not with silver shall ye be redeemed.

content: 4 For thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh, To Egypt went down my people at first､ to sojourn there,— But Assyria without cause hath oppressed him.
content_old: 4 For thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh, To Egypt went down my people at first､ to sojourn there,— But Assyria without cause hath oppressed him.

content: 5 Now therefore､ what do I here? Demandeth Yahweh. That my people have been taken away for nought? They who rule them do howl､ Declareth Yahweh, And continually—all the day is my Name brought into contempt.
content_old: 5 Now therefore､ what do I here? Demandeth Yahweh. That my people have been taken away for nought? They who rule them do howl､ Declareth Yahweh, And continually—all the day is my Name brought into contempt.

content: 6 Therefore shall my people acknowledge my Name: Therefore in that day shall they acknowledge that I am the same､ even I who am speaking,—Here I am
content_old: 6 Therefore shall my people acknowledge my Name: Therefore in that day shall they acknowledge that I am the same､ even I who am speaking,—Here I am

content: 7 How beautiful､ upon the mountains､ are the feet— Of him That bringeth good tidings､ That publisheth peace､ That bringeth good tidings of blessing､ That publisheth salvation,— That saith unto Zion､ Thy God hath become king.
content_old: 7 How beautiful､ upon the mountains､ are the feet— Of him That bringeth good tidings､ That publisheth peace､ That bringeth good tidings of blessing､ That publisheth salvation,— That saith unto Zion､ Thy God hath become king.

content: 8 The voice of thy watchmen! They have uplifted a voice､ Together do they renew the shout of triumph,— For eye to eye shall they see, When Yahweh returneth to Zion.
content_old: 8 The voice of thy watchmen! They have uplifted a voice､ Together do they renew the shout of triumph,— For eye to eye shall they see, When Yahweh returneth to Zion.

content: 9 Break forth､ shout in triumph､ together, ye waste places of Jerusalem,— For Yahweh Hath comforted his people, Hath redeemed Jerusalem:
content_old: 9 Break forth､ shout in triumph､ together, ye waste places of Jerusalem,— For Yahweh Hath comforted his people, Hath redeemed Jerusalem:

content: 10 Yahweh hath bared his holy arm, in the eyes of all the nations, So shall all the ends of the earth see the salvation of our God.
content_old: 10 Yahweh hath bared his holy arm, in the eyes of all the nations, So shall all the ends of the earth see the salvation of our God.

content: 11 Away! away! come forth from thence!— Nought unclean may ye touch,— Come forth out of her midst, Purify yourselves, ye who are to carry the vessels of Yahweh;
content_old: 11 Away! away! come forth from thence!— Nought unclean may ye touch,— Come forth out of her midst, Purify yourselves, ye who are to carry the vessels of Yahweh;

content: 12 For not in haste shall ye come forth, Nor by flight shall ye journey,— For your van-guard is Yahweh, And your rear-guard the God of Israel.
content_old: 12 For not in haste shall ye come forth, Nor by flight shall ye journey,— For your van-guard is Yahweh, And your rear-guard the God of Israel.

content: 13 Lo! my Servant prospereth,— He riseth､ and is lifted up､ and becometh very high:
content_old: 13 Lo! my Servant prospereth,— He riseth､ and is lifted up､ and becometh very high:

content: 14 The more that Many were amazed at thee So marred､ beyond any man’s､ was his appearance,— And his form､ beyond the sons of men
content_old: 14 The more that Many were amazed at thee So marred､ beyond any man’s､ was his appearance,— And his form､ beyond the sons of men

content: 1 Who believed what we have heard? And the arm of Yahweh to whom was it revealed?
content_old: 1 Who believed what we have heard? And the arm of Yahweh to whom was it revealed?

content: 2 When he came up as a sapling before him､ And as a root-sprout out of dry ground He had neither beauty nor majesty,— When we beheld him there was nothing to behold､ that we should desire him;
content_old: 2 When he came up as a sapling before him､ And as a root-sprout out of dry ground He had neither beauty nor majesty,— When we beheld him there was nothing to behold､ that we should desire him;

content: 3 Despised was he､ and forsaken of men, Man of pains､ and familiar with sickness,— Yea like one from whom the face is hidden Despised､ and we esteemed him not.
content_old: 3 Despised was he､ and forsaken of men, Man of pains､ and familiar with sickness,— Yea like one from whom the face is hidden Despised､ and we esteemed him not.

content: 4 Yet surely our sicknesses he carried, And as for our pains he bare the burden of them,— But we accounted him stricken､ Smitten of God､ and humbled.
content_old: 4 Yet surely our sicknesses he carried, And as for our pains he bare the burden of them,— But we accounted him stricken､ Smitten of God､ and humbled.

content: 5 Yet he was pierced for transgressions that were ours, was crushed for iniquities that were ours,— The chastisement for our well-being was upon him, And by his stripes there is healing for us.
content_old: 5 Yet he was pierced for transgressions that were ours, was crushed for iniquities that were ours,— The chastisement for our well-being was upon him, And by his stripes there is healing for us.

content: 6 We all like sheep had gone astray, Every man—to his way had we turned,— And Yahweh caused to light upon him The guilt of us all.
content_old: 6 We all like sheep had gone astray, Every man—to his way had we turned,— And Yahweh caused to light upon him The guilt of us all.

content: 7 Hard pressed—yet he humbled himself､ Nor opened his mouth— As a lamb to the slaughter is led, And as a sheep before her shearers is dumb— Nor opened his mouth.
content_old: 7 Hard pressed—yet he humbled himself､ Nor opened his mouth— As a lamb to the slaughter is led, And as a sheep before her shearers is dumb— Nor opened his mouth.

content: 8 By constraint and by sentence was he taken away, And of his age who considered That he was cut off out of the land of the living, For my people’s transgression did the stroke fall on him?
content_old: 8 By constraint and by sentence was he taken away, And of his age who considered That he was cut off out of the land of the living, For my people’s transgression did the stroke fall on him?

content: 9 And appointed with lawless men was his grave, And with the wicked his tomb,— Though no violence had he done, Nor was guile in his mouth.
content_old: 9 And appointed with lawless men was his grave, And with the wicked his tomb,— Though no violence had he done, Nor was guile in his mouth.

content: 10 Yet Yahweh purposed to bruise him､ He laid on him sickness:— If his soul become an offering for guilt He shall see a seed､ He shall prolong his days,— And the purpose of Yahweh in his hand shall prosper:
content_old: 10 Yet Yahweh purposed to bruise him､ He laid on him sickness:— If his soul become an offering for guilt He shall see a seed､ He shall prolong his days,— And the purpose of Yahweh in his hand shall prosper:

content: 11 Of the travail of his soul shall he see､ He shall be satisfied with his knowledge, A setting right､ when set right himself shall my Servant win for the Many, Since of their iniquities he taketh the burden.
content_old: 11 Of the travail of his soul shall he see､ He shall be satisfied with his knowledge, A setting right､ when set right himself shall my Servant win for the Many, Since of their iniquities he taketh the burden.

content: 1 Shout in triumph､ O barren one､ Who hadst not borne,— Break forth into shouts of triumph—and trill thy voice､ Who hadst not travailed in birth, For more are the children of the Desolate､ Than the children of Her who had the husband､ Saith Yahweh.
content_old: 1 Shout in triumph､ O barren one､ Who hadst not borne,— Break forth into shouts of triumph—and trill thy voice､ Who hadst not travailed in birth, For more are the children of the Desolate､ Than the children of Her who had the husband､ Saith Yahweh.

content: 2 Enlarge the space of thy tent､ And the curtains of thy habitations let them spread forth､ do not spare,— Lengthen thy cords, And thy tent-pins make thou fast;
content_old: 2 Enlarge the space of thy tent､ And the curtains of thy habitations let them spread forth､ do not spare,— Lengthen thy cords, And thy tent-pins make thou fast;

content: 3 For on the right hand and on the left shalt thou break forth,— And thy seed shall of the nations take possession, And forsaken cities shall they cause to be inhabited.
content_old: 3 For on the right hand and on the left shalt thou break forth,— And thy seed shall of the nations take possession, And forsaken cities shall they cause to be inhabited.

content: 4 Do not fear､ for thou shalt not turn pale, Neither feel disgraced､ for thou shalt not be put to the blush,— For the shame of thy youth shalt thou forget, And the reproach of thy widowhood shalt thou remember no more;
content_old: 4 Do not fear､ for thou shalt not turn pale, Neither feel disgraced､ for thou shalt not be put to the blush,— For the shame of thy youth shalt thou forget, And the reproach of thy widowhood shalt thou remember no more;

content: 5 For thy husband is thy Maker, Yahweh of hosts is his Name,— And thy redeemer the Holy One of Israel, The God of all the earth shall he be called.
content_old: 5 For thy husband is thy Maker, Yahweh of hosts is his Name,— And thy redeemer the Holy One of Israel, The God of all the earth shall he be called.

content: 6 For like a wife forsaken and grieved in spirit hath Yahweh called thee,— Even the wife of youthful days in that thou wast rejected､ Saith thy God.
content_old: 6 For like a wife forsaken and grieved in spirit hath Yahweh called thee,— Even the wife of youthful days in that thou wast rejected､ Saith thy God.

content: 7 For a small moment I forsook thee,— But with abounding compassions do I embrace thee:
content_old: 7 For a small moment I forsook thee,— But with abounding compassions do I embrace thee:

content: 8 In an overflow of vexation I hid my face､ for a moment､ from thee, But with lovingkindness age-abiding have I had compassion on thee,— Saith thy Redeemer､ Yahweh.
content_old: 8 In an overflow of vexation I hid my face､ for a moment､ from thee, But with lovingkindness age-abiding have I had compassion on thee,— Saith thy Redeemer､ Yahweh.

content: 9 For the waters of Noah is this unto me,— As to which I sware that the waters of Noah should not again pass over the earth So have I sworn Not to be vexed with thee､ Nor to rebuke thee.
content_old: 9 For the waters of Noah is this unto me,— As to which I sware that the waters of Noah should not again pass over the earth So have I sworn Not to be vexed with thee､ Nor to rebuke thee.

content: 10 For the mountains may move away, And the hills may be shaken,— But my lovingkindness from thee shall not move away, And my covenant of peace shall not be shaken, Saith he who hath compassion upon thee—Yahweh.
content_old: 10 For the mountains may move away, And the hills may be shaken,— But my lovingkindness from thee shall not move away, And my covenant of peace shall not be shaken, Saith he who hath compassion upon thee—Yahweh.

content: 11 O thou humbled one､ storm-tossed､ uncomforted,— Lo! I am about to set､ in antimony､ thy stones, And will found thee in sapphires;
content_old: 11 O thou humbled one､ storm-tossed､ uncomforted,— Lo! I am about to set､ in antimony､ thy stones, And will found thee in sapphires;

content: 12 And make rubies､ thy battlements, And thy gates､ sparkling stones,— And all thy boundaries､ stones of delight;
content_old: 12 And make rubies､ thy battlements, And thy gates､ sparkling stones,— And all thy boundaries､ stones of delight;

content: 13 And all thy children shall be the instructed of Yahweh,— And great shall be the prosperity of thy children.
content_old: 13 And all thy children shall be the instructed of Yahweh,— And great shall be the prosperity of thy children.

content: 14 In righteousness shalt thou be established,— Be thou far from oppression— But indeed thou shalt not fear, And from crushing calamity— But indeed it shall not come nigh unto thee.
content_old: 14 In righteousness shalt thou be established,— Be thou far from oppression— But indeed thou shalt not fear, And from crushing calamity— But indeed it shall not come nigh unto thee.

content: 15 Lo! they would quarrel with thee—not at all from me,— Whoso hath quarrelled with thee over thee shall fall.
content_old: 15 Lo! they would quarrel with thee—not at all from me,— Whoso hath quarrelled with thee over thee shall fall.

content: 16 Lo! I have created the smith, who bloweth up a fire of coals, And who bringeth forth an instrument for his work,— And I have created the waster to destroy:
content_old: 16 Lo! I have created the smith, who bloweth up a fire of coals, And who bringeth forth an instrument for his work,— And I have created the waster to destroy:

content: 1 Ho! every one that thirsteth! Come ye to the waters, Yea he that hath no money,— Come ye—buy corn､ and eat, Yea come—buy corn without money, And without price wine and milk.
content_old: 1 Ho! every one that thirsteth! Come ye to the waters, Yea he that hath no money,— Come ye—buy corn､ and eat, Yea come—buy corn without money, And without price wine and milk.

content: 2 Wherefore should ye spend Money､ for that which is not bread? Or your labour､ for that which satisfieth not? Keep on hearkening unto me､ And so eat that which is good, And let your soul take exquisite delight in fatness:
content_old: 2 Wherefore should ye spend Money､ for that which is not bread? Or your labour､ for that which satisfieth not? Keep on hearkening unto me､ And so eat that which is good, And let your soul take exquisite delight in fatness:

content: 3 Incline your ear､ and come unto me, Hearken､ That your soul may live,— That I may solemnise for you a covenant age-abiding, The Lovingkindness to David､ well-assured.
content_old: 3 Incline your ear､ and come unto me, Hearken､ That your soul may live,— That I may solemnise for you a covenant age-abiding, The Lovingkindness to David､ well-assured.

content: 4 Lo! As a witness to the peoples have I given him,— As a leader and commander to the peoples:
content_old: 4 Lo! As a witness to the peoples have I given him,— As a leader and commander to the peoples:

content: 5 Lo! A nation thou shalt not know shalt thou call, And a nation which hath not known thee unto thee shall run,— For the sake of Yahweh thy God, And for the Holy One of Israel､ because he hath adorned thee.
content_old: 5 Lo! A nation thou shalt not know shalt thou call, And a nation which hath not known thee unto thee shall run,— For the sake of Yahweh thy God, And for the Holy One of Israel､ because he hath adorned thee.

content: 6 Seek Yahweh､ while he may be found,— Call ye upon him､ while he is near:
content_old: 6 Seek Yahweh､ while he may be found,— Call ye upon him､ while he is near:

content: 7 Let the lawless forsake his way, And the man of iniquity､ his thoughts,— And let him return unto Yahweh､ That he may have compassion upon him, And unto our God､ For he will abundantly pardon.
content_old: 7 Let the lawless forsake his way, And the man of iniquity､ his thoughts,— And let him return unto Yahweh､ That he may have compassion upon him, And unto our God､ For he will abundantly pardon.

content: 8 For my thoughts are not your thoughts, Nor your ways my ways,— Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 8 For my thoughts are not your thoughts, Nor your ways my ways,— Declareth Yahweh.

content: 9 For higher are the heavens than the earth,— So higher are My ways than your ways, and My thoughts than your thoughts.
content_old: 9 For higher are the heavens than the earth,— So higher are My ways than your ways, and My thoughts than your thoughts.

content: 10 For as the rain and the snow descend from the heavens､ And thither do not return, Except they have watered the earth､ And caused it to bring forth and bud,— And given seed to the sower, and bread to the eater
content_old: 10 For as the rain and the snow descend from the heavens､ And thither do not return, Except they have watered the earth､ And caused it to bring forth and bud,— And given seed to the sower, and bread to the eater

content: 11 So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth, It shall not return unto me void,— But shall accomplish that which I please, And shall prosper in that whereunto I have sent it.
content_old: 11 So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth, It shall not return unto me void,— But shall accomplish that which I please, And shall prosper in that whereunto I have sent it.

content: 12 For with gladness shall ye come forth, And in peace shall ye be led,— The mountains and the hills shall break out､ before you､ into shouts of triumph, And all the wild trees shall clap their hands:
content_old: 12 For with gladness shall ye come forth, And in peace shall ye be led,— The mountains and the hills shall break out､ before you､ into shouts of triumph, And all the wild trees shall clap their hands:

content: 1 Thus saith Yahweh, Observe ye justice､ And execute righteousness,— For near is My salvation､ to come in, and My righteousness to be revealed.
content_old: 1 Thus saith Yahweh, Observe ye justice､ And execute righteousness,— For near is My salvation､ to come in, and My righteousness to be revealed.

content: 2 How happy the frail man､ who doeth this! Yea the son of the earth-born who firmly graspeth it! Keeping the sabbath､ lest he profane it, and Keeping his own hand､ from doing any wrong.
content_old: 2 How happy the frail man､ who doeth this! Yea the son of the earth-born who firmly graspeth it! Keeping the sabbath､ lest he profane it, and Keeping his own hand､ from doing any wrong.

content: 3 And let not the son of the foreigner､ who hath joined himself unto Yahweh､ speak’ saying, Yahweh will separate me from his people! Neither let the eunuch say, Lo! I am a tree dried up!
content_old: 3 And let not the son of the foreigner､ who hath joined himself unto Yahweh､ speak’ saying, Yahweh will separate me from his people! Neither let the eunuch say, Lo! I am a tree dried up!

content: 4 For thus saith Yahweh— Of the eunuchs､ Who shall keep my sabbaths, And choose what I delight in,— And lay firm hold on my covenant
content_old: 4 For thus saith Yahweh— Of the eunuchs､ Who shall keep my sabbaths, And choose what I delight in,— And lay firm hold on my covenant

content: 5 That I will give unto them— In my house, And within my walls､ A sign and a name, better than sons and daughters,— A name age-abiding will I give him､ which shall not be cut off.
content_old: 5 That I will give unto them— In my house, And within my walls､ A sign and a name, better than sons and daughters,— A name age-abiding will I give him､ which shall not be cut off.

content: 6 And as for the sons of the foreigner— Who have joined themselves unto Yahweh､ To wait upon him, and To love the name of Yahweh, To become his､ for servants,— Every one who keepeth the sabbath､ lest he profane it, And who layeth firm hold on my covenant
content_old: 6 And as for the sons of the foreigner— Who have joined themselves unto Yahweh､ To wait upon him, and To love the name of Yahweh, To become his､ for servants,— Every one who keepeth the sabbath､ lest he profane it, And who layeth firm hold on my covenant

content: 7 Surely I will bring them into my holy mountain､ And make them joyful in my house of prayer, Their ascending-offerings and their sacrifices being accepted upon mine altar,— For my house a house of prayer shall be called､ for all the peoples!
content_old: 7 Surely I will bring them into my holy mountain､ And make them joyful in my house of prayer, Their ascending-offerings and their sacrifices being accepted upon mine altar,— For my house a house of prayer shall be called､ for all the peoples!

content: 8 Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh, Who is gathering the outcasts of Israel:— Yet others will I gather unto him､ Besides his own gathered ones.
content_old: 8 Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh, Who is gathering the outcasts of Israel:— Yet others will I gather unto him､ Besides his own gathered ones.

content: 9 All ye beasts of the field! come ye､ to devour, All ye beasts in the forest.
content_old: 9 All ye beasts of the field! come ye､ to devour, All ye beasts in the forest.

content: 10 His watchmen are blind､ None of them know, All of them are dumb dogs, they cannot bark,— Dreaming､ sleeping, loving to slumber.
content_old: 10 His watchmen are blind､ None of them know, All of them are dumb dogs, they cannot bark,— Dreaming､ sleeping, loving to slumber.

content: 11 And the dogs are greedy, they know not to be satisfied､ Yea they are shepherds､ who know not to discern,— All of them unto their own way have turned, Every man to his unjust gain､ on every hand:
content_old: 11 And the dogs are greedy, they know not to be satisfied､ Yea they are shepherds､ who know not to discern,— All of them unto their own way have turned, Every man to his unjust gain､ on every hand:

content: 1 The righteous one hath perished, And not a man hath taken it to heart,— Yea the men of lovingkindness have been withdrawn､ No one considering, That from the presence of calamity hath the righteous been withdrawn.
content_old: 1 The righteous one hath perished, And not a man hath taken it to heart,— Yea the men of lovingkindness have been withdrawn､ No one considering, That from the presence of calamity hath the righteous been withdrawn.

content: 2 He entereth into peace, Let them rest upon their couches,— Each one who went on a straight path.
content_old: 2 He entereth into peace, Let them rest upon their couches,— Each one who went on a straight path.

content: 3 But ye … draw near hither､ Ye sons of divination,— Ye seed of an adulterer､ when your mother committed unchastity!
content_old: 3 But ye … draw near hither､ Ye sons of divination,— Ye seed of an adulterer､ when your mother committed unchastity!

content: 4 Against whom would ye disport yourselves? Against whom would ye widen the mouth､ and lengthen the tongue,— Are not ye Children of transgression, A Seed of falsehood.
content_old: 4 Against whom would ye disport yourselves? Against whom would ye widen the mouth､ and lengthen the tongue,— Are not ye Children of transgression, A Seed of falsehood.

content: 5 Who inflame yourselves With the terebinths､ Under every green tree,— Slaying the children In the torrent-valleys, Under the clefts of the crags:
content_old: 5 Who inflame yourselves With the terebinths､ Under every green tree,— Slaying the children In the torrent-valleys, Under the clefts of the crags:

content: 6 Among the smooth stones of the torrent-valley is thy portion, They they are thy lot; Even to them hast thou Poured out a drink-offering､ Caused to ascend a gift. Over these things can I cease to grieve?
content_old: 6 Among the smooth stones of the torrent-valley is thy portion, They they are thy lot; Even to them hast thou Poured out a drink-offering､ Caused to ascend a gift. Over these things can I cease to grieve?

content: 7 On a mountain high and uplifted hast thou set thy couch,— Even thither hast thou gone up､ to offer sacrifice;
content_old: 7 On a mountain high and uplifted hast thou set thy couch,— Even thither hast thou gone up､ to offer sacrifice;

content: 8 And behind the door and the post hast thou set thy symbol, For with another than me hast thou uncovered thyself and gone up— Hast widened thy couch, And hast solemnised for thyself a covenant from them, Thou hast loved their couch､ a sign hast thou seen;
content_old: 8 And behind the door and the post hast thou set thy symbol, For with another than me hast thou uncovered thyself and gone up— Hast widened thy couch, And hast solemnised for thyself a covenant from them, Thou hast loved their couch､ a sign hast thou seen;

content: 9 And hast gone to the king with oil, And hast multiplied thy perfumes,— And hast sent thy messengers afar, And … lowered thyself as far as hades!
content_old: 9 And hast gone to the king with oil, And hast multiplied thy perfumes,— And hast sent thy messengers afar, And … lowered thyself as far as hades!

content: 10 With the length of thy journey thou wast wearied, Thou didst not say､ Hopeless! The reviving of thy power thou didst find, For this cause hast thou not become sick.
content_old: 10 With the length of thy journey thou wast wearied, Thou didst not say､ Hopeless! The reviving of thy power thou didst find, For this cause hast thou not become sick.

content: 11 Whom then hadst thou been anxious about､ and feared､ that thou shouldest speak falsely, When me thou rememberedst not､ caredst not for me? Did not I keep silence､ even from age-past times, Although me thou wouldest not fear?
content_old: 11 Whom then hadst thou been anxious about､ and feared､ that thou shouldest speak falsely, When me thou rememberedst not､ caredst not for me? Did not I keep silence､ even from age-past times, Although me thou wouldest not fear?

content: 12 I will expose thy righteousness,— And thy works—but they will not profit thee!
content_old: 12 I will expose thy righteousness,— And thy works—but they will not profit thee!

content: 13 When thou makest outcry let thy gathered throngs deliver thee! But all of them shall A wind catch up—A breath take away! Whereas he that seeketh refuge in me Shall inherit the land, And possess my holy mountain.
content_old: 13 When thou makest outcry let thy gathered throngs deliver thee! But all of them shall A wind catch up—A breath take away! Whereas he that seeketh refuge in me Shall inherit the land, And possess my holy mountain.

content: 14 And one said— Cast ye up—cast ye up､ prepare ye a way,— Lift the stumbling-block out of the way of my people.
content_old: 14 And one said— Cast ye up—cast ye up､ prepare ye a way,— Lift the stumbling-block out of the way of my people.

content: 15 For thus saith he that is high and lifted up— Inhabiting futurity､ And holy is his name: A high and holy place will I inhabit, Also with the crushed and lowly in spirit, To revive the spirit of the lowly, and To revive the heart of them who are crushed;—
content_old: 15 For thus saith he that is high and lifted up— Inhabiting futurity､ And holy is his name: A high and holy place will I inhabit, Also with the crushed and lowly in spirit, To revive the spirit of the lowly, and To revive the heart of them who are crushed;—

content: 16 For not age-abidingly will I contend, Nor perpetually will I be wroth,— For spirit before me would faint, Even the breathing souls which I had made.
content_old: 16 For not age-abidingly will I contend, Nor perpetually will I be wroth,— For spirit before me would faint, Even the breathing souls which I had made.

content: 17 Because of his iniquitous gain was I wroth—and smote him､ Hiding myself that I might be wroth,— But he went on､ turning aside in the way of his own heart.
content_old: 17 Because of his iniquitous gain was I wroth—and smote him､ Hiding myself that I might be wroth,— But he went on､ turning aside in the way of his own heart.

content: 18 His ways have I beheld､ That I might heal him,— And guide him､ And restore consolations to him､ and to his mourners:
content_old: 18 His ways have I beheld､ That I might heal him,— And guide him､ And restore consolations to him､ and to his mourners:

content: 19 Creating the fruit of the lips— Prosperity! Prosperity! For him that is far off､ and for him that is near､ Saith Yahweh, So should I heal him.
content_old: 19 Creating the fruit of the lips— Prosperity! Prosperity! For him that is far off､ and for him that is near､ Saith Yahweh, So should I heal him.

content: 20 But the lawless are like the sea when tossed,— For rest it cannot! But its waters toss out mire and dirt.
content_old: 20 But the lawless are like the sea when tossed,— For rest it cannot! But its waters toss out mire and dirt.

content: 1 Cry aloud､ do not spare, Like a horn lift high thy voice,— And declare､ To my people､ their transgression, and To the house of Jacob､ their sins.
content_old: 1 Cry aloud､ do not spare, Like a horn lift high thy voice,— And declare､ To my people､ their transgression, and To the house of Jacob､ their sins.

content: 2 Yet me—day by day do they seek, And in the knowledge of my ways they delight,— Like a nation that had done righteousness, And the justice of their God had not forsaken They ask of me the just regulations, In approaching God they delight.
content_old: 2 Yet me—day by day do they seek, And in the knowledge of my ways they delight,— Like a nation that had done righteousness, And the justice of their God had not forsaken They ask of me the just regulations, In approaching God they delight.

content: 3 Wherefore have we Fasted､ and thou hast not seen? Humbled our soul､ and thou wouldst take no note? Lo! in the day of your fast ye take pleasure, But all your toilers ye drive on!
content_old: 3 Wherefore have we Fasted､ and thou hast not seen? Humbled our soul､ and thou wouldst take no note? Lo! in the day of your fast ye take pleasure, But all your toilers ye drive on!

content: 4 Lo! for strife and contention ye fast, And to smite with the fist of lawlessness,— Ye shall not fast as to-day, To cause to be heard､ on high､ your voice!
content_old: 4 Lo! for strife and contention ye fast, And to smite with the fist of lawlessness,— Ye shall not fast as to-day, To cause to be heard､ on high､ your voice!

content: 5 Like this shall the fast be､ that I choose, A day for the son of earth to humble his soul? Is it to bow down､ as a rush､ his head, And sackcloth and ashes to spread out? Is it this thou wilt call a fast, Or a day of acceptance with Yahweh?
content_old: 5 Like this shall the fast be､ that I choose, A day for the son of earth to humble his soul? Is it to bow down､ as a rush､ his head, And sackcloth and ashes to spread out? Is it this thou wilt call a fast, Or a day of acceptance with Yahweh?

content: 6 Is not this the fast that I must ever choose— To unbind the tight cords of lawlessness, To unloose the bands of the yoke,—and To let the crushed go free, and That every yoke ye tear off?
content_old: 6 Is not this the fast that I must ever choose— To unbind the tight cords of lawlessness, To unloose the bands of the yoke,—and To let the crushed go free, and That every yoke ye tear off?

content: 7 Is it not to break､ unto the hungry､ thy bread, And the thrust-out oppressed that thou bring into a home,— When thou seest one naked that thou cover him, And from thine own flesh shalt not hide thyself?
content_old: 7 Is it not to break､ unto the hungry､ thy bread, And the thrust-out oppressed that thou bring into a home,— When thou seest one naked that thou cover him, And from thine own flesh shalt not hide thyself?

content: 8 Then shall break forth､ as the dawn､ thy light, And thy new flesh shall speedily grow,— Then shall go､ before thee､ thy righteousness, The glory of Yahweh shall bring up thy rear:
content_old: 8 Then shall break forth､ as the dawn､ thy light, And thy new flesh shall speedily grow,— Then shall go､ before thee､ thy righteousness, The glory of Yahweh shall bring up thy rear:

content: 9 Then shalt thou Call､ and Yahweh will answer, Cry out､ and he will say､ Behold me! If thou remove､ out of thy midst､ The yoke, The pointing of the finger､ and The speaking of iniquity;
content_old: 9 Then shalt thou Call､ and Yahweh will answer, Cry out､ and he will say､ Behold me! If thou remove､ out of thy midst､ The yoke, The pointing of the finger､ and The speaking of iniquity;

content: 10 And shalt let thine own soul go out to the hungry, And the soul of the oppressed thou shalt satisfy Then shall break forth､ in darkness､ thy light, And thy thick darkness become as the splendour of noon;
content_old: 10 And shalt let thine own soul go out to the hungry, And the soul of the oppressed thou shalt satisfy Then shall break forth､ in darkness､ thy light, And thy thick darkness become as the splendour of noon;

content: 11 Then will Yahweh guide thee continually, And will satisfy､ even in Scorched regions､ thine own soul, Yea thy very bones will he invigorate,— So shalt thou become､ like a garden wellwatered, And like a spring of water､ whose waters do not deceive;
content_old: 11 Then will Yahweh guide thee continually, And will satisfy､ even in Scorched regions､ thine own soul, Yea thy very bones will he invigorate,— So shalt thou become､ like a garden wellwatered, And like a spring of water､ whose waters do not deceive;

content: 12 And they who come of thee shall build the wastes of age-past times, And as for the foundations of generation after generation thou shalt rear them up,— So shalt thou be called— A Repairer of broken walls, A Restorer of paths leading home.
content_old: 12 And they who come of thee shall build the wastes of age-past times, And as for the foundations of generation after generation thou shalt rear them up,— So shalt thou be called— A Repairer of broken walls, A Restorer of paths leading home.

content: 13 If thou turn back､ From the sabbath､ thy foot, From doing thine own pleasure､ on my holy day,— And shalt call— The sabbath､ An exquisite delight, The holy day of Yahweh､ A day to be honoured, And so shalt honour it､ rather— Than do thine own ways, Than take thine own pleasure､ or Than speak thine own word
content_old: 13 If thou turn back､ From the sabbath､ thy foot, From doing thine own pleasure､ on my holy day,— And shalt call— The sabbath､ An exquisite delight, The holy day of Yahweh､ A day to be honoured, And so shalt honour it､ rather— Than do thine own ways, Than take thine own pleasure､ or Than speak thine own word

content: 1 Lo! the hand of Yahweh is not too short to save,— Neither is his ear too heavy to hear.
content_old: 1 Lo! the hand of Yahweh is not too short to save,— Neither is his ear too heavy to hear.

content: 2 But your iniquities have become separators betwixt you and your God, And your sins have caused a hiding of face from you､ that he shouldnot hear.
content_old: 2 But your iniquities have become separators betwixt you and your God, And your sins have caused a hiding of face from you､ that he shouldnot hear.

content: 3 For your hands are defiled with blood, And your fingers with iniquity,— Your lips have spoken falsehood, and Your tongue muttereth perversity.
content_old: 3 For your hands are defiled with blood, And your fingers with iniquity,— Your lips have spoken falsehood, and Your tongue muttereth perversity.

content: 4 None sueth in righteousness, and None pleadeth in faithfulness,— Men are trusting in confusion､ And speaking vanity, Conceiving wickedness､ And bringing forth iniquity:
content_old: 4 None sueth in righteousness, and None pleadeth in faithfulness,— Men are trusting in confusion､ And speaking vanity, Conceiving wickedness､ And bringing forth iniquity:

content: 5 Viper’s eggs do they hatch, Spider’s threads do they weave,— He that eateth of their eggs dieth, And that which is crushed bringeth forth an adder;
content_old: 5 Viper’s eggs do they hatch, Spider’s threads do they weave,— He that eateth of their eggs dieth, And that which is crushed bringeth forth an adder;

content: 6 Their threads shall not become a garment, Neither shall they cover themselves with their fabrics,— Their fabrics are fabrics of iniquity, Yea the product of violence is in their hands;
content_old: 6 Their threads shall not become a garment, Neither shall they cover themselves with their fabrics,— Their fabrics are fabrics of iniquity, Yea the product of violence is in their hands;

content: 7 Their feet to mischief do run, And they speed to shed innocent blood,— Their devices are devices of iniquity, Wasting and destruction are in their high roads;
content_old: 7 Their feet to mischief do run, And they speed to shed innocent blood,— Their devices are devices of iniquity, Wasting and destruction are in their high roads;

content: 8 The way of well-being have they not known, And there is no justice in their tracks,— Their paths have they made crooked for themselves, None who treadeth therein knoweth wellbeing.
content_old: 8 The way of well-being have they not known, And there is no justice in their tracks,— Their paths have they made crooked for themselves, None who treadeth therein knoweth wellbeing.

content: 9 For this cause hath justice removed far from us, And righteousness overtaketh us not,— We wait for light､ But lo! darkness, For brightness､ In thick darkness we walk:
content_old: 9 For this cause hath justice removed far from us, And righteousness overtaketh us not,— We wait for light､ But lo! darkness, For brightness､ In thick darkness we walk:

content: 10 We grope､ as blind men､ for a wall, Yea as men without eyes do we grope,— We have stumbled､ at broad noon､ as though it were twilight, In desolate places､ like the dead!
content_old: 10 We grope､ as blind men､ for a wall, Yea as men without eyes do we grope,— We have stumbled､ at broad noon､ as though it were twilight, In desolate places､ like the dead!

content: 11 We growl like bears､ all of us, And like doves do we mournfully coo,— We wait For justice､ and there is none, For salvation､ it is far from us!
content_old: 11 We growl like bears､ all of us, And like doves do we mournfully coo,— We wait For justice､ and there is none, For salvation､ it is far from us!

content: 12 For our transgressions have multiplied before thee, And our sins have witnessed against us,— For our transgressions are with us, And as for our iniquities we acknowledge them:
content_old: 12 For our transgressions have multiplied before thee, And our sins have witnessed against us,— For our transgressions are with us, And as for our iniquities we acknowledge them:

content: 13 Transgressing､ and denying Yahweh, And turning away from following our God,— Speaking oppression and revolt, Conceiving､ and muttering from the heart､ words of falsehood.
content_old: 13 Transgressing､ and denying Yahweh, And turning away from following our God,— Speaking oppression and revolt, Conceiving､ and muttering from the heart､ words of falsehood.

content: 14 So then there hath been a driving back of justice, And righteousness afar off standeth,— For truth hath stumbled in the broad-way, And right cannot enter;
content_old: 14 So then there hath been a driving back of justice, And righteousness afar off standeth,— For truth hath stumbled in the broad-way, And right cannot enter;

content: 15 And the truth hath been found missing, And he that hath turned away from wrong is liable to be despoiled. And when Yahweh looked Then was it grievous in his eyes､ that there was no justice:
content_old: 15 And the truth hath been found missing, And he that hath turned away from wrong is liable to be despoiled. And when Yahweh looked Then was it grievous in his eyes､ that there was no justice:

content: 16 When he saw that there was no mighty man Then was he astonished､ that there was none to interpose,— So his own arm brought him salvation, And his own righteousness the same upheld him;
content_old: 16 When he saw that there was no mighty man Then was he astonished､ that there was none to interpose,— So his own arm brought him salvation, And his own righteousness the same upheld him;

content: 17 And he put on Righteousness as a coat of mail, And a helmet of victory upon his head,— And he put on the garments of avenging､ for clothing, And wrapped about him､ as a cloak､—jealousy!
content_old: 17 And he put on Righteousness as a coat of mail, And a helmet of victory upon his head,— And he put on the garments of avenging､ for clothing, And wrapped about him､ as a cloak､—jealousy!

content: 18 According to their deeds accordingly will he repay, Indignation to his adversaries, Recompense to his enemies,— To the Coastlands—recompense will he repay:
content_old: 18 According to their deeds accordingly will he repay, Indignation to his adversaries, Recompense to his enemies,— To the Coastlands—recompense will he repay:

content: 19 That they may revere､— From the West､ the name of Yahweh, And from the Rising of the Sun､ his glory. For he will come in like a rushing stream, The breath of Yahweh driving it on;
content_old: 19 That they may revere､— From the West､ the name of Yahweh, And from the Rising of the Sun､ his glory. For he will come in like a rushing stream, The breath of Yahweh driving it on;

content: 20 So shall come in､ for Zion､ a Redeemer, Even for such as are turning from transgression in Jacob,— Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 20 So shall come in､ for Zion､ a Redeemer, Even for such as are turning from transgression in Jacob,— Declareth Yahweh.

content: 1 Arise—shine､ For thy light hath come,— And the glory of Yahweh on thee hath beamed;
content_old: 1 Arise—shine､ For thy light hath come,— And the glory of Yahweh on thee hath beamed;

content: 2 For lo! darkness covereth the earth, And deep gloom the peoples,— But on thee beameth Yahweh, And his glory on thee is seen.
content_old: 2 For lo! darkness covereth the earth, And deep gloom the peoples,— But on thee beameth Yahweh, And his glory on thee is seen.

content: 3 So shall nations come to thy light, And kings､ to the brightness of thy dawning.
content_old: 3 So shall nations come to thy light, And kings､ to the brightness of thy dawning.

content: 4 Lift up—round about—thine eyes､ and see, They all have gathered themselves together—have come to thee,— Thy sons from afar shall come, And thy daughters on the side shall be carried.
content_old: 4 Lift up—round about—thine eyes､ and see, They all have gathered themselves together—have come to thee,— Thy sons from afar shall come, And thy daughters on the side shall be carried.

content: 5 Then shalt thou see､ and be radiant, And thy heart shall throb and be enlarged,— For there shall be turned upon thee the fulness of the sea, The riches of the nations shall come unto thee;
content_old: 5 Then shalt thou see､ and be radiant, And thy heart shall throb and be enlarged,— For there shall be turned upon thee the fulness of the sea, The riches of the nations shall come unto thee;

content: 6 The multitude of camels shall cover thee､ The young camels of Midian and Ephah, All they of Sheba shall come,— Gold and frankincense shall they bring, And the praises of Yahweh shall they joyfully tell:
content_old: 6 The multitude of camels shall cover thee､ The young camels of Midian and Ephah, All they of Sheba shall come,— Gold and frankincense shall they bring, And the praises of Yahweh shall they joyfully tell:

content: 7 All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered unto thee, The rams of Nebaioth shall wait upon thee,— They shall come up､ with acceptance､ on mine altar, And my beautiful house will I adorn.
content_old: 7 All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered unto thee, The rams of Nebaioth shall wait upon thee,— They shall come up､ with acceptance､ on mine altar, And my beautiful house will I adorn.

content: 8 Who are these that､ As a cloud､ do fly? and As doves to their cotes?
content_old: 8 Who are these that､ As a cloud､ do fly? and As doves to their cotes?

content: 9 Surely for me shall Coastlands wait､ And the ships of Tarshish､ first, To bring in thy sons､ from far, Their silver and their gold with them,— Unto the name of Yahweh thy God, And unto the Holy One of Israel､ Because he hath adorned thee.
content_old: 9 Surely for me shall Coastlands wait､ And the ships of Tarshish､ first, To bring in thy sons､ from far, Their silver and their gold with them,— Unto the name of Yahweh thy God, And unto the Holy One of Israel､ Because he hath adorned thee.

content: 10 So shall the sons of the foreigner build thy walls, And their kings shall wait upon thee,— For in my vexation I smote thee, But in my favour have I had compassion upon thee.
content_old: 10 So shall the sons of the foreigner build thy walls, And their kings shall wait upon thee,— For in my vexation I smote thee, But in my favour have I had compassion upon thee.

content: 11 So shall thy gates be open—continually､ Neither day nor night shall they be shut,— That they may bring unto thee the riches of the nations, And their kings be led.
content_old: 11 So shall thy gates be open—continually､ Neither day nor night shall they be shut,— That they may bring unto thee the riches of the nations, And their kings be led.

content: 12 For the nation and the kingdom that will not serve thee shall perish,— Yea the nations shall be utterly wasted.
content_old: 12 For the nation and the kingdom that will not serve thee shall perish,— Yea the nations shall be utterly wasted.

content: 13 The glory of Lebanon unto thee shall come, The fir-tree､ the holm-oak､ and the sherbincedar､ together. To adorn the place of my sanctuary, And the place of my feet will I make glorious.
content_old: 13 The glory of Lebanon unto thee shall come, The fir-tree､ the holm-oak､ and the sherbincedar､ together. To adorn the place of my sanctuary, And the place of my feet will I make glorious.

content: 14 Then shall come unto thee､ bending low､ The sons of them who had humbled thee, Then shall bow down､ unto the soles of thy feet､ All they who had despised thee; And they shall call thee— The city of Yahweh, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 14 Then shall come unto thee､ bending low､ The sons of them who had humbled thee, Then shall bow down､ unto the soles of thy feet､ All they who had despised thee; And they shall call thee— The city of Yahweh, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

content: 15 Instead of thy being forsaken and hated､ so that none used to pass through thee I will make of thee— An excellency age-abiding, The joy of generation after generation.
content_old: 15 Instead of thy being forsaken and hated､ so that none used to pass through thee I will make of thee— An excellency age-abiding, The joy of generation after generation.

content: 16 And thou shalt derive sweet nourishment from the nations, Yea on the bounty of kings shalt thou be sustained,— So shalt thou know— That I､ Yahweh am thy Saviour, and That thy Redeemer is the Mighty One of Jacob.
content_old: 16 And thou shalt derive sweet nourishment from the nations, Yea on the bounty of kings shalt thou be sustained,— So shalt thou know— That I､ Yahweh am thy Saviour, and That thy Redeemer is the Mighty One of Jacob.

content: 17 Instead of bronze I will bring in gold､ and Instead of iron I will bring in silver, and Instead of wood bronze, and Instead of stones iron,— And I will appoint the oversight of thee to Prosperity, And the setting of thy tasks to Righteousness.
content_old: 17 Instead of bronze I will bring in gold､ and Instead of iron I will bring in silver, and Instead of wood bronze, and Instead of stones iron,— And I will appoint the oversight of thee to Prosperity, And the setting of thy tasks to Righteousness.

content: 18 Violence shall no more be heard in thy land, Wasting nor destruction､ within thy boundaries,— But thou shalt call Thy walls Victory, and Thy gates Praise.
content_old: 18 Violence shall no more be heard in thy land, Wasting nor destruction､ within thy boundaries,— But thou shalt call Thy walls Victory, and Thy gates Praise.

content: 19 Thou shalt no more have the sun for light by day, Neither for brightness shall the moon give light unto thee,— But Yahweh shall become thine age-abiding light, And thy God thine adorning:
content_old: 19 Thou shalt no more have the sun for light by day, Neither for brightness shall the moon give light unto thee,— But Yahweh shall become thine age-abiding light, And thy God thine adorning:

content: 20 No more shall go in thy sun, Nor thy moon withdraw itself,— For Yahweh will become to thee､ an age-abiding light, So shall be ended the days of thy mourning.
content_old: 20 No more shall go in thy sun, Nor thy moon withdraw itself,— For Yahweh will become to thee､ an age-abiding light, So shall be ended the days of thy mourning.

content: 21 And thy people shall all of them be righteous, To times age-abiding shall they posses the land,— The sprout of mine own planting､ The work of mine own hands,— That I may get myself glory.
content_old: 21 And thy people shall all of them be righteous, To times age-abiding shall they posses the land,— The sprout of mine own planting､ The work of mine own hands,— That I may get myself glory.

content: 1 The spirit of My Lord Yahweh is upon me,— Because Yahweh Hath anointed me to tell good tidings to the oppressed､ Hath sent me to bind up the broken-hearted, To proclaim To captives liberty, To them who are bound the opening of the prison;
content_old: 1 The spirit of My Lord Yahweh is upon me,— Because Yahweh Hath anointed me to tell good tidings to the oppressed､ Hath sent me to bind up the broken-hearted, To proclaim To captives liberty, To them who are bound the opening of the prison;

content: 2 To proclaim— The year of acceptance of Yahweh, and The day of avenging of our God: To comfort all who are mourning;
content_old: 2 To proclaim— The year of acceptance of Yahweh, and The day of avenging of our God: To comfort all who are mourning;

content: 3 To appoint unto the mourners of Zion— To give unto them､ A chaplet instead of ashes, The oil of joy instead of mourning, The mantle of praise instead of the spirit of dejection,— So shall they be called､ The oaks of righteousness, The plantation of Yahweh: That he may get himself glory.
content_old: 3 To appoint unto the mourners of Zion— To give unto them､ A chaplet instead of ashes, The oil of joy instead of mourning, The mantle of praise instead of the spirit of dejection,— So shall they be called､ The oaks of righteousness, The plantation of Yahweh: That he may get himself glory.

content: 4 Then shall they build the wastes of a bygone age, The desolations of former times shall they raise up,— And they shall build anew— The cities laid waste, The desolations of generation after generation.
content_old: 4 Then shall they build the wastes of a bygone age, The desolations of former times shall they raise up,— And they shall build anew— The cities laid waste, The desolations of generation after generation.

content: 5 Then shall strangers stay and feed your flocks,— And the sons of the foreigner shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers.
content_old: 5 Then shall strangers stay and feed your flocks,— And the sons of the foreigner shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers.

content: 6 But ye the priests of Yahweh shall be called, The attendants of our God shall ye be named,— The riches of the nations shall ye eat, And in their glory shall ye boast yourselves.
content_old: 6 But ye the priests of Yahweh shall be called, The attendants of our God shall ye be named,— The riches of the nations shall ye eat, And in their glory shall ye boast yourselves.

content: 7 Instead of your shame—double! and Instead of disgrace they shall shout in triumph over their portion,— Therefore in their own land shall they possess double, Joy age-abiding shall be theirs.
content_old: 7 Instead of your shame—double! and Instead of disgrace they shall shout in triumph over their portion,— Therefore in their own land shall they possess double, Joy age-abiding shall be theirs.

content: 8 For I—Yahweh am a lover of justice, Hating plunder､ for an ascending—sacrifice,— Therefore will I give their reward with faithfulness, And an age—abiding covenant will I solemnise for them.
content_old: 8 For I—Yahweh am a lover of justice, Hating plunder､ for an ascending—sacrifice,— Therefore will I give their reward with faithfulness, And an age—abiding covenant will I solemnise for them.

content: 9 Then shall be known among the nations their seed, And their offspring in the midst of the peoples,— All who see them shall acknowledge them, That they are the seed that Yahweh hath blessed.
content_old: 9 Then shall be known among the nations their seed, And their offspring in the midst of the peoples,— All who see them shall acknowledge them, That they are the seed that Yahweh hath blessed.

content: 10 I will greatly rejoice in Yahweh､ My soul shall exult in my God, For he hath clothed me､ with the garments of salvation, With a robe of righteousness hath he enwrapt me,— As a bridegroom adorneth himself with a chaplet, And as a bride bedecketh herself with her jewels.
content_old: 10 I will greatly rejoice in Yahweh､ My soul shall exult in my God, For he hath clothed me､ with the garments of salvation, With a robe of righteousness hath he enwrapt me,— As a bridegroom adorneth himself with a chaplet, And as a bride bedecketh herself with her jewels.

content: 1 For Zion’s sake will I not hold my peace, And for Jerusalem’s sake will I not rest,— Until her righteousness go forth as brightness, And her salvation as a torch that is lighted.
content_old: 1 For Zion’s sake will I not hold my peace, And for Jerusalem’s sake will I not rest,— Until her righteousness go forth as brightness, And her salvation as a torch that is lighted.

content: 2 So shall nations see thy righteousness, And all kings､ thy glory; And thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of Yahweh will name.
content_old: 2 So shall nations see thy righteousness, And all kings､ thy glory; And thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of Yahweh will name.

content: 3 Then shalt thou become— A crown of adorning､ in the hand of Yahweh, and A royal diadem､ in the hand of thy God.
content_old: 3 Then shalt thou become— A crown of adorning､ in the hand of Yahweh, and A royal diadem､ in the hand of thy God.

content: 4 Thou shalt be termed no longer— Forsaken､ Nor shall thy land be termed any longer､ A desolation, But thou shalt be called､ Hephzibah , And thy land､ Beulah ,— For Yahweh hath found delight in thee, And thy land shall be married.
content_old: 4 Thou shalt be termed no longer— Forsaken､ Nor shall thy land be termed any longer､ A desolation, But thou shalt be called､ Hephzibah , And thy land､ Beulah ,— For Yahweh hath found delight in thee, And thy land shall be married.

content: 5 For a young man marrieth a virgin, Thy sons marry thee! And the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride— Thy God rejoiceth over thee.
content_old: 5 For a young man marrieth a virgin, Thy sons marry thee! And the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride— Thy God rejoiceth over thee.

content: 6 Upon thy walls､ O Jerusalem have I appointed watchmen, All the day and all the night through let them not hold their peace,— O ye that put Yahweh in mind, Do not take rest to yourselves,
content_old: 6 Upon thy walls､ O Jerusalem have I appointed watchmen, All the day and all the night through let them not hold their peace,— O ye that put Yahweh in mind, Do not take rest to yourselves,

content: 7 Neither give rest unto him, Until he establish､ and until he set forth Jerusalem､ as a praise in the earth!
content_old: 7 Neither give rest unto him, Until he establish､ and until he set forth Jerusalem､ as a praise in the earth!

content: 8 Sworn hath Yahweh— By his own right hand, and By his own strong arm,— Surely I will give thy corn､ no more､ as food to thine enemies, Nor shall the sons of the foreigner drink thy new wine, for which thou hast toiled;
content_old: 8 Sworn hath Yahweh— By his own right hand, and By his own strong arm,— Surely I will give thy corn､ no more､ as food to thine enemies, Nor shall the sons of the foreigner drink thy new wine, for which thou hast toiled;

content: 9 But they who have garnered it shall eat it, and praise Yahweh,— And they who have gathered in its clusters shall drink it､ in my holy courts.
content_old: 9 But they who have garnered it shall eat it, and praise Yahweh,— And they who have gathered in its clusters shall drink it､ in my holy courts.

content: 10 Pass ye through､ pass ye through the gates, Prepare ye the way of the people,— Cast ye up､ cast ye up the highway, Clear it of stones, Lift ye high a standard unto the peoples.
content_old: 10 Pass ye through､ pass ye through the gates, Prepare ye the way of the people,— Cast ye up､ cast ye up the highway, Clear it of stones, Lift ye high a standard unto the peoples.

content: 11 Lo! Yahweh hath sent a message unto the end of the earth: Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Lo! thy Salvation is coming,— Lo! his reward is with him, And his recompense before him:
content_old: 11 Lo! Yahweh hath sent a message unto the end of the earth: Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Lo! thy Salvation is coming,— Lo! his reward is with him, And his recompense before him:

content: 1 Who is this coming in from Edom､ With bright-red garments､ from Bozrah? This made splendid in his raiment, Marching on in the greatness of his strength? I speaking in righteousness､ Mighty to save.
content_old: 1 Who is this coming in from Edom､ With bright-red garments､ from Bozrah? This made splendid in his raiment, Marching on in the greatness of his strength? I speaking in righteousness､ Mighty to save.

content: 2 Wherefore is there red､ on thy raiment,— And thy garments､ as of one treading in a wine-trough?
content_old: 2 Wherefore is there red､ on thy raiment,— And thy garments､ as of one treading in a wine-trough?

content: 3 A winepress have I trodden alone､ And of the peoples there was no man with me. So I trod them down､ in mine anger, And trampled upon them､ in mine indignation,— And their life-blood besprinkled my garments, And all mine apparel I defiled;
content_old: 3 A winepress have I trodden alone､ And of the peoples there was no man with me. So I trod them down､ in mine anger, And trampled upon them､ in mine indignation,— And their life-blood besprinkled my garments, And all mine apparel I defiled;

content: 4 For a day of avenging was in my heart, And the year of my redeemed had come.
content_old: 4 For a day of avenging was in my heart, And the year of my redeemed had come.

content: 5 Therefore looked I around､ and there was none to help,— And I was astonished､ that there was none to uphold,— So mine own arm brought me salvation, And mine indignation the same upheld me;
content_old: 5 Therefore looked I around､ and there was none to help,— And I was astonished､ that there was none to uphold,— So mine own arm brought me salvation, And mine indignation the same upheld me;

content: 6 Then trod I down peoples､ in mine anger, And make them drunk､ with mine indignation, And brought down to the earth their life-blood.
content_old: 6 Then trod I down peoples､ in mine anger, And make them drunk､ with mine indignation, And brought down to the earth their life-blood.

content: 7 The lovingkindness of Yahweh will I recall､ The praises of Yahweh, According to all that Yahweh hath bestowed upon us,— Even the abundance of goodness to the house of Israel, Which he bestowed upon them— According to his compassions､ and According to the abundance of his loving-kindness.
content_old: 7 The lovingkindness of Yahweh will I recall､ The praises of Yahweh, According to all that Yahweh hath bestowed upon us,— Even the abundance of goodness to the house of Israel, Which he bestowed upon them— According to his compassions､ and According to the abundance of his loving-kindness.

content: 8 Therefore he said— Surely my people they are, Sons they will not act falsely! So he became theirsaviour.
content_old: 8 Therefore he said— Surely my people they are, Sons they will not act falsely! So he became theirsaviour.

content: 9 In all their affliction he was afflicted､ And the messenger of his presence saved them, In his love and in his pity he redeemed them,— And then lifted them up and carried them､ all the days of the age-past time.
content_old: 9 In all their affliction he was afflicted､ And the messenger of his presence saved them, In his love and in his pity he redeemed them,— And then lifted them up and carried them､ all the days of the age-past time.

content: 10 But they rebelled､ and grieved his Holy Spirit,— And so he turned against them as an enemy､ He himself fought against them.
content_old: 10 But they rebelled､ and grieved his Holy Spirit,— And so he turned against them as an enemy､ He himself fought against them.

content: 11 Then were recalled the days of the age-past time､ Moses—his people:— Where is he that led them up out of the sea､ with the shepherds of his flock? Where is he that put､ within him､ his Holy Spirit?
content_old: 11 Then were recalled the days of the age-past time､ Moses—his people:— Where is he that led them up out of the sea､ with the shepherds of his flock? Where is he that put､ within him､ his Holy Spirit?

content: 12 That caused to go at the right hand of Moses his own majestic arm,— Cleaving the waters from before them. To make himself an age-abiding name:
content_old: 12 That caused to go at the right hand of Moses his own majestic arm,— Cleaving the waters from before them. To make himself an age-abiding name:

content: 13 Causing them to go through the roaring deeps,— Like a horse through the wilderness, That they should not stumble?
content_old: 13 Causing them to go through the roaring deeps,— Like a horse through the wilderness, That they should not stumble?

content: 14 As a beast into the valley goeth down, The Spirit of Yahweh causeth him to rest So didst thou lead thy people, To make thyself a majestic name!
content_old: 14 As a beast into the valley goeth down, The Spirit of Yahweh causeth him to rest So didst thou lead thy people, To make thyself a majestic name!

content: 15 Look thou down､ out of the heavens､ and see, Out of the high abode of thy holiness and of thy majesty,— Where are thy jealousy､ and thy mighty deeds? The resounding of thy yearning affection､ and thy compassions towards me are they restrained?
content_old: 15 Look thou down､ out of the heavens､ and see, Out of the high abode of thy holiness and of thy majesty,— Where are thy jealousy､ and thy mighty deeds? The resounding of thy yearning affection､ and thy compassions towards me are they restrained?

content: 16 For thou art our father, Though Abraham knew us not, And Israel could not acknowledge us,— Thou O Yahweh art our father, Our Redeemer from the Age-past time is thy name.
content_old: 16 For thou art our father, Though Abraham knew us not, And Israel could not acknowledge us,— Thou O Yahweh art our father, Our Redeemer from the Age-past time is thy name.

content: 17 Wherefore shouldst thou suffer us to wander､ O Yahweh､ from thy ways? Wherefore shouldst thou let us harden our heart past revering thee? Return thou､ for the sake of Thy servants, The tribes thou thyself hast inherited.
content_old: 17 Wherefore shouldst thou suffer us to wander､ O Yahweh､ from thy ways? Wherefore shouldst thou let us harden our heart past revering thee? Return thou､ for the sake of Thy servants, The tribes thou thyself hast inherited.

content: 18 For a short time only did thy holy people hold possession,— Our adversaries trod down thy sanctuary!
content_old: 18 For a short time only did thy holy people hold possession,— Our adversaries trod down thy sanctuary!

content: 1 Would that thou hadst rent the heavens､ hadst come down, At thy presence had mountains quaked:
content_old: 1 Would that thou hadst rent the heavens､ hadst come down, At thy presence had mountains quaked:

content: 2 As fire kindleth brushwood､ As fire causeth water to boil So if thou wouldst make known thy Name to thine adversaries At thy presence nations would tremble.
content_old: 2 As fire kindleth brushwood､ As fire causeth water to boil So if thou wouldst make known thy Name to thine adversaries At thy presence nations would tremble.

content: 3 When thou didst fearful things､ we could not expect Thou camest down､ at thy presence mountains quaked.
content_old: 3 When thou didst fearful things､ we could not expect Thou camest down､ at thy presence mountains quaked.

content: 4 Although from age-past times It was never heard､ It was not perceived by the ear,— Neither did the eye ever see— That a god besides thee could work for the man who waited for him
content_old: 4 Although from age-past times It was never heard､ It was not perceived by the ear,— Neither did the eye ever see— That a god besides thee could work for the man who waited for him

content: 5 Yet didst thou meet Him who was rejoicing and working righteousness, Even them who in thy ways remembered thee,— Lo! thou hast been vexed､ And truly we had sinned, Among them was the prospect of an age to come, That we might be saved.
content_old: 5 Yet didst thou meet Him who was rejoicing and working righteousness, Even them who in thy ways remembered thee,— Lo! thou hast been vexed､ And truly we had sinned, Among them was the prospect of an age to come, That we might be saved.

content: 6 But we have become as one unclean all of us, And as a garment polluted were all our righteous doings,— And so we faded like a leaf all of us, And our iniquity as a wind carried us away;
content_old: 6 But we have become as one unclean all of us, And as a garment polluted were all our righteous doings,— And so we faded like a leaf all of us, And our iniquity as a wind carried us away;

content: 7 And there was none To call upon thy Name, To rouse himself to lay firm hold on thee,— For thou hadst hidden thy face from us, And hadst made us despond､ by means of our iniquity.
content_old: 7 And there was none To call upon thy Name, To rouse himself to lay firm hold on thee,— For thou hadst hidden thy face from us, And hadst made us despond､ by means of our iniquity.

content: 8 But now O Yahweh､ our father thou art,— We are the clay, and thou art our potter, Yea the work of thy hand are we all:
content_old: 8 But now O Yahweh､ our father thou art,— We are the clay, and thou art our potter, Yea the work of thy hand are we all:

content: 9 Do not be indignant､ O Yahweh､ so very greatly, Neither perpetually do thou recall iniquity,— Lo! look around､ we pray thee … thy people are we all.
content_old: 9 Do not be indignant､ O Yahweh､ so very greatly, Neither perpetually do thou recall iniquity,— Lo! look around､ we pray thee … thy people are we all.

content: 10 Thy holy cities have become a wilderness,— Zion a wilderness hath become, Jerusalem a desolation!
content_old: 10 Thy holy cities have become a wilderness,— Zion a wilderness hath become, Jerusalem a desolation!

content: 11 Our holy and our beautiful house､ Where our fathers praised thee, Hath become a conflagration,— And all our delightful places are in ruins!
content_old: 11 Our holy and our beautiful house､ Where our fathers praised thee, Hath become a conflagration,— And all our delightful places are in ruins!

content: 1 I have let myself be consulted､ by them who had not asked, I have suffered myself to be found､ by them who had not sought me,— I have said Here I am! Here I am! Unto a nation that had not been called by my name.
content_old: 1 I have let myself be consulted､ by them who had not asked, I have suffered myself to be found､ by them who had not sought me,— I have said Here I am! Here I am! Unto a nation that had not been called by my name.

content: 2 I have spread out my hands､ all the day､ Unto a rebellious people,— Who walk In the way that is not good, After their own devices.
content_old: 2 I have spread out my hands､ all the day､ Unto a rebellious people,— Who walk In the way that is not good, After their own devices.

content: 3 The people who are provoking me to anger､ to my face､ continually,— Sacrificing in gardens, and Burning incense upon bricks;
content_old: 3 The people who are provoking me to anger､ to my face､ continually,— Sacrificing in gardens, and Burning incense upon bricks;

content: 4 Who tarry among graves, And in the secret places do lodge,— Who eat the flesh of swine, And the broth of refuse things is in their vessels,—
content_old: 4 Who tarry among graves, And in the secret places do lodge,— Who eat the flesh of swine, And the broth of refuse things is in their vessels,—

content: 5 Who say— Draw near by thyself､ Do not approach with me､ For I am holier than thou! There are A smoke in my nostrils, A fire burning all the day.
content_old: 5 Who say— Draw near by thyself､ Do not approach with me､ For I am holier than thou! There are A smoke in my nostrils, A fire burning all the day.

content: 6 Lo! it is written before me,— I will not keep silence, But I have recompensed, and will recompense､ into their bosom:
content_old: 6 Lo! it is written before me,— I will not keep silence, But I have recompensed, and will recompense､ into their bosom:

content: 7 Your own iniquities､ And the iniquities of your fathers together､ Saith Yahweh, Who have burned incense upon the mountains, And upon the hills have reproached me,— Therefore will I measure their former work､ into their bosom.
content_old: 7 Your own iniquities､ And the iniquities of your fathers together､ Saith Yahweh, Who have burned incense upon the mountains, And upon the hills have reproached me,— Therefore will I measure their former work､ into their bosom.

content: 8 Thus saith Yahweh— As new wine is found in the cluster, And one saith､ Do not destroy it, for a blessing is in it So will I do for the sake of my servants, That I may not destroy the whole nation;
content_old: 8 Thus saith Yahweh— As new wine is found in the cluster, And one saith､ Do not destroy it, for a blessing is in it So will I do for the sake of my servants, That I may not destroy the whole nation;

content: 9 Therefore will I bring forth Out of Jacob a seed, and Out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains, That my chosen ones may inherit it, And my servants dwell there;
content_old: 9 Therefore will I bring forth Out of Jacob a seed, and Out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains, That my chosen ones may inherit it, And my servants dwell there;

content: 10 Then shall Sharon become a fold forflocks, And the vale of Achor､ for the lying down of herds,— For my people who have sought me.
content_old: 10 Then shall Sharon become a fold forflocks, And the vale of Achor､ for the lying down of herds,— For my people who have sought me.

content: 11 But ye are they— Who forsake Yahweh､ Who forget my holy mountain､— Who prepare､ for Fortune､ a table､ and Who fill､ for Destiny､ mixed wine;
content_old: 11 But ye are they— Who forsake Yahweh､ Who forget my holy mountain､— Who prepare､ for Fortune､ a table､ and Who fill､ for Destiny､ mixed wine;

content: 12 Therefore will I destine you to the sword, And ye all to the slaughter shall bow down. Because I called､ and ye answered not, I spake､ and ye hearkened not,— But did that which was wicked in mine eyes, And of that wherein I delighted not ye made choice
content_old: 12 Therefore will I destine you to the sword, And ye all to the slaughter shall bow down. Because I called､ and ye answered not, I spake､ and ye hearkened not,— But did that which was wicked in mine eyes, And of that wherein I delighted not ye made choice

content: 13 Therefore Thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh,— Lo! my servants shall eat､ but ye shall be famished, Lo! my servants shall drink､ but ye shall be thirsty,— Lo! my servants shall rejoice､ but ye shall turn pale;
content_old: 13 Therefore Thus saith My Lord､ Yahweh,— Lo! my servants shall eat､ but ye shall be famished, Lo! my servants shall drink､ but ye shall be thirsty,— Lo! my servants shall rejoice､ but ye shall turn pale;

content: 14 Lo! my servants shall shout in triumph for mirth of heart､ But ye shall make outcry､ for pain of heart, And for a breaking of spirit shall ye howl.
content_old: 14 Lo! my servants shall shout in triumph for mirth of heart､ But ye shall make outcry､ for pain of heart, And for a breaking of spirit shall ye howl.

content: 15 So shall ye leave your name for an oath, to my chosen ones,— So then My Lord Yahweh will slay thee,— And his servants will he call by another name:
content_old: 15 So shall ye leave your name for an oath, to my chosen ones,— So then My Lord Yahweh will slay thee,— And his servants will he call by another name:

content: 16 So that he who blesseth himself in the earth Will bless himself in the God of faithfulness, And he who sweareth in the earth Will swear by the God of faithfulness,— Because the former troubles have been forgotten, and Because they are hid from mine eyes.
